name: Fake Fishing I
text: Thomas is actually terrible at fishing but wants everybody to think he isn't. So if you give him some fish, he'll give you some materials you can use to craft things.

name: Squirrel Problems I
text: Cecil is dealing with a squirrel problem and needs some acorns to try to lure and trap the squirrels. 200 should be enough. Some boxes would be helpful too.

name: Of Planks and Cannonballs
text: Buddy would like some real cannonballs, instead of all these stones he has piled up. Stones sometimes fall apart in the cannon and make a real mess. He also needs a new plank, to make unwanted guests walk off of. If you can round up some iron to make real cannonballs, and bring him a plank, you can take home his pile of rocks.

name: A Study of Color V
text: George would like to do some painting now of something many might see as mundane color. Brown is the next color for his new masterpiece. Can you round up a bunch of brown objects?

name: Shark Week III
text: Thomas still hasn't caught a shark, but he's not giving up. He decided to use something really different as bait. If you'll bring him a couple of bluegill and some mushroom paste, he'll give you a shark tooth he found on the beach.

name: A Study of Color VI
text: Next, George is working on two similar colors, instead of just one. He needs lots of Yellow and Orange objects. Think you can round up enough to fill up a painting? There is lots of leftover rope from the Brown painting as a reward. George also promises that this maybe, might possibly be the last color he studies. But he isn't 100% sure yet.

name: Shark Week IV
text: Thomas found 2 more shark teeth while he was trying out the new bait you helped him create. He is now convinced that he is on the trail of a massive shark. If you'll bring him more mushroom paste, bones, and feathers, you can have the shark teeth he found.

name: Guest Ledger
text: Buddy would like to keep a list of all of his victims.... erhem.. guests! He gets a lot of guests though, so needs a big pile of books for his records. In exchange, he can hand over this useless old book, already filled with non-important facts, maps and details.

name: An Exchange of Prisoners
text: Buddy is finding it hard to read and write the entries in his guest ledger. He could use a pair of nice shiny spectacles. In exchange, he will hand over his old eye patch, which isn't helping him get the job done anymore.

name: Warning Shots
text: With everything getting organized, Buddy found that his stock of black powder got wet, and has been ruined. How is he supposed to fire his cannons now, to ward off any unwanted tresspassers into his cave? If you can resupply his black powder, he has a nifty flag you can have in exchange.

name: Time is of the Essence
text: Vincent is in a hurry today. He is sure he is late getting somewhere, but how can he be sure? He lost his watch. A terrible thing for a mercenary to admit. If you can replace his pocket watch for him, he will share some of his most delicious breakfast with you.

name: Treasure Chests for Plunder
text: Lots of people come to the Small Cave looking for treasure. Buddy would hate for them to leave being disappointed. So, he wants to bury lots of treasure chests around for people to find. Can you bring him some spare chests to use? He will give you some spare junk he found in return.

name: Observation Logs
text: Cecil is keeping a log of strange phenomena occurring in local areas. He would like to have a separate diary for each of the areas he is investigating. Please bring him a green diary for his forest observations, a leather diary for the hills and mountains, and a purple diary for the small cave.

name: Foraging for Food
text: A mercenary is always traveling, and knowing how to forage for food is very important. If you can bring Vincent some tools, and a diary to keep notes in, he will show you how to find something yummy to spread on your toast.

name: Milk Chugging
text: Holger has heard of the legendary Milk Chugging challenge. Drink a gallon of milk in under an hour? Sounds like child's play to Holger. He would like you to provide a much larger quantity of milk to show how this challenge should be done. He will pay you fair market value for the milk, and even throw in a shiny feather.

It is hot and this place keeps growing! Rosalie has some drinks for you to help you cool off in all this heat. Just give her a couple glass orbs for the trouble. Thanks for being a part of the community!

name: Strange Stones I
text: Beatrix has heard rumors about stones with unique properties. Specifically, she heard about a unique stone somewhere on Mount Banon. Unfortunately, she's never been able to find it. Will you help her find this unique stone?

name: Strange Stones II
text: Beatrix heard about another strange stone from Lorn. He said it's somewhere in the Ember Lagoon area. Beatrix tried to get Lorn to help her find the stone, but he's too busy helping all of the new folks that have come to town. Will you help Beatrix find another strange stone?

name: 200 Patrons!
text: Rosalie was out exploring the small cave and came across a treasure chest full of Gold! She doesn't need all of this Gold, so she wants to share it with you and everybody else around town. If you can bring her some eggplants she'll pay you 20 Gold for the trouble.

name: Strange Stones III
text: Beatrix is still searching for strange stones. Recently, she caught a promising lead from Holger, after emptying her pantry to feed him. Holger said that he found 2 strange stones in Black Rock Canyon, but he doesn't remember where, although he did remember eating beef jerky when he found the stone with 4 runes on it. After searching for several days, Beatrix found the stone with 4 runes on it, but it doesn't react with the other stones you found for her. Can you find the other stone?

name: Strange Stones IV
text: While Beatrix was experimenting with the strange stones yesterday, Thomas stopped by to talk about shark bait ideas. Thomas recognized the stones and said that his parents used to search for a runestone, like the ones Beatrix has, on the Highland Hills. His parents never found it, but they were sure it was out there. Beatrix wants that runestone.

name: Strange Stones V
text: Beatrix got another clue about runestones. Jill said that her family found a few runestones when they grew certain crops when she was a kid. She said that they found one stone among eggplants and another in their cornfield. Beatrix would like you to try harvesting eggplants to see if Jill's tale is true.

name: Strange Stones VI
text: Jill was right! Beatrix would like you to try to get a runestone from harvesting corn now.

name: Thirst for Exploring
text: Holger is going exploring. He's looking for something to carry with him that can hold drinking water, but won't add a lot of weight. It would be great if it was also sturdy, in case he runs into trouble. Holger is also looking for a durable bag to take on his journey.

name: Strange Stones VII
text: Beatrix got another clue. It's secondhand and unverified, but Vincent really believes it. So it should be as good as the clues for the other stones. Vincent heard from a brewer, sometime during his travels, he wouldn't say where, that the secret to his incredible ale was a stone that he found in a bag of hops. Vincent said the ale was easily the best he ever had. Beatrix would like you to try harvesting some hops.

name: Strange Stones VIII
text: A few weeks ago, Beatrix hired a fishing charter for Lake Tempest. She asked the crew about strange stones before they left. A couple of the older hands said that they found a few strange stones on a variety of fishing trips. After a lot of disagreement, Captain Logan suggested the best strategy would be to follow the flow of the water and search the lake, the river, and the ocean. Since then, Beatrix has fished and hired charters every day with no success. Will you try the lake?

name: Strange Stones IX
text: With the addition of that 8th runestone, something strange happened. The runestones started glowing. Beatrix really wants to see if there are any more runestones. Will you try the river?

name: Strange Stones X
text: Nothing changed with the addition of the 9th runestone. Beatrix expected something more to happen, but the stones are just glowing. Beatrix thinks there must be another runestone. Will you try the ocean?

name: Strange Stones Exigent
text: Beatrix is missing. Lorn went to meet her for tea, but she wasn't home. She wasn't home for tea the next day either. He asked around town and searched all her favorite places, but no one has seen her. For the third time, Lorn went to meet Beatrix for tea, but she still wasn't home. So, Lorn searched her house. He found a cracked lava sphere. Lorn thinks Beatrix is now trapped at Lake Minerva. Will you help repair the lava sphere and help find Beatrix?

name: Not-So-Strange Stones
text: Buddy is a little jealous of all the strange stones that Beatrix has been gathering. He would like you to help him grow his own rock collection. He doesn't want those really strange stones though, just lots of the ones he can't find in his cave.

name: You Must Build A Boat V
text: For finishing touches, Vincent suggests a cabin for sleeping and shelter if the weather gets rough. The bed he's suggesting looks to be extremely soft! Hopefully you're almost done.

name: Set Sail for Pirate's Cove
text: Finally, you set sail, Vincent stares darkly at the horizon, which strikes you as odd. Noticing you noticing him, he suggests you play a game of dice while time is on your side...

name: You Must Build A Boat IV
text: With the basics out of the way, Vincent explains that you're going to want a way to steer, and maybe see where you're going. The logic of the situation doesn't escape you either, so you set off to find a few more items. Building a boat is a lot of work...

name: You Must Build A Boat III
text: With the anchor and nets in place, Vincent suggests you may want some things that will keep the boat clean - and some extra storage for supplies. Vincent reminds you that having a clean ship will give you a sense of pride and accomplishment, which is its own reward.

name: Big Boom I
text: Beatrix needs 10 Barrels. The barrels should be large enough to hold at least 10 explosives each.

name: You Must Build A Boat II
text: The boat is taking shape, but you're going to need an anchor, and what boat doesn't look good with nets hanging off the side? Vincent looks tired but determined, and he's much more skilled at crafting than you expected!

name: Pirate's Cove II
text: Vincent, with a gleam in his eye, offers you the opportunity to join him in his adventure. He suggests you bring along some basic items of survival, and he'll provide the rest, for now...

name: You Must Build A Boat I
text: After eating, Vincent tells you that he lost his boat. If you help with materials, he'll help you with building it. You're not quite sure why he didn't mention this first...

name: Pirate's Cove I
text: Vincent, ever the opportunist, tells you he's looking for the Pirate's Cove. He offers you money and promises for riches in exchange for a rune that he thinks may guide him to the cove he seeks.

name: Lost Family Heirloom
text: Buddy claims a family heirloom was recently lost or stolen. He thinks it is a picture of his great-great-great-grandmother trice removed. In any case, it may show up sometime in the flea market for sale. If you can find it for him, he will gladly cover your costs and then some. (Flea Market inventory changes every hour)

name: Bling Things II
text: Rosalie has heard that your Quarry may have found some very rare Jade in it. She would love to add a Jade Charm to her collection of Bling Things. She can hand you some silver, and aged cheese wrapped in a fancy bandana as a reward.

name: Return Our Lost Friend I
text: Lorn appreciates your efforts to try to find Beatrix, but he found a passage in The Book of Places that leads him to believe she's not at Lake Minerva. Instead of endlessly searching that fiery place, Lorn would like your help gathering a few items that he believes will help return our lost friend.

name: Return Our Lost Friend II
text: Lorn needs some steel to continue constructing his rescue apparatus. He also needs a new hammer.

name: Return Our Lost Friend III
text: Lorn is still working on the rescue device, but he wants to go ahead and have the materials ready for the gravitational array. Will you gather the items he needs?

name: Shipwrecked!
text: After an evening of dice, Vincent suggests you take first watch, while he gets some rest. After Vincent lays down, you realize you have absolutely no idea how to steer the boat, or what being on lookout means. You stand at the wheel, when suddenly the boat gives a mighty heave, and you are thrown into the sea. In the chaos, Vincent cries out and suggests you find a barrel and some rope, and search for land!

name: Big Boom II
text: Beatrix is ready to fill her barrels with explosives.

name: Pirate's Cove III
text: The water crashing around you in the morning light, you see land ahead. As you look around, Vincent is nowhere in sight. The boat seems quite damaged, it looks like you ran into a giant rock, oops. With no other choice, you paddle towards the shore, and notice some footprints and an oddly broken branch farther up the shore. You resolve to find Vincent and repair the boat, in that order.

name: Pirate's Cove IV
text: After following some marks in trees and subtly scuffed moss, you stumble upon a Small Cave, it seems oddly familiar. A voice greets you. “Hi, my name is Buddy! Let’s be friends and have dinner!” He requests you bring food for dinner “Because that’s what new friends do!”. His face looks happy, but his demeanor seems demanding, so you set out to help make dinner for your new ‘friend’. He offers you one of his pirate coins on loan if you’ll help him make new friends after you eat.

name: Pirate's Cove V
text: During dinner, you hear faint bird chirps from deeper in the cave. They’re distracting, but you try to focus while Buddy explains that he just really wants to make new friends, but every time he sees someone, they keep walking without giving him a second thought. He’s devised a new idea to get friends, using magic! He asks for your help in obtaining these items in hope that he can cast a spell that will make people want to be his friend.

name: Pirate's Cove VI
text: Buddy looks downtrodden, his ‘magic spells’ did not make him any friends. An owl hoots and his eyes flash angrily for a moment before softening somewhat. Buddy has heard that wealth is a great way to make friends, and he demands you bring him things that will make his cave flaunt his wealth and people will surely want to be his friend! You get the nagging sensation you’re forgetting something right now…

name: Pirate's Cove VII
text: As you watch Buddy decorate his cave, the sounds of birds echo louder and you decide to investigate. While Buddy is distracted, you take a quick peek and discover Vincent in a cage! It turns out that Vincent and Buddy are clearly not friends, though Vincent doesn’t seem willing to discuss why at the moment. Buddy, realizing you know Vincent, demands his pirate coin back, and tells you to leave at once!

name: Pirate's Cove VIII
text: You take a look at the cage, you can see areas where Vincent tried to break out, but the cage was cleverly made. Hesitant to leave Vincent alone, you devise a plan to break Vincent out using bottle rockets placed in the cave as a distraction, and some minor explosives to break open the cage.

name: Pirate's Cove IX
text: As Vincent hurls insults at Buddy, you run back towards the ship, an incensed Buddy seems close behind. Vincent suggests some kind of extra distraction while you repair the ship.

name: You Must Repair A Boat
text: Buddy has been distracted on the shoreline and has lost sight of you thanks to Vincent’s quick thinking. Vincent lays out the damage to the ship and suggests you watch where you’re going in the future. Suddenly, you hear a cannon in the distance and decide not to argue and get to work.

name: Escape from Pirate's Cove
text: The boat, looking worse for the wear, but still seaworthy (you hope!) sets off, cannons in the background. You catch Buddy and Vincent glaring angrily at each other, no love lost there it seems. Vincent turns to you and offers you the pirate bandana as proof of your piratical adventure, and with a sly smile, palms you a coin and rare-looking pipe he swiped from the cave during the escape. Perhaps they will be useful later on a new adventure…

name: Gold Mine
text: Jill hear rumors of a Gold Mine way off in the hills. She would like to try to go explore it, but needs some items before she can go. She will give you a portion of any Gold she finds in the mine.

name: Unique Fish I
text: Thomas would like some unique fish to show his friends.

name: Return Our Lost Friend IV
text: Lorn needs Rosalie’s mystic ring. He’s not sure how it happened, but Rosalie’s mystic ring is holding the magic spark needed to activate his machine and return Beatrix. Hopefully, Rosalie will trade you for it.

name: Conjure Up A New Recipe I
text: Rosalie wants to test her culinary skills by making a new recipe from arbitrary ingredients. Will you bring her some challenging items to try?

name: Return Our Lost Friend V
text: The time has come. Now Lorn needs the Lava Sphere Beatrix crafted. While the machine is working he wants you to get as far away as you can, in case something goes wrong. He would also like you to to hold on to a letter for him. If everything goes well, you can return it to him, otherwise Lorn would like it delivered to Rosalie.

name: Lost and Found
text: Lorn is ready to get his letter back. Despite the damage to his workshop, the machine was a success. Beatrix was safely returned, and Lorn already took her home to rest. The bad news is that the machine is a pile of ash and the Lava Sphere is gone. However, in the ash, Lorn found the strangest thing: two of each of the runestones Beatrix used to craft the Lava Sphere. Lorn thinks you should take them and keep them safe.

name: The Neighs Have It
text: Neigh…

name: Rat Trap!
text:
A dirty rat has been sneaking into your barn, and stealing your seeds! If you lace a trap with some cheese, you can probably catch the little beggar, and get some of your seeds back.

(Cheese is given as a reward from some quests, can be found occasionally in the Flea Market, and in the Post Office Passwords. Also note, this quest gives SEEDS as a reward, that you will have to plant to grow golden crops)

name: His Mane Quest I
text: Neigh?

name: His Mane Quest II
text: Neigh!!

name: To Ride A Horse
text: Buddy has seen a fancy new horse in town and would like to ride it. Having never ridden a horse, Buddy has requested some items with which to aid him in his goal.

name: Consequences and Defenses I
text: Beatrix is always freezing since Lorn brought her back. She’s using every blanket she has, but she’s still so cold. She doesn’t have a fever, but she’s clearly not well. Will you help her build a more significant heater?

name: A Real Gem I
text: Beatrix is looking for real, blue gems. She wants to replace the fake gems in a pair of earrings she recently received, and she'd like a matching ring. In exchange, she would be glad to trade some items left behind by someone no longer welcome in her life.

name: Bug Life I
text: Cecil is interested in studying the insect life of the Misty Forest. Will you bring him some bugs?

name: Let's Play Pirates I
text: Buddy really wants someone to play pirates with. He’d like you to bring the best pirate garb you can find, and he will bring an authentic pirate chest. He promises you can have everything back when you're done.

name: Escargot
text: Holger is pretty hungry but wants to try something a little more European. Escargot! There are rumored to be small snails around the Small Spring. Can you bring enough to Holger to make a meal? He has a new wooden carving he can give you as a reward.

name: An Owl's Best Friend
text: Holger really misses the Carved Owl he gave you earlier. If you bring it back, along with some wood, he will make a new one for you, and something extra as well.

name: Not From Around Here
text: A mysterious figure approaches you while you are in your fields. He tips his hat which you could have sworn wasn’t there a second ago and says he's not from around here. He asks for some food and good conversation, and some extra supplies, as he's traveling the world for a spell. He offers to recompense you for your time and effort.

name: Let's Play Pirates III
text: Buddy has taken townsfolk hostage in his cave to “play pirate prisoner” with you. Alarmingly, none of them seem to have agreed or known about this. Buddy challenges you to a duel with the townsfolk’s freedom as the prize!

name: We Carrot a Lot!
text: Holger has a bunch of new friends that really need some food. Everyone knows that rabbits love carrots, but do you think Holger really wants these carrots for his carved rabbits, or is he going to eat them all himself? Maybe you can take one home and find out for yourself if they really would eat!

name: Let's Play Pirates II
text: Buddy has asked you to fill a treasure chest with all sorts of shiny things to use as your pirate treasure. Buddy believes friendship is its own reward, and he promises again that you can have everything back when you're done.

name: Acorns A Callin
text: Did your carved rabbit eat a carrot? Well, probably not. But today, Holger makes no pretense about what he wants the acorns for. They will make great decorations around the new carved squirrel army he has on display in front of his farmhouse.

name: Let's Play Pirates IV
text: Buddy is impressed with your fighting skill, and happy that you have spent some time with him. You have rescued the townspeople, and sent them back home. Buddy wants to know if you will be his best friend. He would like to have the sword you bested him with, in exchange for some coins he found.

name: Lost at Sea?
text:
Thomas is looking for news about his brother, Norris. Norris works fishing charters and Thomas hasn't seen him in days. The charter Norris was working was scheduled to return after 2 days, but the big storm a few days ago may have delayed them.
Thomas will exchange an old book that belonged to his parents for news about the charter.

name: A Bear Skin Rug
text: George would like to make some bear skin rugs. Bring him some hide, and he will be happy as can be. He will even give you a wooden carving Holger made for him earlier.

name: Let's Play Pirates V
text: Buddy asks if you will come play pirates again with him sometime. He gives you back your pirate garb, and some of your shiny treasure. He also hands you a strange looking rock. He seems to have kept the rings…

name: Moose Horns
text: Holger is working on something really big! It needs some antlers. Holger knows you really want to use those antlers to make nets though, so he will help you out to make sure you are even.

name: Hakuna Matata
text: Hakuna Matata, what a wonderful phrase! Hakuna Matata, makes you want to eat bugs for days! At least if you are a warthog. Did you know Holger has carved up something new in tribute to these wonderful animals? Bring him a handful of their favorite foods, and Holger will send you on your way with your own special friend.

name: Last but not least...
text: Holger has one last woodcarving masterpiece to share with you. He wants some horns in return. You are sure he isn't going to eat those, right? Oh, for canteens? Ok, this is probably safe to do then.

name: Consequences and Defenses II
text: Vincent gave Beatrix some ideas for a few teas to try, to help her recover from whatever is ailing her. He also gave her a recipe for a tea that is supposed to help her sleep. Unfortunately, Beatrix is too exhausted to go and find all of the ingredients for the teas. Will you help her? She also needs a new teapot.

name: His Mane Quest III
text: Neigh neigh neigh!

name: Consequences and Defenses III
text: Lorn went to check on Beatrix this morning, but she was still sleeping. He waited and waited for her to wake up well into the afternoon, until it was time for him to meet with Rosalie. Beatrix was still in a deep sleep when Lorn finally left. Will you check on Beatrix this evening and bring her some dinner?

name: Fire Alarm
text:
George saw the dragon that destroyed the Pale Moon Inn. He says it flew over his house as quick as a shooting star, slammed into the second floor of the inn, and burst back into the air with an explosion of flames behind it.

George thinks the inn might have survived, if not for that fire. Water couldn’t stop it. The building didn’t stand a chance, and the only thing that saved the occupants of the inn was George’s shouting.

In case the dragon returns, will you help George make buckets of dragon fire extinguisher?

name: The Collector
text: Cecil, known for collecting oddities, has heard your plight! You may want to 'Play Pirates', but can't find, or somehow lost the hard-to-find costume pieces needed to do so? Never fear, an exchange can be made, for the right price of course! Just remember, this deal can only be made once. Please don't sell off your needed pirate costume pieces in the future!

name: Spellbound
text: Rosalie found a book in her basement. She can't open the book or remove it from the shelf it's on. At first, she was curious about this strange book, but now she just wants it gone. If you can get it out of the basement, the book is yours.

name: His Mane Quest IV
text: …sigh…neigh…neigh…

name: Consequences and Defenses IV
text: Beatrix didn’t hear you knocking or calling out to her when you dropped off dinner yesterday, but she’s grateful you left the food for her. She was ravenous when she woke this morning. Actually, Beatrix is still very hungry. Will you bring her some lunch?

name: Fire in the Field
text: A loud boom shook Jill’s windows and woke her up just after midnight. She ran to her bedroom window to see what happened and discovered a fire in her wheat field. It only lasted about half an hour, but it burned the entire field of wheat right down to the dirt. Jill tried to put out the fire, but nothing could extinguish it. After the field cooled down, she discovered an enormous crater, but there were no remnants of whatever fell there. Will you help Jill get caught up on her wheat?

name: Consequences and Defenses V
text: Beatrix is extremely hungry again today, and she has an almost painful craving for steak. Specifically, Beatrix wants her steak really, really well done. If you’ll get the steak and coal for her, she’ll cook it to her liking.

name: The Collector - Goldfish
text: You are an experienced enough farmer now, that you have gathered quite a few rarities during your days. Cecil is looking to add to his collection of very hard-to-find fish. Some are so rare, that only pets can find them. Can you help Cecil finish his collection by providing some Goldfish? He will pay handsomely.

name: The Collector - Large Clam Shell
text: You are an experienced enough farmer now, that you have gathered quite a few rarities during your days. Cecil is looking to add to his collection of very hard-to-find fish. Some are so rare, that only pets can find them. Can you help Cecil finish his collection by providing some Large Clam Shells? He will pay handsomely.

name: The Collector - Shinefish
text: You are an experienced enough farmer now, that you have gathered quite a few rarities during your days. Cecil is looking to add to his collection of very hard-to-find fish. Some are so rare, that only pets can find them. Can you help Cecil finish his collection by providing some Shinefish? He will pay handsomely.

name: The Collector - Gold Crab
text: You are an experienced enough farmer now, that you have gathered quite a few rarities during your days. Cecil is looking to add to his collection of very hard-to-find fish. Some are so rare, that only pets can find them. Can you help Cecil finish his collection by providing some Gold Crabs? He will pay handsomely.

name: Fire Unstable
text:
Cecil’s horse is missing, and the stable is burned to the ground. After searching his estate, Cecil found some signs that the horse may be injured, or worse. He also found a horseshoe hanging from a branch at least 4 meters above his head.
 Will you gather some supplies to help Cecil find his horse and rebuild his stable?

name: Consequences and Defenses VI
text:
Lorn appreciates all of your hard work to help Beatrix. He was very busy over the past few days helping Rosalie, and your assistance took a great weight off his shoulders.

Also, knowing that you are watching out for Beatrix has allowed Lorn time to do research. He thinks that he’s close to discovering what is ailing our returned friend.

Now, Lorn would like to borrow your copy of the Book of Schemas for his research. In the meantime, he needs you to refresh and prepare yourself. Something strange is happening around town.

name: Wolf of Main Street
text: Holger wants to start investing in the steak market, but he doesn't have enough silver. He'll trade some valuables for a steak in the market.

name: Not From Around Here II
text: The mysterious man thanks you for the food but mentions that your conversation was a bit… lacking. A sparkle in his eye, he suggests you meet him in town and asks that you introduce him to some of the townsfolk! He mentions that he believes in giving a gift to each person he meets, and asks you bring him a gift for Rosalie…

name: Not From Around Here III
text: Still wondering how he knew who Rosalie is, you see the mysterious man approach Rosalie and engage her in conversation. You overhear them discuss both the beauty of the town and something about luck. It’s an odd conversation, but he’s an odd fellow in your experience. The mysterious man tips another hat to Rosalie and rejoins you saying he’s met everyone he’d like to but could use an extra pair of shoes and some repair material for the journey home.

name: Now You See It
text:
On the walk back towards your farm, you realize you have no idea where “home” is, and get the sinking feeling your home might be his home now. As you walk towards your farm, he stops and thanks you for the companionship with a flourish of another hat.

“By the way, my name is ‘Star Meerif,’ and my home is just over that way a bit. You know, I could use a few feathers, if you have any to spare? They’re for my favorite spell.” He points off in the distance and suddenly a tower shimmers into your view. You cry out in surprise, only to turn around and see that Star has disappeared with your feathers and only a Wizard Hat with items inside is left behind...

name: Now You Don't
text: As you tend your farm one evening, Rosalie approaches you and asks if you know where to find Star Meerif. You give her a look of utter confusion and turn around and point, only to see nothing on the horizon. You struggle to find words but find her looking quite disappointed. She asks if you have anything to cheer her up when you remember what Star left for you.

name: Fire in the Belly I
text:
Holger heard a noise outside near his smokehouse. It was loud enough that it woke him. By the time he put his prosthetic leg on, grabbed his axe, and got to the smokehouse, all of his smoked fish were gone. He saw something big flying away in the moonlight, but he could only make out a silhouette. Whatever it was, it blasted the door to ashes before it took all his fish.

Will you help Holger restock and repair his smokehouse?

name: 50,000 Players!
text: Rosalie can't keep up with the amount of new farmers around town. She needs to cater an event with over 50,000 people! Can you help her with some items she needs for the event? She will pay well for the assistance.

name: His Mane Quest V
text: …Snort.

name: Make Life TakeThe Lemons Back!
text:
*poof*

In a shower of feathers, Star appears in your home both unannounced and uninvited and tips his hat to you. He looks as usual, just slightly more aggravated than you remember.

"Lemons! Lemons! LEMONS! They're so tart and tart and... tart and... UNINTERESTING! I can't stand them! When life gives you lemons, make life take the lemons back! We should get oranges instead! Don't you agree? Well, no matter, because I do. Let me show you this spell I've been working on..."

Star holds his hands out to you expectantly.

name: Orange Justice
text:
Star gives you a wild smile, and motions for you to step away.

"One more thing, could you bring me some feathers? They're for my favorite spell! I can't quite remember the name of it right now, but it's delightful! Hurry up now, I should be done when you get back!"

After you've gathered the feathers, you look inside your home to see a strange glow coming from the windows. The orange glow strikes you as odd, when suddenly the glow becomes as intense as the sun followed by a giant popping noise! You rush inside to see Star chuckling to himself. When he sees you he makes a grand gesture with his hat and says:

"Oh, you've brought the feathers? Thanks friend! Look what I've accomplished in your absence! There was a small mistake on one though..."

You look to see a table full of orange juice where your lemons had been! By the time you turn around, you realize once again, Star is gone without so much as a goodbye.

name: Consequences and Defenses VII
text: Beatrix appreciates your help. Lorn told her at tea today all that you did to assist him in bringing her back. On top of all that, Beatrix appreciates all your support through her current troubles. She would like you to bring some honey and join her for an after dinner hops tea. She also has a gift for you.

name: Hot Peppers
text: Rosalie is looking for peppers for a special meal.

name: Hungry Holger II
text: Once again, Holger is hungry, but he'd like something a little more filling. He recently discovered his love for seafood, could you bring him some delicious fish?

name: Fire in the Belly II
text:
Holger is not happy.


He didn’t hear anything this time, but something broke into his smokehouse and emptied it again. Whatever is stealing Holger’s food destroyed the door again too. All that’s left of the door is the steel reinforcements he added, but they were warped and bent away.


After talking it over with Thomas, they came up with an idea, and they want you to help. They want to rebuild the door, and then fill the smokehouse from floor to ceiling with fish. They don’t need anything fancy or delicious just lots of fish. They’re hoping whatever is breaking in will return and start in on the fish. Then, when it’s really, really full they can get the drop on it.

name: The Elusiveness of Freedom
text:
One of Lorn’s biggest regrets happened many years ago, far away from Redbrook. He was a soldier then, and he was sent with his battalion to free a group of people that were enslaved for many, many years.

A dispatch was sent to the town ahead of the battalion to allow everyone time to gather. The slaveholders and the enslaved were assembled and waiting when the soldiers arrived. Lorn was given a proclamation to read to the town. The proclamation announced that those currently in the bondage of slavery were freed and would be treated as such. Lorn’s battalion remained in the area only long enough to make sure the proclamation was obeyed, and then they moved on to their next assignment.

To this day, Lorn worries that he didn’t do enough to help those newly freed people. He did his duty and followed his orders, but those newly freed men and women and children needed more than being released from forced labor. They needed kindness, friendship, and support.

Every year on this day, Lorn remembers. Then, he tries to find someone around him that needs a little more help and he reaches out to help.

Lorn would like everyone in town to join him in celebrating this day of freedom by helping others. Will you join him and remember someone that needs help?

name: Fire in the Forest
text:
Vincent could see the fire burning the birch forest near Mount Banon, all the way from his campsite. The glare made it harder for him to sleep than usual. It also reminded him of something that happened a long time ago when he was working in a land far away from here. There were random fires and destruction, and animals went missing. A few people were hurt and killed too.


That disaster from long ago was caused by a dragon. The destruction didn’t stop until a trio of dragon hunters arrived and hunted down the dragon. They killed it, but the dragon got one of the hunters and injured the other two.


Vincent would like to see a little less destruction this time. Will you help Vincent find the dragon and figure out a way to stop it? He’ll need some tools and resources.

name: Consequences and Defenses VIII
text:
Lorn likes the idea that Holger and Thomas cooked up, except the part about attacking the dragon. After his latest round of research, he has a better idea. Instead of attacking it, Lorn wants to mark the dragon with green dye and let it escape. Lorn hopes the dye will allow him to find the beast and help it when it’s in a more peaceful state.


Lorn discussed this idea at length with Holger and Thomas. Holger didn’t like it. Thomas was supportive, because he thought it sounded like a strategy he could use for fishing. Nevertheless, both men agreed to do it Lorn’s way this time.


If you’ll gather the resources they need, Lorn will compensate you for your time and materials. He’s also finished with your book and would like to return it to you.

name: His Mane Quest VI
text: Neigh…neigh?

name: Fabled Sailor
text: Cecil is investigating tales of a famous sailor from long ago, and is looking for artifacts for research purposes. If you can bring him some pieces of history, he will be most grateful.

name: Lorn's Advice V
text:
"Hey, I know you have a lot of work to do, and sometimes these help requests can take a while to complete," Lorn tells you. "If you click that button there, yup, the one that says 'Track Items', I'll track your progress for you!

Of course, if you have everything needed, only 'Collect and Complete' will show up. Oh, and if you hand over a few worms and some stones, I have a treat for you too. It is never too early to get a good breakfast!"

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch I
text:
Thomas wants to ride with a fishing charter out to the vast ocean. He’s searching for a hidden island. Unfortunately, he doesn’t have any gold to pay for the charter. So, he made a deal with Captain Logan. Thomas is supposed to provide a variety of fish to make up for the lost fishing opportunities the captain will experience while hauling Thomas around, and a little extra.

Will you help Thomas catch the fish he needs? He can’t pay much, but he promises to also share anything exciting he finds on the hidden island.

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch II
text:
Thomas needs your help again. During his ride with the charter to search for the hidden island, Thomas had a small accident. Although he could see the hidden island through the mask he found, he couldn’t step onto it. The boat passed right through the island too, as if it wasn’t really there.

In his frustration, Thomas quickly built a tower out of the barrels on the boat and climbed on top of it. He was trying to get a better view of the hidden island through his mask. Unfortunately, he stepped a little too close to the edge of his tower while he was trying to touch a palm tree. The tower leaned with the shift in weight and then tipped over, and Thomas and the barrels fell into the water. A few of the barrels smashed open and the bait went everywhere.

Thomas needs to replace a few barrels of bait. Will you help him gather the bait? He can’t pay much, but he promises that he will figure out how to get to that island, and he will also share everything fantastic he finds with you.

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch III
text: Thomas isn’t giving up on getting to that island. He showed the mask to Lorn and explained what happened on his boat trip. Lorn was intrigued and offered to help Thomas find a way onto the island, but Lorn told Thomas that he’s missing a book that could speed up his research. Will you help Thomas find a copy of the Book of Ancients for Lorn to borrow?

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch IV
text: Lorn is still researching the island and the mask, but he told Thomas that getting onto the island may require diligent and repeated experimentation. To that end, Lorn encouraged Thomas to build a boat to eliminate the expense of hiring a vessel for the experiments. Thomas has no clue where to start. Will you help him build a small boat? He can’t pay much, but Thomas promises that you will get to join him on the island, as soon as Lorn figures out how to get there.

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch V
text: Thomas wants to try diving at the site where the island appears. He thinks there may be some clues about the island underwater. Will you help him with the dive?

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch VI
text:
Thomas found nothing useful during his dive. While he was underwater, he could still see the island through the mask, but without the mask, there was only ocean.

Thomas is tired of waiting and he’s out of ideas. So, he went to get answers from Lorn today, but Lorn wasn’t home. While Thomas was trying to find Lorn, he accidentally stumbled in through the window to Lorn’s lab. As he was trying to get back outside, Thomas saw the plans for something called a gravitational array on Lorn’s desk. Thomas thinks it must be what Lorn was working on to get to the island.

Will you help Thomas gather the resources to build a gravitational array? As usual, Thomas can’t pay much, but he promises that you will get a share of all the treasures he finds.

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch VII
text:
Thomas accidentally lost the gravitational array. He paddled out to the site of the hidden island and tried to use it with the mask. The gravitational array started glowing when Thomas got close to the island. So, he held it out to make contact with the shore. At that same moment, a fish jumped out of the water right near his face. In surprise, Thomas dropped the array. It sank very quickly. Worst of all, the island was not fazed by the sinking gravitational array.

Thomas wants you to come up with an idea to try. He's open to almost anything at this point.

name: Shimmering Masterpiece
text: Beatrix is in need of some shiny stones to make her latest art piece. She only wants the highest quality rocks, so it will be the shiniest object in the room.

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch VIII
text: Lorn has the answer. If you'll help Thomas gather a variety of feathers, Lorn thinks the mask can be fixed.

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch IX
text:
Lorn used a few of the feathers you found to repair the broken feathers on the mask, but the rest are meant for Star Meerif. Lorn invited Star to come help repair the mask, and Lorn always likes to give Star a gift of feathers.

Now, Star needs a few more items to complete the repair spell on the mask. Lorn would like you to help Thomas find everything Star needs.

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch X
text:
The mask is repaired!

Star vanished in mid-sentence after the spell was complete. Thomas heard something about "praying mantis DNA", but he didn't understand what Star was talking about.

Now, Thomas would like you to help him get everything he needs for exploring and fishing from the island. He can't pay you much, but he promises that you are welcome to keep anything you find when you come with him to the island.

name: Islands Are Hard To Catch XI
text:
Thomas didn't find anything exciting on the island, but he caught an enormous swordfish from its shores! He says that's even better than a shark. If you'll help Thomas immortalize his catch, he would like to give you his mask. He's sorry that you didn't find or catch anything, but maybe the mask will give you the luck needed to be great at fishing like Thomas.

Before you take the mask, Thomas wants you to be aware that sometimes the mask gets really cold to the touch. It hasn’t happened since Star fixed it, but Thomas didn’t want it to surprise you like it did him.

name: A Tower Divided
text:
*poof*

Star appears again before you quite suddenly, a shower of feathers coming down around him and you.

“Why, good day! Have you noticed anything odd lately? Has Rosalie been snoring again? You see, my tower has been having some issues lately…” He points in the distance and you’re surprised to see a giant tower where there was nothing yesterday!

Upon closer inspection, it looks like the tower has been split in half!

“You see my good fellow, I was enjoying a good rumination on the theory of orchid blooming patterns in non-standard aethereal weather patterns when Geist so rudely slammed into my tower, which for some reason is entirely visible again! Confound it all, I want some tea in peace! I need some help with repairs, and I know you’d be happy to help!”

Star hands you a list of items he needs and disappears without a trace.

name: A Tower Divided II
text:
As you gather the last item, Star appears before you in a shower of feathers yet again. He really loves that spell.

“Oh! Excellent, you’ve gotten the base materials! I knew you were the right person for the job. Now, I need to make a new staff, you know, for bigger magic. Big magic requires a lot of gems, could you fetch me some materials so I can make something worthy of my station? I don't want any Lemon Quartz though.”

Star hands you a second list, and all the previous materials (and Star) disappear without a trace. Except a lot of feathers and one wizard hat.

name: A Tower Divided III
text:
*poof*

As you put the last piece of Magicite down, Star again appears as if he has been watching you the whole time. Very strange, and he really does love that spell. Feathers, feathers everywhere.

“I’m out of feathers, would you mind collecting some more for me while I get to work on this staff? I can’t teleport anymore!”
Star begins to walk, stops, looks at you and laughs, then teleports away in a shower of feathers.

“Just kidding! But seriously, running low on feather juice!” Star’s voice floats in the air in a very odd and melodic way.

Well, you’ve done this much, hopefully the reward is worth it, time to get some feathers.

name: A Tower Redecorated
text:
You put all the feathers in the bucket and wait expectantly for Star to arrive, but nothing happens.

Turning away, you hear a muffled scream from behind, and suddenly flashes of gold and white feathers encircle the room.


“WHY WOULD YOU PUT FEATHERS IN A BUCKET TODAY?!”


You see him one leg in the bucket, feathers in his hair, scrambling to regain his balance. Oops.

After a few moments, Star composes himself, mumbling under his breath about the paradoxical nature of feathers and their location in the timestream’s quantum blue spectrum relative to Wednesdays.

“Anyways…I was thinking, I should probably redecorate. The damage was severe enough that things look awfully messy in there. Mind helping me out, friend? I need to run another quick errand while you’re doing that.”
Star hands you ANOTHER list and poofs away in a shower of feathers.


Bedroom, Living Room, Study

-Antlers to adorn the living room

-Flowers for various plants and spells

-Prism Shards to adorn the ceiling

-Treasure Chests filled with coins

-Shields for inside protection

-Pipes one for each multiverse day of the week

-A new bed

-A desk

-Books to write his thoughts and spells in

name: A Tower Redecorated II
text:
You know the drill at this point, feathers, sudden appearances, strange jokes…the usual.

Star looks gleefully at the things you’ve collected and mutters under his breath something about giving a mile, and hands you another piece of parchment.

“You’ve been quite helpful, the damage Geist has done should mostly be repaired at this point, but my kitchen and cellar were damaged by fire also! Could you help me restoc- I mean restore these too?”

Star looks thoughtful for a moment and takes the parchment back and scribbles something at the bottom of the list.

He hands the list back which reads:


Shopping List:

Golden Veggies - a variety of nutritious foods

Oranges - delicious and fight scurvy!

Milk - does a body good

Eggs - part of a nutritious breakfast

Bacon - it’s so hard to find right now!

Flour - For baking and making bread

Honey - For baking and bread

Wine - for those lazy nights reading magical theory

Cheese - for the wine

Steak - the market’s probably stable right now

Kabobs - perfect for grilling after Friday

Scribbled at the bottom:

ABSOLUTELY NO LEMONS!

name: Lemon, Interrupted
text: Did you just give me a lemon when I explicitly said not to? Did I not write “No lemons!” in all capital letters on my list? You’ve violated one of my most inviolable rules – don’t bring me things I don’t want! Especially lemons! So, you get nothing! You lose! Good day!

name: Mystery Contraption II
text: Cecil is continuing to work on his secret project, and is in need of more materials. He still won't tell you what he's working on though...

name: A Tower Remade
text:
Star returns early, seemingly quite impatient about something…

Once you’ve collected all of the things for his moat, they instantly disappear, and he focuses his attention on Rosalie.

“So, you’ve had time to consider what I’ve written, would you like to see where this can lead?”
Rosalie seems anxious and unsure of what to do. After a few moments, she begins pacing around, for a split second you get the impression she might leave without saying anything. Finally she stops pacing, straightens up and gives Star a firm look and replies, “I am ready to see…”

Star gives her a reassuring smile and looks to you.



“Friend, one last request, can you bring me a wizard hat, for Rosalie?”

name: A Tower Redecorated III
text:
As you realize you’ve finished restocking Star’s food stores, you notice Rosalie walking up to your farm. She greets you and asks you for the letter Star said you had for her.

At the mention of Star’s name, he immediately poofs beside you and extends his hand to Rosalie.

“Oh, I’m sure that letter’s been long lost at this point, I made an extra one just for you!”

He hands Rosalie the letter and turns around to hand you some parchment.

You set to work on what you hope to be the final task, and notice Rosalie deep in thought, and of course Star is nowhere to be seen, again.



The Coolest Moat In The History Of Moats

Puffer – look cool in a gang to attract attention

Clownfish – disarm your foe with cuteness

Giant Squid – eat your foe

Octopus - If the squids don't scare you...

Mussel – they look kinda intimidating?

A drawbridge - obviously





That’s… a big moat.

name: A Tower Remade II
text:
Star produces a staff from inside his robes and offers it to Rosalie along with the hat and a strange ring.

“We will use these to help focus your talent,” he says solemnly.

Star motions for you to step backwards and whispers a few things in Rosalie’s ear you can’t hear, but one thing you can.

“…it’s only my favorite tower, after all."

Rosalie gulps visibly and lifts the staff with a determined look on her face. She begins to close her eyes and mumbles something incoherently. Stars’ attention is now riveted on the tower.

A minute passes and nothing seems to be happening, and as you look to the tower, you can’t help but feel a little disappointed for Rosalie.

After another minute, Star takes an appraising look at Rosalie and adjusts her stance slightly. Rosalie is so deeply in a trance; she doesn’t seem to notice at all. Star whispers something in Rosalie’s ear again, and her eyes open wide as she cries out:
“LIBERO!!!!!!!”

A rush of wind follows her words, and with a sound like peeling thunder and a giant flash, the tower is suddenly whole again!

Rosalie cries out in surprise, while Star exclaims “I KNEW IT!” and dances excitedly beside you both.

After a few minutes of celebration, Star gently takes the staff back from a stunned Rosalie and offers it to you.

"This, this will stay with you. Hopefully, no one has need of it, but if they do, I know where to come. Keep it secret, keep it safe."

Star hands Rosalie a second letter, and with a flourish and a thank you, he disappears without a trace (except feathers). Rosalie, still in a bit of a daze, says her goodbyes and walks quietly from your farm, while you are left to clean up the mess of feathers everywhere.

name: His Mane Quest VII
text:
She isn’t sure how she knows, but Rosalie is absolutely certain that the horse standing shyly by her porch wants a haircut.

The horse came up, looked at the ground for a bit, and then flipped his mane and neighed quietly. Like lightning, an impression came to Rosalie that the horse’s name is Charles, he’s shy, and he wants a haircut. Then, Charles pushed a variety of items toward Rosalie for payment.

Unfortunately, Rosalie’s scissors are pretty dull right now. Will you bring her a nice new, sharp pair of scissors?

name: Dinner Party I
text: Rosalie invited Holger to a dinner party. Holger doesn’t remember what he’s supposed to bring, but he thinks Rosalie said cups. Will you help him get some cups for the party?

name: Dinner Party II
text: Jill was invited to Rosalie’s dinner party. Rosalie asked Jill to bring a side dish, cups, or a dessert. Unfortunately, Jill ran out of time to make her dad’s famous cookies. Will you help her get some cups for the party instead?

name: Dinner Party III
text: Thomas is supposed to attend Rosalie’s dinner party. He was also supposed to grill some fish for the main course. When Thomas told Rosalie that a raccoon stole all his fish, Rosalie said she understood and invited Thomas to bring cups instead. Will you help Thomas get some cups for the party?

name: A Horse Of A Different Color
text: Buddy thinks Charles Horsington III could be his friend. He has something he’d like to build to “catch his attention”. In exchange, he has some cool bugs he thinks you might like. This sounds ominous to you, but… why not?

name: A Horse Of A Different Color II
text: Buddy says his creation is coming along nicely, but he’d like to add some color to it. Seems fairly innocent.

name: A Horse Of A Different Color III
text: With the colors done, Buddy thinks there should be some flair for whatever it is he’s building. He has a list of adornments he’d like you to get for him.

name: Bling Things
text: Rosalie needs pretty gems for the jewelry she is making, along with some other materials. She's willing to give you some of the jewelry as a reward.

name: A Horse Of A Different Color IV
text: Holger has been recruited to help with Buddy’s bizarre building blunders. Holger needs building materials to complete some carvings. He has some things he’s found while searching for wood for other projects.

name: A Horse Of A Different Color V
text: With the work Holger has completed, Buddy says it’s now time to start getting some things out of the way. He’d like some fairly dangerous tools. This… is starting to get concerning again.

name: A Horse Of A Different Color VI
text: Buddy is very excited. He says everything seems to be working properly, now it’s time to finish everything up with some hardware. He gives you fishing nets saying “These aren’t good for horses anyway.” You feel like Charles Horsington III might be in trouble.

name: Dinner Party VI
text: George is going to Rosalie’s party, but he doesn’t know what he should bring. Rosalie said he could bring anything. If he’s going with his training to be prepared, George thinks cups are his best bet. Will you bring George some cups for the party?

name: A Horse, Afraid
text: NEIGH? NEIGH? NEIGH?!

name: Dinner Party V
text: Cecil is in charge of entertainment for Rosalie’s dinner party. Will you bring him some cups for a game he wants to play at the party?

name: Dinner Party IV
text: Rosalie invited Beatrix to her dinner party, but she said not to worry about bringing anything this time. Beatrix doesn’t want to go empty handed. Will you get some cups for Beatrix to take to the party?

name: A Horse Of A Different Color VII
text: Buddy says everything is completed. He just needs some help getting Charles Horsington III to come visit him in the cave. He thinks if you bring carrots, he might be able to help get Charles to stop by.

name: Dinner Party VII
text: Rosalie appreciates you coming to the dinner party, and bringing carrots for the vegetable platter. Everyone else brought cups and left them behind when the party was over. Rosalie would like you to take the cups. Maybe you can host your own dinner party.

name: You Spin Me Right Round,Buddy, Right Round
text: Buddy has gotten Charles Horsington III to come see him at his cave. You are absolutely stunned to see what Buddy has created. There is a carousel, complete with horses, chariots with shields adorning them, all decorated with the colorful additions you have spent so long acquiring for Buddy. Sitting on one of the horses, in what you can only assume must be mildly painful for his back, is Charles Horsington III. He has the biggest grin you have ever seen on a horse (not that you’re sure you’ve ever seen a horse grin before), and he appears to be having the time of his life. You ask Buddy how in the world the carousel is spinning, and he shows you the trench he dug with the tools you brought him. Water is flowing down the trench, and making the carousel turn. Buddy seems to be happy to have given Charles a fun ride to play on. He offers you a pile of coins, if you can bring something to carry it all in.

name: Big Boom III
text: Beatrix needs a few more things to finish setting up. This could get messy.

name: Defenses and Consequences I
text: George has an idea to help protect the townsfolk from the dragon. With approval from the mayor, George is leading a large work crew to build dugout dragon shelters all around town. Everyone in town is being asked to contribute. For your part, will you help George gather the tools and building materials to start a few of the shelters?

name: Defenses and Consequences II
text: George needs more building materials for the dragon shelters. Will you help get the items he needs?

name: Defenses and Consequences III
text: George thinks that with everyone contributing, he’ll only need a couple more loads of building materials.

name: Defenses and Consequences IV
text: The dragon shelters are almost finished. George thinks this should be the last load of building materials.

name: Defenses and Consequences V
text: Ric arrived in town yesterday. With all the destruction from the dragon, he couldn’t find a place to stay. He ended up sleeping under a tree in the woods outside of town. Do you have a room he could rent for a few days?

name: Defenses and Consequences VI
text:
Ric appreciates the room you rented to him. He traveled from far in the west, prompted by rumors that a dragon was attacking this town. Now that he has seen the destruction, he believes the rumors. Ric hasn't seen the dragon yet, but he's ready to help stop it.

Ric had to travel light to get here so quickly. Will you help him build up an arsenal that he can use to stop the dragon and defend the town?

name: Defenses and Consequences VII
text:
Ric found the mayor today and discussed an offensive strategy to use against the dragon. The mayor agreed to let Ric direct a crew in the building of large-scale offensive weapons around town.

Everyone is being asked to contribute. Will you help gather materials to build ballistas?

name: Defenses and Consequences VIII
text: The mayor wouldn't agree to Ric's plan to have cannons in town, but the mayor did approve the use of cannons on the outskirts. Ric needs more materials for his crews to build enough cannons to cover the entire town. Everyone needs to contribute.

name: Defenses and Consequences IX
text: Ric needs more black powder for the cannons and more iron for the cannonballs.

name: Experimental Bait I
text: Thomas heard from a friend that radishes make excellent bait, so he wants to try it for himself.

name: Defenses and Consequences X
text: Ric is ready to start patrolling at night to watch for the dragon. Will you get him some things to help him stay energized?

name: Consequences and Defenses IX
text:
Lorn, Holger, and Thomas followed a trail of green paint this morning. It was scattered and spotty, but it was consistent enough that they were able to follow it with a little effort. When they reached the end of the trail, they found Vincent at the edge of the forest, prone on the ground behind a small rise, and watching Beatrix's house.

Vincent said that he followed the dragon as best he could all night. The last he saw the dragon, it dropped from the air just before it reached Beatrix's house. He watched all night for the dragon to reappear, but he hasn't seen it since.

Lorn would like you to join the four men in their watch this evening.

Rosalie thinks this place is starting to get crowded, but she's going to do her best to welcome every new farmer with something nice. All she needs in return are a few things for her next catering event.

name: Secrets With Lorn I
text:
Lorn wants to have a secret way of sharing information and items with you. He set up a mailbox at the Post Office. It requires a password. You can access the mailbox if you can discover the password from this clue.

The watermelon has a relative that you can grow at level 40.

After you solve the clue and enter the password, bring Lorn the contents of the mailbox for a reward. He’ll also let you keep what was in the mailbox after you show him you were successful.

name: Feathers I
text: As you're tending to your peppers, you nearly trip over a small boulder you don't remember being there before. You look down and see a piece of balled up paper. You look around, confused, as nobody is there but you. You open the paper, and it says one word. "Bucket." You're not sure why, but you feel compelled to head to your workshop and build a bucket for this piece of parchment.

name: Feathers II
text: You're woken up in the middle of the night by a loud THUD. You go investigate, and find a very rotund rabbit sitting on your workbench. You turn on the lights, and notice a scroll of paper tied around a strange collar he's wearing. You take a step towards him. He bolts across the room faster than your eyes can follow. Think, think... You hear a soft whine and look to see this fat, fat rabbit is comically rubbing its own belly. You must have some carrots left over somewhere. You notice that same old bucket from earlier in the day on the floor, when you're positive you left it outside, and you wonder if you should use that to capture this very strange bunny.

name: Feathers III
text: You've finally caught the rabbit, and manage to slip the parchment from under his collar. As soon as you do this, he dashes out of your home, just as fast as he came in, bucket still on his head and carrot dangling from his mouth. You open the folded note, and it says "Feather. In. Bucket." You've never found any loose feathers before, and don’t know what this letter is talking about. The words on the paper swirl away, and new words appear. "Chickens have feathers." You guess it's time to get a chicken coop, you wanted to make yourself some scrambled eggs anyways. Without even thinking, you decide to construct a new bucket, and find a feather for this piece of paper.

name: Consequences and Defenses XIII
text:
Beatrix is so glad to see you and Vincent. She feels like she’s losing her mind, and she hopes you can stay and help her.

Beatrix woke up in a small stand of trees not far from her house. She was covered in branches and leaves and there was an unpleasant smelling liquid everywhere. Beatrix has no memory of how she got there, and she is terrified that something horrible happened.

This isn’t the first time she found herself somewhere with no memory of how she got there. Over the past few weeks, Beatrix found herself sleeping in different rooms of her house every morning.

Now, Beatrix is exhausted from crying, but she’s afraid to go to sleep. Will you help her make some energy tea to keep her awake?

name: Thank You!
text: Farm RPG launched in May of this year. In just over 4 months, the amount of support the game has gotten has been insane. The Farm RPG Patreon reached 500 Patrons today, so to celebrate, all players can complete this special Help Request and get some great items. Thank you to everybody playing and supporting the game development!

name: Consequences and Defenses X
text:
Lorn wants you to document all that you and the other members of the watch party saw this evening, including as much detail as everyone could see of Beatrix’s transformation into the dragon, and a complete description of her dragon form. He also wants notes on anything that anyone noticed out of the ordinary from the time Beatrix walked out of her house, clearly still asleep, until the time she changed into the dragon. Every detail could be important.

Lorn thinks good information will be the key to helping Beatrix.

While you document what happened, Lorn is going to run and see if he can keep an eye on Beatrix, or the dragon rather. Will you give him something to light his way?

name: Cecil's New Steed
text: Cecil recently purchased a new horse, but he needs healthy food to feed it. Can you spare some of your harvest?

name: Consequences and Defenses XI
text:
Lorn needs help.

He followed the dragon until he got close to town. Then, explosions rang out from every direction. Lorn retreated back to the edge of the woods to find cover. There wasn’t much to see from where he was, but several of the houses in the distance looked to be damaged and the sky was orange towards town.

Once the explosions stopped, Lorn searched for the dragon and eventually found a trail of dragon blood a few hundred meters from Beatrix’s house, leading to a little stand of trees. Among the trees, Lorn found the dragon half conscious with its wings completely shredded. Unfortunately, that wasn’t the worst of it. Lorn also found several large wounds in the dragon’s side.

Lorn covered the dragon with branches and foliage, but he doesn’t think that cover will pass a close inspection. Will you and Thomas gather some things to hide the dragon while Lorn takes Vincent and Holger to make sure no one comes near the dragon?

name: Consequences and Defenses XII
text:
The dragon is gone.

When Lorn, Holger, and Vincent got to the stand of trees where Lorn left the dragon, there was nothing there except branches, leaves, and the evidence of a wounded dragon, but no dragon. Lorn and the other men split up in three directions and fanned outward from the stand of trees. There was no sign of the dragon except it’s trail leading to the trees where Lorn left it.

Now, Lorn and Holger are going to town to see what happened, and to see if anyone needs help. Thomas will go with them. Lorn would like you and Vincent to go check Beatrix’s house, just in case the dragon went back there.

If you’ll give Holger and Thomas each a light to bring with them, Lorn will send you with his key to Beatrix’s house?

name: Parts Unknown I
text:
As you leave the town on a trip for more nails and iron, you are stopped at a clearing by Vincent.

After exchanging pleasantries, Vincent begins to tell you about a job he has taken on for a client and would like your help in retrieving it. He offers to split the reward with you if you’re willing to do some of the work and material gathering.

To start, he thinks it may be a long trip and asks you to bring some various supplies for the journey ahead.

name: Parts Unknown II
text:
Leaving town, Vincent starts to tell you about a time he had to hunt down a rogue with a graviton projector, but before he’s able to tell you more, George walks up beside you both and says he heard about your trip and would like to go along as well.

Vincent is clearly not a fan of this idea, but relents as you offer to split your rewards with George and he can keep his. Now that Vincent has been mollified, George asks for a few extra supplies before you set out.

name: Parts Unknown III
text: After a moment of thought, Vincent asks you for some parchment and coal to sketch out your journey, so you don’t get lost.

name: Parts Unknown IV
text:
Putting the parchment on the ground, Vincent makes a brief sketch of the area you’re heading.

He notes down some significant areas:


Whispering Creek
Jundland Desert
Sinking Swamp
Unknown Lands


“We’re going to the Unknown Lands and looking for Castrum Romuska, which is an old abandoned castle. The journey shouldn’t take more than a few days, let’s ensure we have everything we need – speaking of, let’s pack some food and travelling cloaks for the journey and be on our way!”

He hands you a second parchment with what else to pack.

name: Parts Unknown V
text:
Your journey takes many days. The horses require reshoeing, the cloaks need repairing, but overall your trip is remarkably uneventful thanks to Vincent's excellent guidance and leadership.


In a moment of curiosity, your group tried to veer off the path to see the famed Whispering Creek. Even with Vincent guiding you, the location evaded your party, even as you looked at the map. Well, another problem for another time.


As your journey continues, Vincent constantly scouts ahead for new information, while you discover that George has a pleasant singing voice. He also enjoys sharing stories from his days as a soldier, and has a great knack for storytelling.

name: Parts Unknown VI
text:
As you set up camp for the evening, George continues to sing a song he has composed along your journey. His story of a love lost is one you continue to find beautiful and haunting - you hope he finishes it one day.

An hour later, Vincent arrives back at camp with news of a great castle rising on the horizon to the south. He watched the castle for signs of life and found none, and suggests that tomorrow you should expect to arrive at the castle proper.

Vincent finishes setting up camp with both snares and tricks to alert you to any intruders to your camp. His professionalism and skill are daunting and comforting, and you rest easy with the knowledge of yet one more good night of sleep and a big adventure tomorrow.

name: Parts Unknown VII
text:
As you crest another hill, you see a castle in the distance. Sunlight spills off the castle in odd directions, giving it a luminescent and odd gleam as you walk towards it. You can see familiar workings of steam and crystal, but as you get closer you see more gears and contraptions that are odd to your eyes. As you approach the front gate, a voice suddenly pierces the air!


“GOOD DAY! WHAT IS IT YOU REQUIRE?”


The voice is very odd, and always carries the same intonation. It’s very uncomfortable on your ears. Vincent steps forward and tells the gate they wish to enter.


After a long pause, the voice returns:


“REQUEST NOTED. ENTRY WILL BE GRANTED AFTER SERVICES RENDERED.”


There emits a buzzing noise from the gate and a small piece of parchment emits from a slot with the words:

ENTRY TICKET/Front Gate Repairs


“PLEASE TURN ALL REQUIRED MATERIALS IN TO THE REQUIRED RECEPTACLE.”

name: Parts Unknown VIII
text:
As you bring back the materials, a slot opens where you’re able to deposit them all. A tattered gate swings open, and by both the creaking and grinding, you conclude the castle has seen better days. Those materials are going to be useful to…whomever needed them.


“WELCOME TRAVELERS TO CASTLE ROMUSKA! I AM ROMUSKA’S ONLY OFFICIAL MAINTENANCE BAYESIAN AUTOMATON. IT HAS BEEN MANY CYCLES SINCE I HAVE SEEN HUMANS ENTER. PLEASE STATE YOUR NAME AND PURPOSE.” 


Vincent again steps forward and proclaims confidently, “My name is Vincent and I am travelling with my companions at the behest of another. We are here seeking the energy stone. We come in peace.”


Again, there is a long pause between Vincent’s statement and a response.


“THANK YOU FOR VISITING THE CASTLE, PLEASE NOTE REPAIRS ARE REQUIRED TO ACCESS THE AREA YOU HAVE IMPLIED. I WILL GUIDE YOU TO YOUR DESTINATION.”


On your right, an extremely long parchment emits from a slot in the very odd shaped walls.

Door 0001 (biological naming standard “Front door”) requires repair
Room 0001A (biological naming standard "Hallway A”) requires door 0001J repair
Room 0001B (biological naming standard "Dormitory B”)
Room 0001C (biological naming standard "Dormitory C”)
Room 0001D (biological naming standard "Dormitory D”)
Room 0001E (biological naming standard "Dormitory E”)
Room 0001F (biological naming standard "Dormitory F”)
Room 0001G (biological naming standard "Dormitory G”)
Room 0001H (biological naming standard "Dormitory H”)
Room 0001I (biological naming standard "Dormitory I”)
Room 0001J (biological naming standard "Hallway B”) requires door 0001J repair, requires door 0011E repair
Room 0011A (biological naming standard “Kitchen A”)
Room 0011A-01A (biological naming standard "Pantry”)
Room 0011A-02A (biological naming standard "Utensil storage”)
Room 0011B (biological naming standard "Lavatory”)
Room 0011C (biological naming standard "Library”)
Room 0011D (biological naming standard “Recreation Room”)
Room 0011E (biological naming standard “Hallway B”) requires door 0011E repair
Room 0012A (biological naming standard “Infirmary A”)
Room 0012B (biological naming standard “Storage Closet A”)
Room 0012C (biological naming standard “Elevator Lobby 1”) requires Elevator repair

“PLEASE TURN ALL REQUIRED MATERIALS IN TO THE REQUIRED RECEPTACLE”

You see an open slot in the wall next to what appears to be the front door. The door has certainly deteriorated. Some of the metal on the front of the door seems to have rusted through, you can see rotting boards underneath. The door handle is ready to fall off. You’re pretty sure, just like with the gate, that you have to put the repair materials in the slot next to the door.

name: Experimental Bait II
text: Thomas' friend lied to him. However, he heard from his brother who heard from a friend that Sweet Roots worked better as bait, and wants to try it out.

name: Parts Unknown IX
text:
Immediately after dropping the repair materials in the slot, the front door very slowly begins to creak open inward.

As it starts to open, the location the previous voice came from emits what sounds simply like “WHOOSH”. When you turn to look in that direction, the voice states: “THE DOOR HAS MALFUNCTIONED AND IS NO LONGER CAPABLE OF CREATING THE ‘WHOOSH’ SOUND. IT IS MY RESPONSIBILITY TO ATTEND TO THE FAILINGS OF THIS FACILITY."

With directions in tow, you, George, and Vincent head to the foyer. It is at once both a testament to the castle’s long-gone opulence and current despondent and abandoned nature. As you make your way through the room, gems cover the ceiling and walls to create strange patterns. There are paintings, decorations, and other valuable looking items every which way you look. As you look to your comrades, Vincent seems unfazed, but George’s eyes are alight with wonder.

To each side of the hallway, you see several doors that appear to have been very well kept. They are labeled strangely, matching what you see on the parchment: ROOM 0001B, and below this, you read what appears to be a person’s name on each door.


At the end of the foyer, a steel door covered in plush material stands in your way. A slot in the door opens and a broken looking eye extends out.
“WELCOME TO ROOM 0001A, BIOLOGICAL ENTITIES HAVE TITLED THIS ‘HALLWAY A’. DOOR 0001J HAS HAD ITS OBSERVATIONAL MATRIX DAMAGED DUE TO DISREPAIR AND DISUSE. PLEASE PROVIDE THE REQUISITE MATERIALS TO MOVE FORWARD.”

name: Parts Unknown X
text:
Once you have deposited the materials for whatever the “observational matrix” is, the door opens. Inside, you see a rather plain hallway. The room numbers are still on every door, but you also see familiar words, like “kitchen” and “library”. This section of the building looks to have been well kept, similar to the rooms in the previous hallway. You notice that everything that seems to be used by people has been maintained, while all of the mysterious things like “observational matrix” have been left in disrepair.

At the far end of the hallway, another broken looking eye comes out of the door saying, “THE GRAVITATIONAL POSITRONIC MATRIX HAS MALFUNCTIONED IN THE NEXT SECTION. PLEASE PROVIDE THE REQUISITE MATERIALS TO MOVE FORWARD.”

name: Parts Unknown XI
text: In the next hallway, you see an Infirmary and a Storage Closet. You also see a door at the end of the hallway. There are two slots in a metal plate next to the door, which is labelled “Elevator”. Rummaging through the things you have with you, you notice that moonstones would fit perfectly in these slots.

name: Parts Unknown XII
text:
Once you have placed the stones in the metal panel, the door slides to one side. The now familiar eye comes down from the ceiling, and tells you, “PLACE LUNAR MATERIAL IN THE BOTTOM TWO OPENINGS TO ACCESS FLOOR 2.”

Looking inside the strange contraption, you see another metal plate, with 16 openings, exactly like the ones you placed the moonstones in that opened this door.

name: Parts Unknown XIII
text:
As you place the first stone, it begins to glow faintly, and the door slides closed. Once you have placed the second stone, both orbs glow. Nothing else happens, and you, George, and Vincent all look at each other, wondering what to do next. The eye extends and says, “PRESS THE BUTTON FOR THE FLOOR YOU DESIRE TO ATTEND TO.”


You reach out a hand, and press the button labelled “2”. Nothing happens. The eye says, “YOU NEED TO PAY THE TOLL.” You notice a slot that is labeled “TOKENS HERE”.


After a moment, George suggests that some of the ancient coins he's seen you carry around match the size of the open slot, and shrugging, you provide them.

name: Parts Unknown XV
text:
As the three of you feel the elevator move ever upwards, you hear the voice,
“ERROR! ELEVATOR IS NOT MOVING TO PREDETERMINED FLOORS! THIS IS A CLASS C SUBSECTION 4 VIOLATION OF THE ROMUSKAN CLAUSE FOR COHABITATION OF VISITORS AND AUTOMATONS. BE WARNED, IF YOU DO NOT TURN BACK – “

The elevator stops and with a pleasant ding, the doors slide open to reveal a dilapidated office clearly in need of repair. A machine is sitting at the desk, with what seem to be wires running from a sphere into the robot in a very haphazard manner.

“ - I WILL BE FORCED TO CONTACT THE ROMUSKAN AUTHORI - “


The robot eye moves towards you and you see it focus and unfocus quickly.


“AH YES, WELCOME TO THE MAIN OFFICE OF ROMUSKA CASTLE - AS YOU CAN SEE - WE HAVE A BIT OF A MAINTENANCE PROBLEM. IF YOU WOULD BE SO KIND AS TO CLEAN UP AND GIVE ME 134,217,728 SILVER, I WOULD GLADLY BE RID OF THE PROBLEMS OF THIS CASTLE AND THIS WORTHLESS ENERGY CORE THAT HAS STOPPED ME FROM COMPLETING MY TASKS.”

name: Parts Unknown XIX
text:
While you retrace your steps back to the entrance, ROOMBA continues to list off problems with each area, and you hope it is quieter for the final journey home.
“ROOM 0011A NEEDS 256 RUBIES, ROOM 0001J REQUIRES 512 MOONSTONES, 1024 GOLDEN FEATHER, AND 2048 JADE...ROOM 0001A REQUIRES...CALCULATING...2047 LEMON QUARTZ...ODDITY DETECTED…” ROOMBA whirrs and becomes mercifully silent.
As you approach the gate, you see that it is closed and George groans a bit to your side. You stand there for a moment before ROOMBA speaks up again.
