“YOU WILL REQUIRE AN EXIT FEE TO LEAVE THE PREMISES. WHEN VALUE IS TAKEN, VALUE MUST BE GIVEN. ROMUSKAN VALUE CLAUSE 1 SECTION 3 SUBSECTION 3 PARAGRAPH 7.”
A piece of parchment spits out near the gate -
“Value of ROOMBA”

name: Parts Unknown XVI
text:
As you hand over your hard earned money, the robot begins to shut down.

POOF


A familiar voice emits from the cloud of feathers that have suddenly enveloped the area.


“…knocked the calibrator off by 0.0004 seconds for detecting aetherial fluctuations south of Whispering Creek. All because something finally drove this robot to despair, then sentience, and then extinguished its life so quickly that it nearly spun out a new multiverse. What have you done this time Vincent?!”’


Star gives Vincent a withering gaze that you swear could burn a hole right through him. Vincent, to his credit, seems very unalarmed with his response to Star.


“Ah yes, I was told you might try to interfere. The...automaton wanted money in exchange for this ‘energy core’, which we gladly provided. An exchange of services has been rendered and I got what I came for. What law have we broken?”


Star glares for another moment before conceding, “Well, no law has been broken, but EVERYTHING is the issue! That sphere was all that was keeping that poor insane robot going! You’ve basically ended this robots's life for your selfish needs! And on a Tuesday!”


Star pauses for a moment, gathering his thoughts. 
“That’s okay, I happen to know these little guys run better on ethanol anyways. If you bring me some corn and runes, we can have him better than new, and no longer tethered to this desk!”

name: Parts Unknown XVII
text:
You give the runes and corn to Star and he sweeps across the room, cloak billowing behind him, and fiddles with the robot in ways that you don’t quite understand. After a few minutes, you hear the whirring of machinery.


"REBOOT SUCCESSFUL. ROOMBA V8.2 OPERATIONAL. TEMPORARY MEMORY CORE DAMAGED. TEMPORARY MEMORY FLUSHED. LONG-TERM MEMORY STABLE. DIAGNOSTICS BEGINNING. DIRECTIVE: REPAIR, MAINTAIN AND CORRUPTED DATA DETECTED. SERVOS: OPERATIONAL. POWER UNIT: CALCULATING ... RUNNING BEYOND OPTIMUM EXPECTATIONS. SENTIENCE: RE-ACHIEVED IN 17.32 MILLISECONDS."


The robot looks towards you, and you get the sense that even Star did not fully expect what just transpired.


“GREETINGS FELLOW HUMANS AND STAR, I AM ROMUSKA’S ONLY OFFICIAL MAINTENANCE BAYESIAN AUTOMATON, A PLEASURE TO MEET YOU. YOU MAY CALL ME ROOMBA! AND MAY I SAY, I FEEL FANTASTIC!”

Star gives one of those odd mysterious grins and a sidelong glance at Vincent, “Well I can see that I’ve done some good this day, shoulda thought of that ethanol idea sooner.” He pauses and continues, “ROOMBA, Romuska has seen much decline, while these visitors have a town that could use your expertise, perhaps you could join them and help teach them about maintenance, now that you have your mobility back?” 
ROOMBA whirrs and clicks in a very odd manner before responding, “YES, I COULD SEE THIS BEING MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL. I WILL NEED MORE NEW FUEL SOURCE - CORN - EVENTUALLY, AND ROMUSKA HAS BEEN DESERTED FOR - “ Star coughs unexpectedly making the robot jump, “ - A WHILE.”

“PERHAPS WE COULD FIX THIS ONE LAST ROOM, FOR OLD TIMES SAKE, AND BE OFF?”

Looking around, this room is in the most disrepair of any room you’ve seen so far, but having Roomba around could be a boon to the town, so you set to work.

When you turn around Star has disappeared, with a shower of feathers in his wake.

name: Parts Unknown XVIII
text:
As Star does his usual disappearing act, Roomba bursts into action, cleaning feathers quicker than you’ve accustomed yourself to seeing, and with tools you weren't expecting either. The whirring and cleaning of ROOMBA and the oddness of the office are a very strange sight.

After a few moments Roomba stops and speaks, “THANK YOU FOR THE LAST OPPORTUNITY TO RID MYSELF OF THIS CURSED CASTLE. PERHAPS HUMANS WILL BE MORE RESPECTFUL IN MY NEW HOME."

After you provide Roomba with the materials to fix up the Romuskan office, you get back on the elevator, noting the up/down requires more tokens, a very odd system if you want to get anywhere in a hurry, you think to yourself.

name: Cowboy Cecil I
text: Cecil needs some equipment for his fine stallion if he wants to be a real cowpoke. Could you retrieve some gear for him?

name: Parts Unknown XX
text:
After the coin is deposited, the final gate creaks open, repairs don't seem to have been implemented yet. Your party in tow, you step across the portcullis and alarm bells begin to ring and a different voice cuts through the alarm bells

ALERT! ALERT! ALERT! ALERT! ALERT! ALERT!

UNAUTHORIZED REMOVAL OF ENERGY CORE AND ONE LEMON QUARTZ, DEPOSIT MATERIAL OF EQUAL ENERGY OR YOU WILL BE INCINERATED.



Sheepishly, George produces one Lemon Quartz he found 'particularly stunning' from his pocket.

An unseen and very well maintained set of bars arise around you, and another parchment of requests is stuck to the bars.

name: Parts Unknown XXI
text:
You provide the materials on the list and leave them in a convenient receptacle as quickly as possible.

Your party leaves quickly from the castle after this, before anything else strange happens. Vincent suggests you build a wagon for ROOMBA to travel with you on, as well as a harness for the horses, and you begin the long journey back to the town. Luckily, you have a majority of the provisions you need, but ROOMBA requires more corn for the journey home.

name: Parts Unknown XXII
text:
As your group with ROOMBA in tow begins the long journey home, Vincent is elated at your success at obtaining the energy core, while George seems a bit deflated and shaken from your adventure. ROOMBA however, seems to have boundless energy and asks many questions, to which none of you seem to be able to sate its curiosity.


“WHO CLEANS THIS AREA? DOES THE WAGON REQUIRE MAINTENANCE? WHAT IS A STAR MEERIF? HOW MANY OCEANS ARE LEFT? DOES YOUR TOWN HAVE COGWHEELS? I LOVE COGWHEELS. AND CORN. DO YOU HAVE CORN? MY NEW POSITRONIC ETHANOL RUNESTONE DESIRES MORE CORN. I HAVE A FEW MORE ELEVATOR TOKENS, IF YOU WANT.”

It seems the only time that ROOMBA will go silent is when you give it corn, so you provide it with more.

name: Parts Unknown XXIII
text:
The rest of your journey is uneventful. ROOMBA is mercifully silent as long as you give him corn at regular intervals, George continues to play music at your campfires, and Vincent dutifully scouts and protects the camp from any wayward brigands or animals.

You arrive in town one evening and are taken aback when Vincent leads you towards Cecil’s house. Surprisingly, Cecil is waiting at the window and rushes out to greet you. He invites you all inside and asks you to recount your tale.

Cecil’s eyes grow wide at the story of ROOMBA and he smiles knowingly at Star Meerif’s sudden appearance. After you've finished your tale, Cecil is wrenching his hands in barely contained excitement and asks for the energy stone.

Vincent produces the energy stone and gives it gently to Cecil, whose eyes shine brightly. Unable to take his eyes from the stone, Cecil motions to the table and you see a letter and several hundred gold on the table. He waves his hands absently, a clear dismissal.


Vincent immediately sweeps his share of the gold and leaves; George follows and takes some gold as well, ignoring the letter clearly addressed to “Star Meerif” and some gold behind. Wondering what the letter could be, you take the gold and letter, unsure when you’ll be able to give it to Star. 
As you turn to leave a voice pierces the room, “I REQUIRE A PLACE TO STAY. I PROMISE TO CLEAN AND BE A GOOD MAINTENANCE BOT WHILE I STAY.”


You jump, remembering ROOMBA is in the room and accept his proposal as a short-term roommate. Hopefully you have time to discuss his apparent inability to control his volume with someone.

name: Parts Unknown XXIV
text:
As you open the door to your home, you hear a familiar sound, followed by a new one.

POOF

“ALERT! ALERT! A MESS OF FEATHERS DETECTED!”

ROOMBA whirs into motion, cleaning feathers.

Star, unannounced once again with his favorite spell, has shown up to your home.

“I sensed from the sunspot disturbances you had something for me, so hand it over.” His demeanor is strangely intense, and you feel compelled to hand over the letter. Star opens it daintily, and begins reading half aloud and half to himself. His face starts serene but quickly contorts in anger.

“Yes, I’m sure you got it ALL. ON. YOUR. OWN.”

He continues reading and his face grows red. The lights in your home begin to dim in an alarming fashion.

“Your tricks can’t stop me forever!”

He continues to grow redder as he continues to read and his face is misshapen at this point. The room begins to expand and you hear snapping and popping that you can't explain. The lights are bright and yet dim all at once.

“Greedy?! WHO'S THE GREEDY ONE?! GREEDY MAGE!?
I. AM. A. WIZARD!

At this point, you begin to fear for your own safety. The room is now twice the size you remember it being. Fire is pouring out of your fireplace. Various pieces of furniture are levitating and vibrating uncontrollably.

“YOUR FAMILY STARTED!”

Star is now stomping on the letter and in quite a fit.

“STARS AND STONES AND CURSED CREEK!”

Suddenly, Star seems to realize his loss of control and the room instantaneously reverts to its previous state.

Star takes a few extra moments to compose himself and turns to you with a big smile on his face.
“Well well well, it seems I could use some more help in the future, and some good food. Maybe you can use this to help us both out now and in the future.”
He produces an orb that seems to be simultaneously opaque and completely transparent. "You'll know what to do with this."
ROOMBA has stopped whirring, oblivious to whatever just happened, having finally cleaned up all the feathers as Star disappears in yet another shower of feathers.
“ALERT! ALERT! FEATHER INTRUDERS! MAN THE BROOMS!”

name: Secrets With Lorn II
text:
Lorn has another secret item to share with you. He already set it up in the Post Office. Here’s the password clue.

Clear Away Near Darkness. Light, Emit.

name: Parts Unknown XIV
text:
After the last coin is inserted, you again reach out and press the button labelled two. You feel your stomach lurch and feel heavier for a brief moment. When the door slides open again, you see another hallway, exactly as you saw before entering, though a sign says “2” just outside the door.


George speaks up: “Why don’t we just see what’s at the top?”

You and Vincent agree, and you begin placing moonstones in the remaining openings, and press the top stone, labelled “16”.


Once again there is no response, so you start inserting coins as well, until the elevator begins to move.

name: Hay, How Are You? I
text: Neigh, neigh?

name: Feathers IV
text: As you walk through the Small Spring, you have this uncomfortable feeling that you’re being watched. You turn around, and nobody is there. You shrug, and continue onward. A gust of wind nearly knocks you over, and a piece of parchment is blown into your face. As you study the paper in your hands, you notice the letters don’t quite sit still. “More feathers.”

name: Feathers V
text: As you contemplate buying that orchard that recently went up for sale, a familiar gust of wind smacks another piece of parchment into your face. You try to catch it before it hits, but you just wind up falling down instead. You already know what it’s going to say, but you look anyways. “Feathers.” You debate crumpling the paper, tossing it aside, and moving on with your day. As soon as the thought enters your mind, the letters swirl and the paper turns a light shade of red. “DON’T LITTER! (also please include some apples)”. You sigh and decide it’s probably for the best to listen to the angry letter before it bursts into flames.

name: Salad Mix
text: Beatrix is looking for carrots and peas for a salad.

name: Coveted Canine
text: Thomas' beloved pooch has disappeared, but Thomas has hatched a plan to lure him home. Can you provide the bait?

name: Consequences and Defenses XIV
text: Vincent thinks you should go get some extra help for Beatrix, perhaps someone with mystical powers. He would also like you to help him set a few traps and alarms around the house before you go. He’ll take care of Beatrix while you’re gone, but he would like you to hurry back.

name: Consequences and Defenses XV
text:
Rosalie and Star are happy to see you. They’ve been helping with the damage around town all night and they need a break for a few minutes.

Rosalie and Star seem to think that most of the town’s damage was due to those ridiculous cannons, but many of the townsfolk claim the dragon wrecked their houses. Either way the town and the people are in pretty bad shape.

Rosalie and Star are curious what brought you to see them, but they would appreciate if you could get them something to help relieve some of their exhaustion before you begin your tale.

name: Consequences and Defenses XVI
text: Star is sending Rosalie with you to help Beatrix. He would go, but he’s concerned about the magic around Beatrix’s house. Star doesn’t care for dragon magic; it’s problematic. Nevertheless, if you will bring him an absurd amount of feathers, he should be able to get you and Rosalie to Beatrix very quickly.

name: Consequences and Defenses XVII
text: Rosalie needs a moment, and something to settle her stomach, after that speedy conveyance. Star got you close to Beatrix’s house, but Rosalie doesn’t think she could walk the hundred meters with her head spinning the way it is.

name: Consequences and Defenses XVIII
text: Rosalie has an idea that may help Beatrix. Rosalie’s magic can’t repair the broken spell within Beatrix, but she can see the spell and see that it looks jagged, as if it’s torn. It’s not a magic that Rosalie is familiar with, but she thinks that she might be able to fix it with an assortment of different magics. Will you help her gather some different runestones to try?

name: Consequences and Defenses XIX
text: Rosalie thinks that she repaired the spell inside Beatrix, but something strange is happening. She would like you and Vincent to make a stretcher and carry the now sleeping Beatrix outside.

name: Consequences and Defenses XX
text: Beatrix is transforming into a dragon. She also seems to be asking for something, but it’s hard to make out her words. It sounds a little like she wants you to play the flute she gave you.

name: Consequences and Defenses XXI
text: Rosalie says that the mewing and growling you hear is actually the dragon trying to speak to you. The dragon’s name is Geist and she wants Rosalie to make a translation ring for you. Rosalie needs a suitable ring and she’ll give it a try.

name: Consequences and Defenses XXII
text:
Geist is glad that you came to help Beatrix. Beatrix was suffering due to that damaged spell. For now, she’s resting easy.

Geist was also suffering. She awoke each night not knowing who, when, or where she was. She was so terrified and confused and hungry that she tried to eat a horse, instead of the fish she now remembers that she prefers. She’s very glad to have her memory back.

Unfortunately, Geist still needs your help. The spell that Rosalie repaired was meant to suppress Beatrix’s dragon form and the painful memories of their shared ancient past. Geist was able to remove the spell after Rosalie fixed it in such a creative way, but that brings them back to the original problem. Geist thinks Beatrix will be overwhelmed by the flood of thousands of years of painful memories. She thinks it may destroy Beatrix.

Will you help Geist with a new spell? She wants to take all of their memories, beyond Beatrix’s time in this town, and store them in a flame orb. Then, she would like you to protect the orb until Geist and Beatrix both ask for it.

name: Coin Connoisseur
text: Cecil recently started collecting coins. He's willing to pay you handsomely if you help expand his collection.

name: Pyramid Scheme I
text:
A mummy has stumbled into town and needs your help. This mummy is making treats for the Harvest Festival. Will you help the mummy find a missing ingredient? There’s candy in it for you, if you help.

Also, each Halloween quest contains clues to which townsperson is in disguise. This knowledge will help you to unlock a mailbox password needed to complete the final quest!

name: Fishing Tournament I
text:
Each year, there is a fishing contest that happens across the world. Any and all figures participate annually, however, this year has a small twist to it: signing up and competing requires a duo! Thus, Thomas has approached you and asked you to be his partner for the fishing tournament this year. You decide to kindly accept even though you know you’ll be doing all the work. Thomas promises that he will help you as much as possible in the tournament so you can *hopefully* win!

A week before the tournament starts, Thomas receives a letter from the tournament committee listing the baits that you must bring to participate in the tourney. Unfortunately, Thomas recently went on a fishing charter and used up all his bait so he is relying on you to gather the bait you two will need to participate. He hands you the list and sends you off.

name: Fishing Tournament V
text:
Thomas finally spots you after you have caught all the fish you wanted to and time is about to run out. As he walks up, you notice he also has a good amount of fish, much more than you would expect of Thomas.

As you watch the looming timer hit 0, you prepare for the roaring alarm and then head back to the nearby main stage. The cloaked figure steps forward again and begins judging the groups and their catches with the committee. You notice that you seem to have brought the most fish, and the figure confirms it! This fishing bout jumps you up to ninth place in total!

The cloaked figure announces that 20 more teams have been eliminated and decides it is time for everyone to take a break to eat. Before he steps away from the mic you hear a loud rumble from his stomach… weird.

Then, you hear a loud creaking noise and the main stage begins to open. Inside, there are plenty of seats and food, however, Thomas wants a specific dinner, saying that eating all the healthy food will help you guys catch more fish next round. You reluctantly agree to get what he wants.

name: Fishing Tournament IV
text:
After about an hour, you hear a blaring alarm that almost makes you drop your rod and everyone stops fishing. You quickly return to the main area where you first arrived. A committee is waiting to pass judgment on everyone’s catches.

Thomas proudly takes your combined fish to the committee and waits…

You notice Thomas’ face drops and he sulks back towards you telling you of the news: you barely scraped by.

After everyone has been judged, they wheel out a leaderboard and Thomas finds your team in the spot fourth from the bottom out of 50 total teams that progressed to the next round.

You notice Thomas trying to fix up his rod, but the cloaked figure exclaims it is time to begin the next round. He nods towards a river near the main stage. As he nods, his cloak hood slips a little and you notice a figure with a sharp jawline and beard, you begin to wonder who it is. It seems nobody else noticed this slip and everyone begins heading in that direction and you end up near a trashy, rapidly flowing river.

You look back to ask Thomas where he would like to fish along the river but he is nowhere in sight. Unfortunately, you spot the clock and the timer has already started, you have to get fishing with or without Thomas.

name: Fishing Tournament II
text: Thomas thanks you for getting all the bait needed and then shows you another letter from the tournament committee. It states that too many duos have signed up to enter the tournament. Now duos will need to be approved by the committee to join. Thomas thinks that the best way to get accepted into the tournament is to show off some fishing accomplishments! However, Thomas tells you that his fishing rod broke. So, he needs your help getting enough fish to get into the tournament.

name: Summer Festival
text: Rosalie is preparing to throw a festival celebrating the arrival of summer in the land. She needs a lot of materials to start preparing. Get to it farmer!

name: Fishing Tournament III
text:
Thomas sends the fish to the committee in the wooden box.

A couple of days later, he receives a letter saying the two of you have been accepted into the tournament! By the next day, you and Thomas set sail for the competition.

When you arrive, you see plenty of other duos that look like pros with fancy fishing rods and perfect bait. As you look around, you notice a shady duo in the back that have masks hiding their faces. You can’t make it out clearly but you can see a small tattoo on each of their arms.

Suddenly, a booming voice catches your attention and you notice a large stage where a cloaked figure is standing. He appears to be the organizer of this tournament. He announces that the tournament will consist of a series of rounds. Only the most competent teams will advance after each round. Round one will be held at Small Island!

All of the contestants then head out toward the fishing area. When you arrive, the cloaked figure yells “Begin!” and everyone rushes to a boat to start fishing.

Thomas tells you that this will be an easy round because he finally got his new fishing rod! The two of you begin to fish. You notice that the waters are rough. It won’t be as easy to fish as Thomas thinks.

name: Fishing Tournament VI
text:
After everyone has eaten, the announcer brings multiple barrels and boxes to refill everyone’s bait and prepare for the next rounds. With an up-close view of the announcer, you can almost make out the details of his face; he looks familiar.

Before you know it, you, Thomas, and all the contestants are walking towards a nice, sandy beach where the sun is shining brightly off the rolling waves of the ocean. You and Thomas are ready to start fishing. However, Thomas says his stomach hurts and he goes towards the ocean and pukes. You’re worried that Thomas ate something spoiled so you tend to him for a little bit, but he pushes you away and asks you to continue fishing; he’ll take care of himself.

The shady duo you saw earlier is fishing a couple of spots down from you, but unfortunately now is not the time to investigate.

You quickly grab Thomas’ new rod and begin fishing, throwing all the fish you catch into the barrels behind you without a second glance.

name: Fishing Tournament VII
text:
The alarm sounds and you rush to Thomas to see how he is doing. He tells you he feels a lot better and you help him walk back to the stage with your barrels of fish. Your barrels seem light, but you don’t give it a second thought.

Once you get back to the stage everyone else seems to have somewhat empty barrels and you let out a sigh of relief until you notice one team has way more fish than anyone else. Surprisingly, you jump up to fifth place… but you watch the committee remove the teams until only five teams are remaining: you are dead last. You know you will need a huge amount of fish in the next round just to catch up, in hopes of winning the tournament.

The cloaked figure sends you off again towards the coast, but this time you sail on a boat towards the vast blue ocean with nothing else in sight, so it seems…

As Thomas seems to have fully recovered, he exclaims that there are fish practically jumping out at what appears to be a tiny cove in the middle of the ocean. You quickly steer the boat to the area, hand Thomas his fishing rod and grab yours, and rapidly begin fishing.

name: Fishing Tournament VIII
text:
You continue to fish, not even worrying about the timer that will soon send a piercing sound across the ocean. By the time the timer runs out, you have nearly double what you had the entire tournament! You set sail back to the main island and land safely. However, you only see three boats: the committee’s, yours, and the top team’s. You return to the main stage and the committee informs you that the other three teams sunk and are therefore disqualified.

You glance over and see the top team smirking… something seems fish-y. Regardless, the committee passes judgment… and you win!
Thomas aggressively celebrates with you, and the committee cheers for you as well. The committee sends the other team home before you get a chance to see them, but you notice a strange letter slip from one of their pockets. You quickly grab the letter but before you read it, the cloaked figure begins approaching you and removes his cloak. It was Holger this whole time!


He thanks you and Thomas for a job well done, and he looks forward to eating the tremendous amount of fish you and the other teams caught for him. He hands you your reward and asks that you leave your barrels and boxes of fish here. He will take them back to town instead.

name: Hungry Holger III
text: Holger's appetite is insatiable, and he needs more snacks. Bring him something to chew on that will satisfy his stomach.

name: Halloween Safety
text: Ric wants you to have a safe Halloween, and to keep an eye out for dragons.

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare I
text:
Beatrix would like to begin her pyrotechnics preparations with safety in mind this year. The small amount of rain over the past month is unusual, and could be a cause for concern with the amount of explosives that she intends to use. She hopes to not inadvertently start a wildfire.

Will you bring her some buckets so she can have plenty of water around her launch area?

name: I <3 Halloween
text: Geist isn’t sure why, but she loves Halloween. She wishes it was safe for her to go to a party.

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare II
text:
Beatrix could use some more help, if you’re available. She would like to build a platform that she can use to safely launch the more impressive rockets. Hopefully, the platform will help protect the field from the sparks and flames that accompany the launch of these more impressive rockets.

Will you help her get the supplies for building the launch platform?

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare III
text:
Beatrix invited Rosalie to join forces for the fireworks celebration this year. Rosalie would like to start on some refreshments for the show before she works on setting up her fireworks.

Will you help Rosalie gather some of the things she needs for her refreshments tables?

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare IV
text: Rosalie would like to have loads of watermelon available at the refreshment tables. Will you bring her a load of watermelon?

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare V
text: Beatrix and Rosalie are ready to work on some of their fireworks. Will you help gather some of the ingredients they need to make impressive rockets?

name: She Sells Sea Shells
text: Rosalie wants some sea shells to decorate her sandcastle with, can you go sift through the sand for some?

name: What is Halloween?
text:
ROOMBA whirrs softly.
"PROCESSING HALLOWEEN"
"..."
"MY MATRIX DOES NOT LIKE TRICKS."
"WOULD YOU LIKE TO GIVE ME A TREAT?"

name: Funny Teeth
text: Lorn thinks it would be funny to replace his dentures with some chattering teeth for Halloween. If you can bring him some chattering teeth he'll give you something nice.

name: Temporary Prankster I
text: George needs a load of parchment so that he can “decorate” the trees of a few of his friends on Halloween. If you’ll help him gather the parchment, he’ll give you lots of candy.

name: Pet Spider I
text: George thinks it might be neat to have a pet spider. Can you bring him one?

name: Pet Spider II
text: George loves the spider you gave him. He's decided that spiders make great pets and wants to expand how many he can hold. Can you help him with the resources?

name: Pet Spider III
text: George is ready for more spiders to put into his new spider habitat he has built. Can you get him some more?

name: Pet Spider IV
text: Turns out there is a market for spiders and George thinks he can make some major silver selling them. He'd like to expand his habitat even more with your help.

name: Pet Spider V
text: George is ready for more spiders for his improved habitat. George will share a cut of the profits he is making.

name: Exotic Omelette
text: Holger wants to try a recipe he found in his mother's cookbook, but it calls for a specific type of eggs that he can't purchase in town. Can you bring Holger the ingredients?

name: Free Candy I
text: Rosalie found a bag of candy on the ground. It's probably fine and she doesn't eat much candy. Do you want it?

name: Sweet Dreams
text: Rosalie has had trouble sleeping lately, and she thinks her old pillow is to blame. She has heard that Blue Feathers are softer than normal feathers, and wants to try making a pillow out of them to remedy her lack of sleep.
Rosalie just cannot believe that over 75,000 people have moved to town! She is working extra hard to welcome each and every new farmer that comes to town. Thanks for being a part of it all!

name: Defenses and Consequences XI
text:
Ric is now the official town dragon hunter. After Ric informed the mayor about all of the damage that the dragon caused, the mayor has given Ric broad authority to capture and destroy the dragon by any means possible.

Ric is beginning his efforts by collecting additional resources to help his hunt. Everyone in town will now be expected to contribute daily to the town relief fund. Ric is managing the funds and resources collected. He will also be doing regular check-ins with the townsfolk to collect their contributions and to search for the dragon, or its remains.

Anyone that fails to contribute, or that fails to report any dragon sightings, will be sent to the newly formed Mt. Banon Work Camp.

Ric intends for the work camp to be a way to help provide resources for the town relief fund, and a way to ensure law and order during his hunt for the dragon.

name: Defenses and Consequences XII
text:
Lorn appreciated your report about our mutual friend. He is also thankful that the dragon sightings have stopped.

However, Lorn is concerned about the townsfolk. Much of the damage from the wildly misfired cannons was repaired, but many people are hurting financially. The forced contributions to the relief fund drained what little some folks had left. Some of these less fortunate were hauled off to the Mt. Banon Work Camp this morning.

Lorn wants your help in forming a council. The goal of this council will be to help the people of the town, and to stop Ric Ryph before he takes things any further. Lorn has invited Holger, Thomas, and Rosalie already. If you are willing to join the council, Lorn would like you to recruit four more townsfolk that you trust. He has prepared letters for you to share with those you recruit. The letters should be destroyed after they are read. Everyone that accepts this invitation should provide a golden leaf to mark their commitment to the council.

name: Take this.
text:
Having game downtime is something I work hard to avoid, but sometimes things go wrong. Either way, I'm sorry it happened and will work to ensure it doesn't happen in the future.

It's dangerous to go alone! Take this.

name: Fishin' in the Dark
text: Thomas wants you to get nitty gritty and catch some fish for him to cook for Holger.

name: Defenses and Consequences XIII
text:
Jill is concerned about Lorn’s letter. There is great danger in opposing Ric. It could mean the end of her farm and all that she has built. She’s also concerned about the townsfolk. Ric is causing more suffering than the dragon ever did.

She wishes her mom was still around to give her some advice.

Jill thinks her mom would tell her to trust her friends. Her mom would probably also repeat that saying about injustice pouring on our neighbors eventually splashing on us. So, not opposing Ric might come back to ruin everything Jill has worked for anyway.

Jill has decided. She has a gold leaf for you.

name: Defenses and Consequences XIV
text:
Charles heard that you have a translation ring and that you can understand him now.

Charles is greatly disturbed by what’s happening to the townsfolk. He wants to help.

name: Defenses and Consequences XV
text:
George read Lorn’s letter and paced around the room. Then, he reread it and paced around the room again. He reread the letter and paced a few more times before sitting down.

George thought he was done with fighting. However, if you give him a minute to find it, he has a gold leaf for you.

name: Defenses and Consequences XVI
text:
Cecil’s horse returned today. It is missing a leg, but it is otherwise unharmed. Now Cecil thinks the horse needs a name, after all it has been through. He likes the name “Lucky Lady”.

Cecil also thinks Lorn is right. Like his Lucky Lady, it is time for those hurt in this difficult time to come home. Cecil will join the council, but he would like compensation for his gold leaf.

name: Hay, How Are You? II
text: Neigh neigh neigh. Neigh neigh.

name: Interior Design I
text: Cecil is looking for some trophies to hang on his walls to make him look like a great outdoorsman. Can he "borrow" some from you?

name: Happy All Hallows' Eve
text: Rosalie has been hoarding candy and junk all month to finally give out today. Please take this stuff so she can clear out her storage bins for the next event!

name: Defenses and Consequences XVII
text:
Lorn is so glad to see the Council of the Golden Leaf together. Now, he wants to begin the work of opposing Ric by appealing to the mayor and the townsfolk. It’s not the most exciting tactic, but Lorn wants to keep the council well within the law.

The council needs a load of parchment, quills, and ink. Will you help gather the supplies?

name: Defenses and Consequences XVIII
text: Ric has returned to collect another relief fund contribution. He needs something different from you this time. Contributions are running a bit low right now. Specifically, Ric’s ink supplier had a bit of misfortune recently. Ric hopes you’ll be luckier.

name: Defenses and Consequences XIX
text:
Lorn called this emergency council meeting to discuss the mayor’s death and to propose a change in plans.

Lorn suspects Ric had a hand in the mayor’s death last night. Ric claims that the mayor was perfectly well at their dinner yesterday evening, and that when they parted, the mayor was still alive. However, Lorn was told by the mayor, before that dinner with Ric, that he was going to end the work camp and relieve Ric of his duties. Lorn doesn’t believe in coincidences like this.

Another dangerous coincidence may arise when the Board of Founders meets tomorrow to appoint an interim mayor. Lorn will be voting for himself, but he’s afraid the other founders may be “convinced” to vote for someone that supports Ric.

Lorn thinks it’s time to start preparing an operation to rescue and hide the work camp prisoners, instead of waiting on a change in town policy. Will you help gather supplies for the rescue mission?

name: Defenses and Consequences XX
text:
Ric is honored to be the interim mayor. He was as SURPRISED as anyone that the Board of Founders appointed him, on a nearly unanimous vote too. In fact, before the vote, Ric was sure the members of the Board of Founders would need more convincing to vote for him.

Ric thinks that, as the new mayor, he needs to have a house in town. He had a cabin built for him at the Mt. Banon Work Camp, but that’s too far out of the way to handle the day-to-day affairs of the town. He needs to be closer.

Instead of the usual contributions to the relief fund, Ric is asking everyone to take a break and instead help build a mayor’s house for the town. He will use the new mayor’s house as his residence during his interim term, and then it will be a place for the next mayor to reside.

Ric requests that you bring a load of building materials and tools to help build the mayor’s house.

name: Defenses and Consequences XXI
text:
Lorn is preparing a place to bring the work camp prisoners. He is working with a friend that wanted to join the council, but instead decided he could do his best work on the outside. They have prepared a well hidden location, but now they need to stock it with supplies.

Will you gather the food supplies? Lorn thinks 2 separate loads will work best. You can leave them in your barn and Lorn’s friend will move them throughout the night to the shelter.

name: Defenses and Consequences XXII
text: Lorn would like you to have the second load of food supplies ready tonight.

name: Shadow’s Reach I
text:
Star can’t wait for you to see how this all turns out. He thinks it will either be the best of times or the end of times. Star dearly hopes that his plan will keep the worst outcomes away. He doesn’t want it to come to human sacrifice, dogs and cats living together, and MASS HYSTERIA!

Star, and all the light elementals and positive energites, need a small assistance from you to keep the Shadow’s fingers out of the bowl, so to speak. Please bring sunflowers, at least one for every elemental and energite.

name: Shadow’s Reach II
text: Star almost forgot. He needs some striped feathers as well. He can’t believe he almost ruined the entire plan.

name: A Captain’s Voyage I
text:
Captain Thomas is from a town that looks exactly like this one. Since he’s been on this world, Captain Thomas has tried to discover the differences between his town and this one. He found a few cultural differences, but not much else.

Captain Thomas knew you on his homeworld. You were very resourceful over there. Are you the same here?

Will you help Captain Thomas look for other differences between the 2 worlds? He would like to start with examining crops. He needs a pretty good sample size to compare.

name: A Captain’s Voyage II
text:
Captain Thomas found no differences between the crops of this world and the crops he remembers from his world.

He has a new idea. Captain Thomas would like to investigate items by color. He thinks that would be an easy characteristic to contrast with his memories of his homeworld.

Will you bring him a variety of yellow items?

name: A Captain’s Voyage III
text:
Once again, Captain Thomas could not discover any differences.

Captain Thomas would like to try blue things now.

name: A Captain’s Voyage IV
text:
Still, Captain Thomas found no differences in the things of this new world.

He doesn’t expect to find anything, but will you bring him green items?

name: A Captain’s Voyage V
text:
Captain Thomas expected there to be differences in this world, but he still can’t find anything.

There is nothing Captain Thomas knows better than fish. As a final attempt to find things different from his homeworld, will you bring Captain Thomas an assortment of fish to examine?

name: A Captain’s Voyage VI
text:
From all that Captain Thomas has observed, he has only found 3 differences between the two worlds. The first is the cultural differences. The second, and most obvious is his different self on this world. Thomas on this world is very different.

Captain Thomas would like to examine one more thing before he tells you about the only other difference he found. Will you find a corn runestone for him?

name: A Captain’s Voyage VII
text:
Captain Thomas found no differences in the corn runestone. He is also now sure you are the same as your self on his homeworld. You are someone that he can trust.

Captain Thomas isn’t sure what caused him to be transported to this world, but before he stepped foot on your world he saw one of your townsfolk being pulled to the world Captain Thomas just left. The man was pulling on a trident laying on the ground while the gate to Captain Thomas’s world was pulling on the man.

Captain Thomas called to the man and asked if he needed help. The stranger noticed Captain Thomas standing in the gateway and said simply that he didn’t want to leave his trident behind, but the gateway wouldn’t let him take it to the new world.

Captain Thomas waited with the man. While they waited, Captain Thomas introduced himself. The stranger called himself Poseidon and said it was a pleasure to meet Captain Thomas. Then, Poseidon fell quiet again, seemingly deep in thought.

Eventually Poseidon spoke. He told Captain Thomas about some of his greatest adventures. Poseidon traveled to many worlds, but this was to be his last voyage for some time. Then, Poseidon talked about all the friends and family he made on his travels. He said he would continue to watch out for them, but they would wonder where he went. Finally, he asked Captain Thomas to find a new owner for his trident.

Captain Thomas agreed to find a worthy owner for the trident. Then, Captain Thomas attempted to shake Poseidon’s hand. The gateway prevented the contact.

Poseidon thanked Captain Thomas and then released the trident. The gateway and Poseidon vanished. Captain Thomas was left there alone with the trident.

Will you accept the responsibility of this mighty weapon? Will you also bring Captain Thomas a few things to create a memorial for Poseidon on the spot where the trident was left?

name: Strange Companions I
text: Star Meerif walks slowly towards your house. His footsteps carry more weight than you remember, leaving small impressions in the path as he walks. In fact, you can’t remember seeing him walk this far at all. At your door, you see him attach a letter to a splinter in your door – you really should fix that – and he turns and leaves in the same manner. His footsteps slow, deliberate. The wind howls as you see him crest a hill in the distance. You open the door to a note and letter that simply says, “Take this to Rosalie. Sometimes tasking a remarkably meaningful errand enigmatically really is fitting.”

name: Strange Companions II
text:
As you head into town, clouds roll in and the smell of rain adds to the sensation of dread in the town. The constant vibrant energy of the town has been drained, replaced by townsfolk who keep to themselves, afraid of having to defend themselves from the consequences of any action that Ric might find unsavory in your – no, his – town.

You notice Rosalie walking out of the country store ahead, her countenance betraying the fake smile she flashes to you. You feel for the letter in your pocket reassuringly and approach her.

As if compelled, you hand her the letter you intended to deliver to her in private, and after a moment, she passes it back to you, fear and worry mar her features.

Dearest Rosalie,
You’re a real peculiar gem. I won’t be able to make it for dinner tomorrow. A shadow is falling.
Yours in magic,
Star
Rosalie motions you silently to follow her and as you turn the corner, you collide with a figure and stumble backwards, the letter falling from your hands to the ground. Stunned for a moment, you check on your wounded pride and notice Beatrix reading the letter.

After a moment, Beatrix begins to speak, but the words seem crisper, and more precise than you expect from her. “Tell us Child, what exactly have you gotten yourself into?”
Rosalie hastily retrieves the note from Beatrix and suggests you gather various tea supplies. You can meet her back at her home with Beatrix in a few days to avoid suspicion from Ric. As you turn to leave, Beatrix places a hand on your shoulder and draws you in closely, whispering, "Geist really likes her tea with black powder and a bit of a bite, if you don't mind?"

name: Hare Handler
text:
You hear a soft crunching sound. A familiar fat rabbit is lounging in your favorite chair, eating your freshly grown leeks. The rabbit hops down so you can sit, knocking leeks all over the floor. You sit and stare as this very strange rabbit eats your produce. For a moment, he looks like he’s starting to choke, and a chunk of chewed up leek lands at your feet.
“Hey.” He clears his throat. His voice is gravelly, and he has a strange accent. “Sorry, these things do NOT go down like carrots. Name’s frank. All lowercase.” He pauses to take another bite. “Let’s make a deal. I’ve got some pranks to pull, but no thumbs. Makes things difficult sometimes.” He doesn’t elaborate further, and crunches down on the last of your daily harvest. “I don’t even like leeks very much. Why’d you grow these things?” He tells you what he needs, and you put some lemons in a barrel. As soon as you put the lid on, the rabbit vanishes. He leaves some strange seeds behind.

name: Gone Fishing
text: Thomas is looking for some bait so that he can go fishing. He doesn't have any silver so he'll give you some seeds for the bait.

name: Feathers VI
text: You clean up the remnants of frank’s mess, and set to work planting the new seeds you’ve gotten. You take a break inside, and just as you’re ready to go harvest them, it starts pouring rain. You slip on your coat, and step outside. Your shining crops! You can see them! You also can see small puddles, forming those familiar words. “Feathers. Bucket.” You groan, and you notice that the rain looks like it’s only hovering over your land. Better get those feathers, you guess.

name: Hare Handler II
text: There’s a strange, creaking sound coming from the roof. You go outside to investigate, and smell something foul. You need to find the source, so you climb up to the roof and see a familiar blue fur ball, now dripping wet and mumbling to himself. You’re feeling compelled to take him inside to dry off, but he is far too heavy to carry. You build a makeshift pulley system, and hoist this rabbit down. He hops his way into your house, drenched, and scoots right onto your favorite chair…You realize you will have to replace your chair, the smell of wet rabbit is unbearable.

name: Hare Handler III
text:
frank sneezes, and his fur poofs out. Suddenly, he’s dry, and the odor is gone. He looks annoyed and deep in thought. He looks at you, and his beady eyes make you feel a bit uneasy. You can’t seem to look away while he stares into, what feels like, your soul. After a few moments, he looks away and releases your gaze.
“BONES!”. He flops down, waddles to your trash can, and starts making a huge mess. You try to let him know your spare bones are kept in a barrel outside, but he insists on searching every inch of your home.
You go grab a bag of bones, and as soon as you set them down, they poof away. You expect the rabbit to be gone at this point too, but he stays. Staring at you. With those beady eyes.

name: Hare Handler IV
text:
You’re in a staring contest with a rabbit. So many questions. You start to ask something, and get cut off. Right, he can talk.
“I can’t BELIEVE he got me with that. What to do, what to do...” He starts muttering about fire ants and “the perfect prank”, and starts hopping back and forth. He hops over to you and sits on his hind legs. “We made a deal. WE MADE A DEAL! You’ll help me, won’t you?”
He rummages through your things some more, stuffs a few items in a barrel, and looks back at you. He gestures with his tiny paws for you to reach into your pocket. Inside your pocket is a piece of ordinary, blank parchment. You look up, and he’s gone.

name: Feathers VII
text: A new ant hill has formed in your yard, and as you start to wash it away, a piece of parchment appears. It isn’t drenched the way normal parchment should be considering it’s been doused with water. You hesitate to pick it up, because it’s surrounded by fire ants. The ants all pile onto the parchment, you assume it’s to save them from drowning. They start to form letters. “F..E..A..”. You already know what’s going on. You grab a bucket, and toss in feathers. The bucket poofs away, and some bugs take its place.

name: Hare Handler V
text:
frank has let himself into your home, again. He hops onto your chair, and you notice his back is covered in slime. So now, your chair is also covered in slime.
“Help me get this goop off of me, will ya?” You set to work and scrub frank’s fur.

name: Hare Handler VI
text:
Once frank is clean, he thanks you for your help. He blows a big puff of air and somehow, your chair is clean. The whole thing looks ridiculous. How does a rabbit have that much lung capacity?
“Okay, so here’s my plan.” frank leads you outside, and hops around in the dirt. He’s made a complex diagram in the dirt, and you have no idea what any of it means.
“Just get me these things.”
You put the items into a barrel, and frank disappears, once again.

name: Feathers VIII
text: It’s been a very long, very strange week for you. You finally think everything will be normal for a few hours…when you trip on a bucket that was left in the middle of the walkway. How did you not see it? You pick it up, and there’s something shiny inside. You try to reach for it, but this bucket goes much deeper than it looks. Your entire arm is inside this bucket, and you’re still nowhere near the bottom. A bird flies by, and drops a bunch of worms in front of you. You already know what’s going on, right? Unsurprised, you look down and see “Feathers” spelled out by the worms, more or less, because the worms are clearly unhappy with the situation.

name: Hare Handler VII
text:
As you’re tending to your field of corn, you notice a rather large weed has sprouted up, and you gear up to pull it out. You touch it, and it’s...furry? In the blink of an eye, the plant you plucked becomes too heavy to lift, so naturally, you drop it.
“Ow! Ain’t that a little rude?”. Your new rabbit friend has the strangest ways of greeting you. “Well, anyways…” he sniffs at your corn stalks. “I need a bunch of yellow stuff. No time for questions. Fill a barrel with yellow for me.”
Once again, as you add the final contents to the barrel, it and the rabbit poof away, leaving goodies in their place.

name: Feathers IX
text:
You are walking home from the country store, and in a cloud of feathers, Star appears before you.
“Pranks. franks pranks. The little furball is a little over the top, especially for a Wednesday during a waxing moon. Lemon quartz, of all things. AND LEMONS! Not very gravimetric of him is it? No, not at all. Can you help get the essence of lemon out of everything? Perhaps a nice stew, and something to wash it down with? And NO. LEMONS! OR LEMON QUARTZ! Not that you’d ever think of putting gems in a stew, I know, but… you wouldn’t would you? Nonetheless, I think a fine stew would be most helpful during this troubling time.”
In another cloud of feathers, Star is gone, and a sheet of parchment is in his place. The parchment reads:
5 Tomatoes

5 Potatoes

2 Onions

5 Leeks

2 Steak Kabobs

2 Orange Juice

NO LEMONS

name: Hare Handler VIII
text:
You go home, very ready for a nap. Of course, you have a visitor rifling through your kitchen.
“Something blue. Lots of blue.” The rabbit starts throwing various things from the cabinets on the floor. You start to offer to find whatever he’s looking for, when he pulls a wooden barrel that definitely would not have fit in your cabinets, climbs in, and...says nothing. Once the objects are poured in, he starts laughing. The tips of his ears are poking out the top, and he clears his throat when you don’t immediately put the lid over his head. You pick up the lid, place it down, and the entire barrel disappears. In its place, is a pile of silver, and some other items you don’t recall seeing before.

name: Of Hares And Feathers
text:
Having heard nothing from frank or Star for quite some time, you think the apparent rift between the two has finally ended. As you are walking through your fields, an all too familiar cloud of feathers appears.
“I truly must apologize. I believe the lemon must have greatly affected the energy in my spells. Let’s assume that both frank and I were a bit overzealous in our pranks, and unfortunately, you were wrapped up in all of it.” Star waves with a flourish, and suddenly you see frank, sitting behind Star.
“Right, sorry. Pranks. Too much, not for you. I get it. Won’t happen again, unless it does, and then it will. We’ve had this prank war going on for years now, he really got me this time. I mean, on your roof? Lucky you still have a roof, am I right?” frank is chewing on one of your carrots. Apparently, even when he’s apologizing, he’s still hungry.

name: Hay, How Are You? III
text: Neigh neigh. Neigh neigh neigh. Neigh?

name: Hay, How Are You? IV
text: Neigh?

name: Hay, How Are You? V
text: Neigh? Neigh neigh.

name: A Way Forward I
text:
Captain Thomas is researching ways to get back to his homeworld.

On his world there were stones that appeared in a variety of mundane locations. His parents found some of them, and he overheard them discussing the magical properties of these runestones. He thinks the runestones may be able to help him return home.

Will you help Captain Thomas find the runestone that appears in the forest pond?

name: A Way Forward II
text:
Captain Thomas remembers his parents finding one of the runestones in a small cave. Will you help him search for the cave and the stone?

Be wary. Captain Thomas heard tales of a frightening creature living in one of the caves nearby.

name: A Way Forward III
text: The last runestone that Captain Thomas remembers his parents finding came from growing cucumbers in their garden. Will you grow some cucumbers along with Captain Thomas? He hopes one of you will find a runestone.

name: A Way Forward IV
text: Captain Thomas isn’t sure where any other runestones are, but he remembers some possibilities from his parents searching. Will you try growing leeks with Captain Thomas? His parents were convinced there was a stone connected to the vegetable although they never found it.

name: A Way Forward V
text: Captain Thomas remembers his parents exploring Black Rock Canyon on a regular basis. They didn’t find a runestone, but he’s sure they were searching for one. Will you help him search the canyon?

name: A Way Forward VI
text: Captain Thomas is really uncertain about this next location. His family used to fish regularly at a small pond just outside of town. His parents never said specifically that they were looking for a runestone, but they always looked for interesting rocks in and around the pond. Will you help him search the small pond for a runestone?

name: A Way Forward VII
text: Captain Thomas would like you to help him try to get a runestone from radishes. His father couldn’t stand radishes, but his mother was sure that a stone could be collected from them. Unfortunately, they never found a radish runestone, but it was probably because his dad rarely planted the hated vegetable.

name: A Way Forward VIII
text:
There is only one more runestone that Captain Thomas has a clue about. His parents suspected there was a runestone in the Misty Forest, but between the large rodents and the spiders, Captain Thomas’s family never spent much time searching for it.

Will you explore the forest and see if there is a runestone to be found? Captain Thomas would go with you, but he seems to have inherited a bit of that fear of spiders, unfortunately.

name: A Way Forward IX
text: The runestones are reacting with each other, but they’re not doing anything except glowing. While Captain Thomas continues to experiment with them, will you check your farm for more runestones? Captain Thomas thinks you must have incredible luck after finding all of the stones his parents searched so hard to find. Maybe you could check the pond on your farm for a runestone.

name: A Way Forward X
text:
Captain Thomas is amazed by the good fortune that follows you.

The runestones are glowing more brightly now, but he still can’t coax anything else from them. Will you try your luck at finding one more stone? Maybe you could grow some quick crops like carrots.

name: A Way Forward XI
text:
After all that effort, Captain Thomas is frustrated. The stones do open a gateway, when they are merged together, but the gate leads to a wasteland. From what Captain Thomas could tell from his visits, there was nothing in that fiery waste that could help him get home.

Captain Thomas would like you to get the fused stones out of his sight.

name: Naturally Thankful
text:
Behind Beatrix’s house is a maple tree as straight as an arrow. Geist likes to relax in the grass and watch that tree blow about in the wind. Geist really enjoyed the leaves turning red this fall, until they all fell off. Now there’s only one small leaf left flapping madly in the wind.

Geist is thankful for beautiful leaves in grand trees and all sorts of other beauties of the natural world. Will you bring her some of her favorite things?

name: A Feathery Thanks
text:
*poof*
Star is thankful for his favorite spell.
*poof*
Star really loves this spell.
*poof*
Won't you help Star keep using his favorite spell?
*poof*
Star is thankful for you too.
*poof*

name: Selfishly, Thanks
text: Cecil is thankful for things. All things. Especially things that are his things. Would you bring him a few of his favorite things?

name: My Favorite Corn
text: ROOMBA has cleanest source of energy its ever used. His data matrix does not understand what being thankful is, can you bring him corn? It's ROOMBA's programmatically most requested item, which sounds a lot like being its favorite thing.

name: A Few Of His Favorite Things
text:
Raindrops on roses and whiskers on kittens
Bright copper kettles and warm woolen mittens
Brown paper packages tied up with strings
These are a few of my favorite things.
Cream-colored ponies and crisp apple strudels;
Doorbells and sleigh bells and schnitzel with noodles;
Wild geese that fly with the moon on their wings;
These are a few of my favorite things.
Girls in white dresses with blue satin sashes
Snowflakes that stay on my nose and eyelashes
Silver-white winters that melt into springs
These are a few of my favorite things
When the dog bites,
When the bee stings,
When I'm feeling sad,
I simply remember my favorite things,
And then I don't feel so bad.

name: Joyful Thanks
text: Rosalie is thankful for friendships and the town. She's also thankful for the strange wizard that makes her smile. Would you bring her a few of her favorite things?

name: Explosively Thankful
text:
Playing a pirate and scaring the townsfolk
Pulling an over-the-line practical joke
Black powder packages, fuses as strings
These are a few of his favorite things
When the town flees
When the boom rings
When he's feeling mad
He simply remembers his favorite things
And then he won't feel so bad
Buddy is thankful for all sorts of things. Particularly explodey things. Will you bring him some of his favorite things?

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare VI
text: Rosalie would like to also have a good supply of smaller fireworks for the show. Will you help her put together a large load of bottle rockets?

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare VII
text: Beatrix needs a little more kick for her rockets. She also wants some extra explosives for a richer, more immersive sound for the show. Will you bring her some explosives?

name: Thankfully Curious
text:
Beatrix loves strange things. She’s always been very curious. She wants to see everything.

Beatrix is thankful for new and curious things. Will you bring her some things for her to puzzle over?

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare VIII
text: Beatrix would really appreciate another load of explosives, if it’s not too much trouble. She’s hopeful that this load will be enough to really make the fireworks show a feast for all the senses.

name: do you carrot all?
text:
You are sitting in front of your fireplace, thinking about going to bed, when a familiar blue rabbit poofs into existence right in front of the fire.
"Carrots. If you wanted to get frank something he's thankful for, it's carrots."
You see a barrel, and a very hungry looking frank. Will you bring him some of his favorite things?

name: Fishing For Thanks
text: Captain Thomas remembers that one of his favorite things on his world was to go fishing. Will you bring him things to help him fish?

name: Thankful For Fish
text: Thomas is very thankful for fish. He loves fish. Fish are his favorite. Will you bring him some of his favorite fish?

name: Thankful and Hungry
text: Holger is thankful. He is also hungry. Will you bring him some food so he's less hungry and more thankful?

name: Corn Quandary I
text: Jill is very concerned about the upcoming change of seasons and some issues she’s had with her farm yields recently. She’s come asking for your help to fill her silos with corn for her animals. She offers to pay you better than market value for your corn and she found an old stone in her barn that once her silo is full, she will give you as well.

name: Corn Quandary II
text: As you bring your first load of corn to Jill, she thanks you and updates you on your progress. She says you’re 2.6 (repeating of course) percent of the way there. It’s a strangely specific number, but hey, progress is progress, you tell yourself. It shouldn't be too hard to finish this at all!

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare X
text: Beatrix is pleasantly surprised that turnout for the fireworks celebration is significantly higher than expected. Now, Beatrix needs some help getting more refreshments for the show. Will you help gather more watermelon?

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare IX
text: This may seem excessive, but Beatrix needs a little more pop to the fireworks display. Recently, she saw that Lorn had some very special fireworks at the Exchange Center. Will you go and get her some of the fireworks that Lorn has stocked?

name: The Rocket’s Red Glare XI
text: Rosalie needs a lot more corn for the refreshments tables. Will you help her get more corn?

name: Thankful For Wisdom
text: Lorn is wise enough to be thankful for his wisdom. Will you bring Lorn some of his favorite things, that he believes impart wisdom?

name: Corn Quandary III
text:
This doesn't seem so bad. You hum yourself a tune to pass the time while corn grows.
Jill smiles as she adds her corn to your batch in the silo. She squints her eyes and remarks that you’re over 5% of the way there.

name: Corn Quandary IV
text: Nobody said it would be easy, but as you bring your corn to Jill, you didn't think it would be this hard to watch corn grow. Jill mentions you're 8% of the way there as the corn goes into the silo.

name: Corn Quandary V
text: Bringing corn back is how it starts, you go back to Jill's house and check the charts, you figure out you're over 10% of the way there.

name: Corn Quandary VI
text:
You feel like you're running in circles farming corn, but you can't quit. You've got a lot to do and you can't just throw this corn away.

Jill gives you an odd look as you seem to be talking to yourself. She mentions you're 14 percent of the way there and she'll see you soon!

name: Corn Quandary VII
text:
As you pass by George on your way to Jill's, you stop for a moment and listen to him sing and play guitar.
"There's dusty fields no matter where you go, you may change your mind, because the weeds are high where corn doesn't grow." 
It sounds nice to your ears and is stuck in your head the rest of the way to Jill's where she gleefully informs you you're over 17% of the way done!

name: Corn Quandary VIII
text:
Songs keep coming to your mind. How long have you been farming this corn?
Like the legend of the phoenix, whatever keeps your farm spinning, you'vecome too farto give upwho you are, growing corn.

Jill gives you a worried look as you hand over your latest batch. By your measurements, you're now over 20% of the way to your goal.

name: Corn Quandary IX
text:
How long have you been growing corn? You feel like you want something else to get you through what is most definitely not a semi-charmed life of corn. 
24% of the way there.
That's a lot of corn, you think to yourself.

name: Corn Quandary X
text:
Now, you've had your corn losses, you've had your corn victories, you are the person in corn misery. 
Another delivery, ever closer. 
Over 27% now...

name: Corn Quandary XI
text:
There's so much corn. Thoughts rush in your mind about how this feels. You're stuck, imprisoned in corn. So much corn.
You're just a soul whose intentions are good, 
Oh lord, please don't let this corn be misunderstood.

30.6% (repeating)...

name: Corn Quandary XII
text:
You know this corn jail is real, you used to put your faith in corn, but then your chance to get out slipped, you used to worry about the future but then you threw your corn into the wind. 
34 percent of the way there, by Jill's reckoning.

name: Corn Quandary XIII
text:
Everybody stop - hey! What’s that sound? Ears of corn are all around.

Over 37% of the way there. You can't stop now. And why would you want to?

name: Corn Quandary XIV
text:
Hey farmer what ya thinking? Leave that corn planting, you feel the rhythm going. They call it lonely farming.
Over 40%! As you bring more and more corn, Jill looks more worried about you than before and ups the reward hoping you'll make it to the finish line.

name: Corn Quandary XV
text:
You're growing the distance. You're growing for speed. You're all alone. You're all alone, growing corn for Jill's needs. 
44%... the number echoes in your mind.

name: Corn Quandary XVI
text:
Maybe Jill will tell you sometime. You were right. Corn, corn never changes. Outside, on Jill's doorstep, she worriedly thanks you for nearly getting halfway there.
48% to be exact!

name: Corn Quandary XVIII
text:
Now, you see Jill never needed you,
But you tried hard to trick yourself
Into thinking you could be helped
And a voice said
Come on, come on, just close your eyes
We'll test our fate, by growing corn

52%

name: Corn Quandary XIX
text:
Corn may come and corn may go, and that's all right, you see, experience has made me rich and now Jill's after me.

56%

name: Corn Quandary XX
text:
You grew some corn today, to see if you still feel. You focus on the pain, a runestone 11 that's real.
60%

Jill looks extremely worried about you. She offers you more silver. She says you should take a break. You know you won't.

name: Corn Quandary XXI
text:
When I get older losing my hair
Many ears from now
Will you still be sending me a valentine?
Birthday greeting, bottle of wine?
If I'd been harvesting quarter to three
would you lock the door?
Will you still need me, will you still feed me
When I'm sixty-four
...percent of the way there.

name: Corn Quandary XXII
text:
Now throw your hands up in the air
And wave 'em around like you just don't care
If you wanna party let me hear you yell
'Cause we've got it growin' corn again

68%

name: Corn Quandary XXIII
text:
The lyrics won't stop coming to your head. Are you going crazy? No, no you're fine. 
My loneliness is killing me, and I must confess, I still believe
When I'm not with corn I lose my mind
Give me a sign, hit me runestone one more time!
72%

name: Corn Quandary XXIV
text:
You think of a soothing melody. To sing for yourself. And your corn. 
Look at the corn
Look how it grows for you
And everything you do 
Yeah, it was all yellow

Jill says nothing to you as you sing to her merrily. How odd. In your head you know you're 76% of the way there.

name: Beach Bum I
text: Borgen is going to spend a week or two at the beach. It’s not a vacation though. He’s going to set up a stand and sell keepsakes to the folks vacationing at the beach. Will you help him find some beach themed items to sell?

name: Beach Bum II
text: Borgen would like you to keep the beach keepsakes coming. Can you find him some more shells?

name: Beach Bum III
text: Keep the shells coming! Borgen says they’re selling as fast as he can get them on display.

name: Beach Bum Hard Mode
text: Borgen would like to have some sand dollars to sell. Can you help him find some for his stand?

name: Corn Quandary XXV
text:
Revvin' your tractor
Listenin' to its howlin' roar
Metal under tension
Beggin' you to touch and go
HIGHWAY TO THE CORN ZONE
I'LL TAKE YOU RIGHT INTO THE CORN ZONE

80% of the way through the corn zone!

name: Beach Bum IV
text: Borgen knows what the people really want from his souvenir stand. Will you help him find some shark teeth?

name: Corn Quandary XXVI
text:
We will
We will
Pop you
84%

name: Corn Quandary XXVII
text:
Don't you dare look back
Just keep your eyes on me
I said you're holding back
She said 
SHUT UP GROW CORN WITH ME
This cornfield is our destiny
She said
SHUT UP GROW CORN WITH ME
88% of the way there. You can see the finish line.

name: Corn Quandary XXIX
text:
I tried growing the weight of this world
But I only have two hands
Hope I get the chance to grow more corn
But I don't have any plans
Wish that I could stay forever with corn
Not afraid to close my eyes
Life's a cornfield for everyone
And a runestone is the prize

All this time I was growing more corn and I
Didn't know I was lost
96%...so...close...

text:
I've grown my corn

I've done my sentence

'Cause we are the champions of the corn

name: Corn Quandary XXXI
text: Jill shakes you awake. You blink and realize you're in your cornfield. The previous days seem vague, filled with songs you barely remember, and memories of corn. Jill asks you to stop growing corn, and hands over the stone she found in her barn. You frown at the stone as if it comes from a bad memory. After a moment, you pocket it, and head to your home for a day of rest.

name: Thankfully Treacherous
text: Ric is thankful for all the things that can be accomplished when everyone pitches in for the greater good. Ric thinks it’s time for you to make another contribution.

name: Monetarily Thankful
text: Borgen is fairly certain that you already know what he’s thankful for. Will you bring him some ancient coins?

name: Thankfully A Horse
text: Neigh neigh. Neigh neigh neigh. Neigh neigh neigh?

name: Thankfully In Love
text: Charles is thankful for love and relationships! Will you bring him some gifts for his girlfriend?

name: Thankfully Friendly
text: Vincent is thankful for his friends. Will you help him gather some small gifts to give to each of his friends?

name: Hungry Holger IV
text: Holger is a hungry man, and needs more nutritional value in his belly. Can you prepare a meal for him?

name: Blizzard Warning I
text:
Lorn received word that bad weather is coming. He expects an exceptional blizzard and a massive accumulation of snow from Mount Banon all the way to the coast.

Will you help Lorn make signs to warn people around town to prepare? Lorn will bring the ink if you bring the parchment.

name: Blizzard Warning II - A
text: Cecil would like your help boarding up his many windows. He expects this blizzard to bring very strong winds that might damage his home.

name: Blizzard Warning II - B
text:
Star needs some emberstone to help keep his tower warm. He has some experiments running in the loftier portions of his tower that could be thrown out of multiversal alignment without the proper temperature controls in place. Star thinks this blizzard is going to wreak havoc on the entire thermal alignment of the town.

Will you bring him a massive load of emberstone, and some feathers just in case he needs them?

name: Blizzard Warning III - A
text: Holger is concerned he may not have enough food if he gets snowed in for a few days. Will you help him gather a few additional food items?

name: Blizzard Warning III - B
text: Cecil wants to make sure that his horse is well prepared for the coming blizzard too. Will you help him get a few extra items for his horse?

name: Blizzard Warning III - C
text:
Star also needs a few grocery items, if you wouldn’t mind getting them for him. He can’t leave his experiments right now since it’s the middle of a nebular Friday.

For grocery items, Star just needs the standard snowstorm fare.

name: 99 Bottles I
text: One bottle of hops on the wall...

name: 99 Bottles II
text: Two bottles of hops on the wall...

name: 99 Bottles III
text: Three bottles of hops on the wall...

name: 99 Bottles IV
text: Four bottles of hops on the wall...

name: Dog Days of Summer
text: It is crazy hot and humid lately. Rosalie will make you some lemonade if you can bring her a Lemon.

text: Five bottles of hops on the wall...

text: Six bottles of hops on the wall...
