name: Blizzard Warning III - D
text: Jill needs your help. With the blizzard coming, she needs some extra crops to turn into feed for her animals. She would like to get a variety of crops so her animals get all the nutrients they need to stay healthy. Unfortunately, there isn’t enough time remaining for her to do it alone. Will you help her get a few more varieties of crops to turn into feed?

name: Blizzard Warning IV - A
text:
Vincent is certain that Lorn is right about a terrible blizzard coming. He has seen the signs in the sky of an approaching storm, and the wildlife around his camp are behaving like they know a severe storm is coming.

Normally, Vincent would get a room in an inn to weather the worst of the storm, but all of the inns are full right now. Will you rent a room out to Vincent, just until the worst of the storm passes?

name: Blizzard Warning IV - B
text: Neigh neigh!!! Neigh!?

name: Blizzard Warning IV - C
text: Thomas doesn’t need any necessities to prepare for the blizzard, but he would like to be ready to try ice fishing after the storm passes. Will you bring him a few things he can use to go fishing in the ice?

name: Blizzard Warning IV - D
text: Vincent would also like to rent some space in your barn to store his wagon. Unfortunately, he also needs a few new wheels for his wagon to get it over to your barn. Will you rent him the space and help him get some wagon wheels?

name: Recycling Project
text: After all of these festivals that Rosalie has thrown, Jill has noticed that there is some cleanup needed. Help Jill collect some junk to be recycled, and materials to help reuse them.

name: Blizzard Warning IV - E
text: Holger is still not sure he has enough food to make it through the blizzard. Will you bring him a little more food?

name: Blizzard Warning IV - F
text: Jill needs a little more feed for her animals, to feel completely prepared for the blizzard, but her feed mill is already running at full capacity. Will you bring her a few more bags of feed from your mill?

name: Blizzard Warning IV - G
text: Beatrix thought she was completely prepared for the blizzard, but as she was preparing tea for Lorn today, she realized that her tea supplies are running awfully low. Will you help her gather a few things to ensure she has tea for the duration of the storm?

name: Blizzard Warning IV - H
text: George expects to have a bit of quiet time on his hands during the blizzard. He thinks it will be a good opportunity to challenge himself musically. He would like to try playing a left-handed guitar. Will you bring him a left-handed guitar?

name: Shoveling Snow I - A
text: Neigh…

name: Shoveling Snow I - B
text: Buddy would like to help his many friends by shoveling the snow off the path to his cave. Will you bring him a shovel?

name: Shoveling Snow I - C
text:
Borgen needs a shovel to clear the snow from his usual site. He doesn’t want any paying customers slipping and falling when they come to check out his wares.

Will you sell Borgen a shovel?

name: Shoveling Snow I - D
text:
Beatrix has a very strange patch of ground on the eastern side of her house. The blizzard piled up snow everywhere on that side of the house, except this one spot. All around this spot the snow slopes quickly up past her knees, but at this strange patch the ground is completely dry and has not a lick of snow.

Beatrix is going to excavate this patch of ground. The area is about a meter by two meters. Will you bring her a shovel?

name: Shoveling Snow I - F
text: frank needs a shovel for the snow. Will you bring the shovel and not ask any more questions?

name: Shoveling Snow I - E
text: Will you bring George a shovel? He would like to clear the snow from his walkways.

name: Egg Hunt
text: Rosalie needs eggs to make a number of cakes for a large event. In return she will give you 1200 Silver.

name: Lunar Telescope
text: Beatrix would like to create a new kind of telescope, using lenses crafted from moonstone. Do you know where to find these rare rocks?

name: Shoveling Snow I - G
text: Thomas wants to do something nice for the whole town, or as much of it as he can. Will you bring him a load of emberstone and salt rock to help clear the main road?

name: Shoveling Snow I - H
text: Captain Thomas saw Thomas trying to clear the snow from the main road. Thomas looked like he could use some help. Will you bring Captain Thomas some emberstone and salt rock so he can help?

name: Shoveling Snow I - I
text: Jill needs snowballs and lots of them. She’s going to war with George in exactly one hour. Will you help her prepare?

name: Shoveling Snow I - J
text: George is going to war with Jill. He needs snowballs and loads of snowballs. Will you give him a hand gathering snowballs?

name: Shoveling Snow I - K
text: Rosalie needs some snowballs. Someone threw one and hit her in the back while she was shoveling her front walkway. She will be ready next time.

name: Shoveling Snow II - A
text:
Borgen was trying to hit Holger with a snowball yesterday and accidentally hit Rosalie. He immediately hid himself. So he doesn’t think Rosalie knows it was him, but he is still very afraid now. He expects Holger to rat him out at any moment.

Will you help Borgen build a proper snow fort to prepare? He will gather the snow if you bring the other necessities.

name: Shoveling Snow II - B
text: Holger told Rosalie that Borgen hit her with a snowball as quickly as he could yesterday, but Borgen vanished before they could ambush him. So, they’re planning their attack for this evening, just before the sun goes down. They’re prepared with snowballs, but they could use a few other items to overcome Borgen’s defenses. Will you give them a hand?

name: Shoveling Snow II - C
text:
Rosalie feels a little bad about the ambush on Borgen. Rosalie and Holger overwhelmed Borgen pretty quickly, and then as Borgen retreated Rosalie nailed him right in the back.

Will you bring Rosalie some of Borgen’s favorite things so she can make him a gift basket?

name: Shoveling Snow III - A
text: Beatrix excavated the strange area of ground without snow on the side of her house. You’ll never believe what she found! It’s something big and metal and there’s a hatch big enough for a person to enter. Unfortunately, Beatrix can’t get the hatch open. Also, the handle for the hatch is extremely hot. Will you bring something to help cool the handle off?

name: Shoveling Snow III - B
text: Beatrix also noticed a keyhole on the hatch. Will you bring Beatrix some keys to try?

name: Super Calamari
text: Holger is in the mood for some Calamari. But, not regular Calamari. He wants SUPER Calamari, which can only be made from a Giant Squid. Can you help him catch these delicious monsters?

name: Shoveling Snow III - C
text: Beatrix still can’t get the hatch open and the entire thing is still very hot. She has an unconventional idea to try, if you’ll give her a hand. Will you bring her some explosives?

name: Shoveling Snow IV - A
text: Beatrix asked Lorn to come take a look at the hatch since all of her efforts to open it were fruitless, so far. Lorn has seen some strong bunkers before, but this one seems to be magically sealed. The first thing Lorn would like to try on the hatch is water. Will you bring him several buckets of water and a cup to use to dip and pour?

name: Shoveling Snow IV - B
text:
Lorn was surprised by the effect the water had on the hatch. The heat coming from the hatch increased until the water boiled away, and then the hatch returned to its normal very hot temperature.

Lorn would like to conduct another experiment. Will you bring him some seaweed?

name: Shoveling Snow IV - C
text: After the seaweed burst into flames instantly upon contact with the hatch, Lorn decided that this magical seal may be a bit beyond his abilities. Nevertheless, he has one more experiment in mind, if you bring him some magna quartz and steel.

name: Shoveling Snow V - A
text:
Cecil is glad that Beatrix and Lorn asked him to come take a look at the hatch before anyone got hurt. However, he is surprised to see this hatch. Cecil thought that he mapped all of the underground structures in this area several years ago. He did not detect this one during that search, but now that the structure is exposed, Cecil thinks it is a good idea if he takes a look.

Cecil has a device, called a fachetek, that he can use to disable the magic guarding the hatch. Then, he can safely open the hatch and take a brief look down in the structure, to make sure that there is no danger for the townsfolk.

Cecil would appreciate your help in building a support rig that he can attach his climbing system to, so that he can descend safely down through the hatch.

name: Shoveling Snow V - B
text: Cecil will not be needing the magna quartz and steel wire that Lorn left on the hatch. If you will bring Cecil a few iron rings, he should be able to clean all the magna quartz up.

name: Shoveling Snow VI
text:
Cecil successfully disabled the magic seal that was guarding the hatch. The hatch then opened very easily. Unfortunately, the magic seal was a bit stronger than Cecil expected. The seal almost depleted his fuel supply.

The fuel source for Cecil’s fachetek is aquamarine and his supply is running low. Will you bring him some aquamarines in ring form, so that they are easier to load in the fachetek?

name: Shoveling Snow VII
text: Before Cecil descends through the hatch, will you also bring him some lemon quartz in ring form to use with his fachetek. Cecil can swap the lemon quartz into the fachetek to use it like a torch in case there are no lights in the underground structure.

name: Shoveling Snow VIII
text:
Cecil appreciates your help getting back up through the hatch. His exploration wore him out, but it revealed that the structure is actually an enormous instacrafting facility. He also found that the facility was completely sealed up, and it looked like it was abandoned. Unfortunately, Cecil found nothing of interest in the whole building. He did bring up one little bauble to examine in his lab, but he doesn’t expect it to be worth anything.

Cecil would like to reset the magic seal with his fachetek and bury the hatch again. He thinks that there may be an opportunity to use the facility in the future, but he thinks it could be dangerous to leave it exposed like it is now. Will you handle the burying work while he informs Beatrix and Lorn about his findings?

name: Shoveling Snow IX
text: Cecil would like to thank you for the help you provided with investigating that underground facility. He was right about the bauble he found not having much value, but it does have a little bit of magic to it. Cecil would like you to have it, for a small, reasonable price.

name: Egg Drop Contest
text: Beatrix is teaching the local school kids how to build a box that protects an egg when dropped off a roof. Holger came to help, chopped up all the wood, made a fire, and scrambled all the eggs for a big breakfast to feed the kids. Now, there are not enough materials to build the boxes or eggs to put in them. Can you help save the school project?

name: Fancy Dinner
text: Cecil wants to have a fancy dinner with an important guest tonight. He needs some gourmet food. Can you help with the wine and steak?

name: 12 Days of Christmas IV
text:

30 arrowheads
20 mushrooms
And 10 from my orchard fruit trees

name: 12 Days of Christmas III
text:
On the third day of Christmas, the townsfolk asked of me
30 arrowheads
20 mushrooms
And 10 from my orchard fruit trees

name: Do You Want to Build A Snowman? I
text:
Buddy enters the town. He looks mischievous, and you feel as though it’s your duty to see what he’s up to. After a few moments, you recognize the house Buddy is approaching is Vincent’s. This seems…bad. You brace yourself for what comes next, but after pounding on the door, Buddy calls out -

“Vincent?
Do you want to build a snowman? 
C’mon let’s go and play
I never see you anymore
Come out the door
It’s like you’ve gone away

We could have been best buddies
And yet we’re not
I wish you would tell me why…
Do you wanna build a snowman?”

Vincent opens the door suddenly and shouts, “GO AWAY BUDDY!” He turns and slams the door, and Buddy stands outside looking dejected. 
After a moment you hear him call out, “OK, bye.”
Buddy looks to you dejectedly for a moment before he perks up. “Maybe if I start building a giant snowman, Vincent will want to play? Will you help?”
You can’t help yourself.

name: Do You Want to Build A Snowman? II
text:
The snowman begins to take shape and Buddy, spurred on by your good deed and a seemingly unending well of optimism knocks on Vincent’s door again.
“Vincent?
Do you wanna build a snowman?
Or decorate some Christmas cards
I think some company is overdue
I’ve started making a giant snowman in your yard
Hang in there, buddy
It gets a little lonely
With only one snowman
Just watching the hours tick by”
Vincent opens the door cautiously and his eyes grow wide at the giant snowman that has begun to form in his front yard. He looks at Buddy for a moment before shaking his head and closing the door without a word.

Buddy looks sadly at the door and you can hear a muffled, “OK, bye”
Your heart cannot take the sadness in Buddy’s eyes and you begin gathering more snowballs to help complete his project.

name: Do You Want to Build A Snowman? III
text:
The snow portion of the snowman is nearing completion, and Buddy again knocks on Vincent’s door.
“Vincent?
Please, I know you’re in there
People have been asking where you’ve been
They tell me “have courage” and I’m trying to
I’ve built a snowman right here for you,
Just let me in!
We could friend each other
Just you and me
What else could we do?
Do you wanna build a snowman? 
(It doesn’t have to be a snowman!)”

Suddenly the door swings open and Vincent shoves something in Buddy’s hand and closes the door immediately. 
Buddy looks dejectedly on, “OK, bye.”
You look at Buddy’s hand and notice coal and a carrot.

Buddy suddenly notices what he has and his eyes brighten immediately as he looks towards you. “All we need is a giant scarf!”
He glances down again and adds, "Maybe some more coal too."

name: Do You Want to Build A Snowman? IV
text: After you bring back a scarf, Vincent comes outside bearing hot chocolate for you and buddy, and a grin on his face. “Buddy, this is one of the biggest and best snowmen I’ve ever seen, maybe next year we can build one together. It can be a sequel and we’ll sing a duet into the unknown sky about it!”

name: Covert Santa I
text:
One of the traditions that Lorn loves most this time of year is doing Covert Santa with his friends. They all pull names from a Santa hat and get a gift for the person whose name they pulled. They also put a secret gift in a password protected mailbox at the post office. That gift is for any clever individual that figures out each of the pairings for Covert Santa.

Lorn could use a hand getting a gift for the friend whose name he pulled this year. He won’t tell you who it is, but Lorn would like to gift his friend a fairly substantial load of food. Will you help Lorn?

name: Covert Santa II
text: Covert Santa. Weird. I like it. I don't necessarily get it, but I got it. frank needs carrots. You grow carrots still, right? Apples too.

name: Covert Santa III
text: Neigh neigh neigh neigh. Neigh neigh. Neigh. Neigh, neigh neigh neigh?

name: A Lot Of Trees I
text: Vincent wants to sell Christmas trees in town, but he needs some help gathering the trees. Will you lend him a hand?

name: Cowboy Cecil II
text: While Cecil was riding his fine Stallion, he lost his favorite cowpoke boots in the river. There are a lot of them in there, can you find the specific ones he is looking for?

name: A Lot Of Trees II
text: Vincent wants to upgrade his Christmas tree lot by selling fully decorated trees alongside the plain Christmas trees. Will you help him get a few more trees and decorate them?

name: A Lot Of Trees III
text: Vincent wants to add a gift shop to his lot. He plans to sell a variety of things in addition to the Christmas trees. He envisioned a one-stop shop for all the holiday needs. Will you give him a hand?

name: A Lot Of Trees IV
text: Vincent needs a few more items for his shop, if you’re willing to help.

name: A Lot Of Trees V
text: Vincent needs more plain trees. Will you bring him a fresh supply?

name: Covert Santa IV
text: Buddy is glad to be part of the Covert Santa. Buddy isn't quite sure what to get, but he likes this person and thinks Apples and Cucumbers might do the trick. His friend likes things that start with those letters.

name: Low On Coal II
text: Santa thinks that making coal from wood is making a depressing task even more loathsome. Will you bring him some coal instead?

name: Low On Coal III
text: :( Santa needs more coal. :(

name: Low On Coal IV
text: Santa expects this to be the last batch, at least he hopes it will be. He doesn’t want to need anymore coal.

name: Low On Coal I
text: Santa needs some coal. His workshop is completely out of it, and, unfortunately, there are a few people that will be receiving coal in their stockings instead of presents this year. Will you help Santa gather wood to make some coal?

name: A Lot Of Trees VI
text: There was a huge rush on fully decorated Christmas trees. Will you help Vincent replenish his supplies?

name: Thomas' Tea Party
text: Thomas's niece and friends are coming to visit him for a fancy tea party. His fishing luck hasn't been great this week though, and now he needs help to get everything set. Thomas can make the tea if you can get the rest together.

name: A Lot Of Trees VII
text: Vincent needs more color choices for tree decorations. Will you bring him some different colored decorations?

name: A Lot Of Trees VIII
text: Vincent wants to sell treats in his gift shop. Will you bring him a load of candy?

name: A Lot Of Trees IX
text: Business is really taking off for Vincent. Now he needs more plain trees! Will you bring him a large supply?

name: A Lot Of Trees X
text: Vincent is completely out of fully decorated Christmas trees. They are selling quicker than he can keep up on his own. Will you bring him a big load of fully decorated trees to help him catch up?

name: A Lot Of Trees XI
text: Vincent has an amazing idea for his gift shop. He’s going to sell green scarves! They can be used as scarves or as tree skirts. Will you help him prepare a large inventory?

name: A Lot Of Trees XII
text: Vincent needs more trees. He can barely keep up with the demand right now. Will you bring him a ridiculously large load of plain trees?

name: A Lot Of Trees XIII
text: The fully decorated trees are gone, completely wiped out. Please help Vincent build up a bigger stock of fully decorated trees.

name: A Lot Of Trees XIV
text: Vincent needs more ornaments to sell in his gift shop. Please bring him a large load of all the colors.

name: A Lot Of Trees XV
text: Vincent has a new idea for the gift shop. He wants to try selling teddy bears. Will you bring him a few to test the market?

name: Covert Santa V
text: Jill needs something strange for the recipient of her Covert Santa gift. She has racked her brain, but can’t think of anything strange enough. Will you help her find something really strange?

name: An Apple a Day...
text: ... Keeps the Doctor Away, or so the saying goes. Cecil would like to prove this out but he needs a good stockpile of apples to do so. Are you up for this fruity task?

name: Covert Santa VI
text: George isn’t sure what the wise gift would be for the person whose name he has for Covert Santa. He suspects that this person is more concerned with helping everyone else than longing for possessions. Speaking of helping, will you give George a hand finding the right gift?

name: Covert Santa VII
text: Thomas loves Covert Santa. He thinks it’s a great opportunity to show off his fishing skills. He’s not sure if his person loves fish as much as he does, but maybe if the fish are caught using corn for bait she will. Will you help Thomas with the fish?

name: Covert Santa VIII
text: Rosalie is so excited to get a Covert Santa gift ready. She is hopeful that her mind is in harmony with the lyrical person whose name she pulled. Will you help her get the things she needs for the gift?

name: Covert Santa IX
text: ROOMBA does not fully understand this Covert Santa, but ROOMBA finds the idea of getting a gift for a drago... ERROR. ROOMBA needs your help to get a gift ready.

name: Covert Santa X
text: Geist wants to get Covert Santa right. She’s never celebrated the holidays like this before. She also hopes that the snow has trapped her person so he doesn’t wander off in search of new jobs. Will you help her find the perfect gift?

name: Covert Santa XI
text: Borgen is happy to participate in Covert Santa this year, but he dislikes his recipient. However, in the spirit of the season, he will still do his best. He'd like for you to bring him something to help remind this person that there can be consequences for actions.

name: Covert Santa XII
text:
Captain Thomas has been invited to Covert Santa in the town. He knows it by a different name where he’s from, but it’s heartwarming to know traditions can be anywhere. 
While getting to know townspeople, Thomas has noticed his Covert Santa is very bad at expressing themselves to others directly. Lucky for his Covert Santa, Captain Thomas is always looking to help out a townsfolk in need. He has also noticed a tradition in this world his Covert Santa follows that he’d like to support, but was thinking a tradition from his world could help his Covert Santa express themselves to a certain someone better too.

name: Covert Santa XIII
text:
Vincent rarely participates in Covert Santa, because he isn’t very good at connecting with others, but in the spirit of the holidays he tells you he wanted to give it another shot, much to his obvious chagrin.
Unfortunately, his Covert Santa and he have a long history and haven't been the best of pals, but Vincent learned earlier this winter that maybe fences can be mended and is warming up to them. Vincent is heating up some cocoa and asked if you could bring him some yarn to make a warm scarf for his Covert Santa, it might be cold for them later.

name: Covert Santa XIV
text:
Ric Ryph was humbled being invited to do the Covert Santa this year. He tells you about how much it means to him that the town has adopted him as a mayor and as one of their own. 
His Covert Santa is someone he really admires and wants to give them a gift that will really make an impression! Will you help Ric Ryph?

name: Covert Santa XV
text: Beatrix can't believe it's time for Covert Santa already. She thinks some fish might be exactly the right thing to get her Covert Santa partner. Will you bring a variety of fish so she can make this the best holiday for her recipient?

name: Big Finale
text: Rosalie is preparing a holiday fireworks display. For the Big Finale, she needs a lot of bottle rockets. Can you help procure some of those whiz-poppers?

name: Covert Santa XVI
text: Holger is very excited for Covert Santa this year. He's hoping to get some yummy food. He's glad that his match for Covert Santa isn't likely to want any of his food. Can you help Holger get some fishing supplies for his surprise gift for this year's Covert Santa?

name: Covert Santa XVII
text: Cecil is happy to be part of this common-folk tradition of Covert Santa. He thinks he has the perfect gift in mind this year. Will you bring some corn to Cecil so he can become the best Covert Santa ever?

name: Covert Santa XVIII
text:
Star loves that the town invited him to be a part of Covert Santa this year. He mentions to you that it’s been a long time since he felt like he belonged anywhere and it warms his heart. The tradition of giving part of the gift now, and part of the gift through the mailbox passwords sounds fun and mischevious. 
Star could use a little help with his gift though, he’s very nervous about getting his Covert Santa the right thing. It’s important because giving less than three of anything is not how he normally expresses himself. He mentions three things, and asks if you'll help him.

name: Lost Reindeer II
text: Santa suspects that Dasher may be the hardest to find. Dasher is quick and cunning. You may need help from the whole community to find Dasher.

name: Lost Reindeer I
text:
Santa needs your help. Someone disabled the security magic that sealed and protected his local present crafting facility, #815. The spell was disabled just long enough for Santa’s reindeer to get out of one of the side entrances that manifest around town and around the countryside. When Santa went to check on the reindeer they were all gone. The magic seal was also set back in place. So, the reindeer couldn’t get back in, even if they returned.

Will you help Santa find his reindeer? Santa thinks Rudolph might be the easiest to spot. So start your search with Rudolph.

name: Lost Reindeer III
text: Santa thinks he may have some tips that can help you find Dancer. Dancer is the most wise of the reindeer. Most likely, Dancer will find a quiet place and wait. Santa thinks you should begin your search around one of the local springs.

name: Lost Reindeer IV
text: Santa is positive that he knows how to find Prancer. You’ll need carrots. Prancer loves carrots more than anything. Grow some carrots and Prancer will come to you.

name: Lost Reindeer V
text: Santa doesn’t have any great clues to help you locate Vixen. A temporary market, of some sort, might attract Vixen’s attention, but Santa isn’t completely sure about that.

name: Lost Reindeer VI
text: If you can find horned beetles, Santa thinks you’ll be able to find Comet. Comet has always loved those strange bugs.

name: Lost Reindeer VII
text: Cupid will be really tough to find. Santa thinks you’ll need your friends to help find Cupid.

name: A Ring for Every Finger
text: Jill would like a ring for each finger. Unlike some lesser-skilled or unlucky farmers, she has all 10 fingers, and toes. She has plenty of spare wheat seeds to offer as payment if you can come up with pairs of assorted rings.

name: Lost Reindeer VIII
text: Santa wants you to find some stockings. If you find stockings, you’ll find Donner. Donner loves stockings.

name: Lost Reindeer IX
text: Blitzen is a little backwards sometimes. Santa thinks Blitzen might be hanging around the post office. That reindeer loves mailboxes.

name: Lost Reindeer X
text:
Santa was correct. You were just the person to help him find his reindeer. He appreciates all your hard work.

Will you bring Santa some milk for the road?

name: A Lot Of Trees XVI
text: Vincent is ready to make a final push into the holidays. Will you bring him 2 loads of plain trees?

name: A Lot Of Trees XVII
text: Vincent is ready for the second load of plain trees.

name: A Lot Of Trees XVIII
text: Now, Vincent wants 2 last loads of decorated trees. After he sells out his inventory, Vincent is going to close up his tree lot and enjoy the holidays. He hopes you will too!

name: A Lot Of Trees XIX
text: Vincent appreciates all your help with his tree lot. He’s ready for the last load now.

name: A Small Gift I
text: Buddy wants to make a gift for one of his dearest friends in the whole wide world. Will you help him?

name: A Small Gift II
text: Buddy still needs your help with the gift he’s making. Will you bring him some milk?

name: A Small Gift III
text: Buddy only needs a few more things to finish his gift. He thinks his friend will be so surprised.

name: A Taste for Gold
text: Holger is hungry, but this time he would like a nice selection of golden crops to make an extra shiny salad. It takes real skill as a farmer to grow these crops. Do you have the talent to pull it together?TIP: Golden crops are rare drops from the regular version of the crop.

name: A Small Gift IV
text: Buddy needs one last ingredient for his gift to be complete. Please help!

name: A Small Gift V
text: Buddy wants you to have this gift that he made! Did you bring him a gift?

name: Hay Holidays I
text: Neeeeiiigh!

name: Hay Holidays II
text: Neigh! Neigh! Neigh!

name: Hay Holidays III
text: Neigh. Neigh? Neigh!

name: Hay Holidays IV
text: Charles is so grateful for your help with getting a gift together for his girlfriend. He needs one more thing to really make it great. Will you give him a hand?
Wow! Can you believe there's over 100,000 folk around here now! Rosalie was able to get some extra supplies to give out to everybody to celebrate.

name: A New Year I
text: Rosalie is preparing for a large party to celebrate the new year. Will you help her gather some things she needs for the celebration?

name: A New Year II
text: Rosalie needs a few more things for her party. Will you bring her some more seaweed for the appetizers she’s making?

name: A New Year III
text: Rosalie wants to end the party with an enormous fireworks display. Will you help her get a load of fireworks?

name: Hungry Holger I
text: Holger is hungry and needs some peas to go with his meal. He's really hungry so he wants a lot of peas. Bring him peas.

name: Archery Practice
text: Beatrix would like to do some archery but needs materials to build a bow, arrows, and a target. Can you find what Beatrix is looking for?

name: A New Year IV
text: Rosalie needs drinks for the toast to the new year. Will you help her?

name: A New Year Extra
text: Beatrix isn’t sure that Rosalie will have the right fireworks to celebrate the new year. Will you help her find something really spectacular to bring to Rosalie’s party?

name: There’s A Way I
text:
Captain Thomas suspects that you have seen someone that looks like him before. George had the same expression yesterday when Captain Thomas first arrived in town. Apparently there is a Thomas in town that looks almost identical to Captain Thomas. Captain Thomas wants to assure you that he is a different person, and not Thomas playing an out-of-season fool’s joke.

Being new in town, Captain Thomas could use some help getting established. George is renting a room to him, but Captain Thomas would like to start earning some money and getting a more permanent residence. Will you help Captain Thomas gather some bait so he can start catching and selling fish?

name: There’s A Way II
text: Captain Thomas caught a solid load of fish and put quite a bit of money away. Now, he’s ready to keep expanding his business. Will you help him get some tools so he can collect his own bait, gather resources, and improve his fishing?

name: There’s A Way III
text: Business is booming for Captain Thomas, but he still needs to expand. He would like to build some traps to add variety to what he can catch. Will you help him gather the resources he needs to build the traps?

name: There’s A Way IV
text: The next thing Captain Thomas needs for his fishing business is to increase his supply and decrease his time spent fishing. Will you help him get the materials to make some nets?

name: There’s A Way V
text:
It’s a big day for Captain Thomas. He bought a house and some land!

The house is perfect for Captain Thomas, but it needs some repairs. Will you bring him some wood and nails so he can start his renovations?

name: There’s A Way VI
text: Captain Thomas is ready to move into his house. Will you help him stock his pantry?

name: There’s A Way VII
text: Captain Thomas moved into his house and his business is still doing well. Now, he wants to invest some of his money. Will you help him find some good investments?

name: There’s A Way VIII
text:
Captain Thomas would like to thank you for helping him to get settled in to his new home.

Captain Thomas comes from a town exactly like this one, but in another universe. He realizes that his story is hard to believe, but he hopes to prove it to you someday. He also hopes to make it back to his world.

name: Big Boom IV
text: Beatrix needs one final component to make sure she's not in the blast radius, and maybe a shield.

name: Fine Fishing I
text: Thomas needs a hand. He’s supposed to catch some very elusive fish for a client, but he’s not having any luck finding these rare fish. Would you be willing to catch the fish and sell them to Thomas?

name: Fine Fishing II
text: Thomas needs more golden fish. His client purred over the gold drums you caught. Will you check the forest pond for a different golden fish?

name: Fine Fishing III
text: The client Thomas is working for loves the fish you’re catching, and by extension his client likes Thomas even more. Will you check Lake Tempest for a new golden fish?

name: Fine Fishing IV
text: Will you check the small island for golden fish? Thomas thinks the more variety he provides the more likely his client will keep coming back for more.

name: Fine Fishing V
text: Thomas tried fishing for golden fish in the Crystal River, but he didn’t catch anything. Will you try the river?

name: Fine Fishing VI
text: Thomas’s client is very finicky and never satisfied. So, he needs a new golden fish. Will you try the Emerald Beach? Thomas would join you, but he’s currently trying to find a golden fish in the pond near Holger’s house.

name: Fine Fishing VII
text: Thomas still hasn’t caught a single golden fish. Clearly he needs your help now, more than ever. Plus, his client’s appetite for golden fish is growing. His client won’t eat anything else now. Will you try your luck with the ocean?

name: Fine Fishing VIII
text: Thomas isn’t sure if the legendary Lake Minerva actually exists, but if you know a way to fish there, Thomas would love to offer his client an exotic golden fish from Lake Minerva.

name: Fine Fishing IX
text: Thomas has a new idea to make his client happy. What if he brings his client some golden coral! Then, his client will be constantly reminded of Thomas and the delicious fish he provides. Will you bring Thomas some gold coral?

name: Find A Way I
text:
Captain Thomas has a new plan for finding a way back to his homeworld!

On his homeworld, there is a large island out in the open ocean. He has often gone there to catch fish. In your world, the same island doesn’t exist.

Last night, Captain Thomas was visiting Captain Logan, one of the charter boat captains. Captain Logan told him about your world’s Thomas finding a hidden island. Captain Logan also mentioned that Thomas gave you access to the island.

If you would be willing to take Captain Thomas to this strange island, he would gladly pay you for the time. He’ll also equip you to catch loads of fish while you’re there. Will you take Captain Thomas to the large island?

name: Punkin Chunkin Trebuchet
text: George may not be a soldier anymore, but he loves heavy artillery. Nothing would scratch that itch like building a giant Pumpkin Chunking Trebuchet. Can you help an old soldier relive his glory days?

name: Find A Way II
text:
Captain Thomas can’t believe this. After exploring and fishing for hours, he is certain that this island is exactly like the large island of his homeworld. He doesn’t understand why it doesn’t fully exist in your world, but he thinks it may hold a clue to help him to get back home.

Captain Thomas needs to stay on the island on a little longer. Will you help him find a way to stay, even when you leave?

name: Find A Way III
text: Captain Thomas is going to stay on the island a little longer. He can’t leave until he finds something to help him. Will you help him set up a permanent place to stay?

name: Find A Way IV
text: Captain Thomas almost has a decent shack built. Will you bring him some more building supplies?

name: Find A Way V
text: Captain Thomas wants to stock his shack with food for his time on the island. Will you help him get a supply of food to last him several weeks? He'll catch his own fish, but he'll need a variety of other food items.

name: Find A Way VI
text: Captain Thomas wants to do some exploring all over the island at night. Will you bring him a load of lanterns he can place all over the island?

name: Find A Way VII
text: This request will sound very odd, but Captain Thomas needs two hourglasses and some sand from the mainland.

name: Find A Way VIII
text:
Captain Thomas discovered something very strange.

One day he was digging through the sand as the sun was about to set. Right as the sun set, Captain Thomas dropped the sand that was in his hand. Instead of falling straight down, the sand remained in the air for several seconds. It was at least long enough for Captain Thomas to get down on his knees and pinch a grain of sand out of the air.

That's why Captain Thomas needed the hourglasses and the sand from the mainland. He wanted to experiment to see if it would happen again, and he wanted to see if it would happen to sand from the mainland.

The sand from the mainland behaved completely normally in all of Captain Thomas' experiments. The sand from the island behaved completely abnormally at sunset, even inside the hourglass.

Now, Captain Thomas wants to try making some glass from the island's sand. Will you help him get the resources for building and using a kiln and a bellows? He'll also need some additional materials to help him make the glass.

name: Find A Way IX
text:
Captain Thomas successfully made glass. He also successfully tested the glass. It behaves just like the sand right after sunset.

Captain Thomas also made a new discovery. One day he was walking around the island with an orb of the glass that he made. He was looking to see if there were any reactions to the glass from other things on the island. Captain Thomas reached the eastern edge of the island a few minutes before the sun came up. As he was walking along the beach he reached down and pulled up a handful of sand. The excess sand falling from his hand stopped falling and remained in the air until the sun appeared. Then, the sand fell to the ground like normal.

Captain Thomas brought some of the western shore sand back to his shack and started experimenting. He discovered that this sand behaved very much like the sand near Thomas' shack, but only right before dawn. He also discovered that the two sands don't mix. They repel each other.

With this new knowledge, Captain Thomas went to explore the middle of the island. Just as he expected, Captain Thomas found that there is a line across the center of the island that is completely devoid of sand.

Captain Thomas would like to make some more glass using sand from both sides of the island. Will you help him get more resources for making glass?

name: Find A Way X
text:
Captain Thomas didn't have much luck trying to combine the glass from the different sands together. It was like trying to combine oil and water, very hot water and very hot oil. Nevertheless, he did craft a neat hourglass filled with sand from both sides of the island. The hourglass doesn't keep time at all because the sands just stay suspended against the top and bottom, but it‘s fascinating to look at.

Now, Captain Thomas is out of ideas. The mystery of the island is fascinating, but Captain Thomas doesn't feel like he's making any progress toward getting home. He's going back to his fishing business for a while. He appreciates your help again and he's very sorry for wasting your time.

name: Find A Way XI
text:
Captain Thomas would like for you to come fishing with him. He finds that catching fish and enjoying the quiet and peace of nature with a friend helps him clear his head.

Also, in appreciation for your friendship, Captain Thomas wants you to have the hourglass he made. Hopefully, it will be a memento for you to remember him by when he finally makes it home.

name: Themed Crop Labels
text: George needs some signs to label his different crops. He would like something to fit the theme of his past occupation as a soldier. Can you round up some shields that would do the job?

name: Hoptimistic I
text: frank is feeling down after his series of pranks didn't go as planned. “Guess I caused all that rabble for nothin’, huh?”. He chomps down on a couple carrots. You tell him it’s not a big deal, but he doesn't seem convinced. He sulks in your chair, and a pile of carrot shavings starts to form below him. There has to be something you can do to cheer him up.

name: Strange Companions III
text:
A few days later, your home remains quiet and noticeably uninterrupted. Trips into town have felt tense and you have intentionally avoided speaking to Beatrix and Rosalie except in passing. After gathering the items for tea, you arrive at Rosalie’s home, ready to discuss the letter and what has her so anxious with Beatrix.
When you arrive, you’re surprised to find a third person sitting in a chair near Rosalie’s fireplace. Lorn greets you warmly and motions for you to join the group. Rosalie looks pensive, and Beatrix seems quiet and unreadable as ever. After sitting, the tense mood of the room becomes too much to bear, and Rosalie breaks the tension by suggesting tea.
The group prepare their tea, Beatrix adding some very odd ingredients to her tea in the process. After some time of small talk, the tension in the room again reaches palpable levels, and Lorn quietly draws the letter out of his pocket and says, “So, a peculiar gem?” Beatrix looks intently at Lorn, and for a moment, the fire seems to pulse in intensity, almost exactly at her pace of breathing, but you shake the feeling off as your imagination as Lorn continues, “I’ve heard many things about many various gems, but what do you all know about the power of gems?”
Rosalie blinks and gives Lorn an odd look, “Star hasn’t mentioned many things about gems, he seems to dislike a certain type, but I’ve never taken much notice to be honest.”
Before Lorn can reply, Beatrix in a crisp accent cuts him off, “Gems can hold many powers, they attune to the aether of the world, and some types have affinities towards elements and types of magic. For example, many of the elements attune to basic gems like rubies for fire, or emerald for earth. Using gems for magical enhancement is not a common art in the world any longer.”
Rosalie leans back looking surprised in her chair as what you now recognize as the voice of Geist speaks. Lorn takes a moment to process this information before continuing, “Indeed, I’ve heard similar stories about gems and magic, but there are some gems, some very peculiar, that seem to do things that defy a normal explanation.”
The fire in the room suddenly burns bright as Beatrix straightens and says, “I remember…fragments. A war! A gem! Pain! Loss…” 
Suddenly, Beatrix crumples to the ground as the fireplace loses intensity. Lorn and Rosalie rush to Beatrix’s aid. Her eyes open slightly, she looks directly at you and says, “I need rest…and the Flame Orb.”
Beatrix closes her eyes, and Lorn asks you to gather some items to help Beatrix regain her strength.

name: Strange Companions IV
text:
The town is quiet as you gather the materials as quickly as you can, an even harsher reminder of how many townsfolk no longer call the town their home. On the trip back to Rosalie’s house, several times you notice certain oddities around town. A home door ajar, blinds closed with windows open - at one point you swear you saw shadows that seemed to move even when you stood still. Hairs standing on end, you attempt to look casual as you head towards your destination. The sense of unease does not lift when you enter the house, instead worry and uncertainty are etched upon the faces of your friends. 
Lorn explains, “Beatrix needs more time to recover, but we’re worried that her instability could cause serious consequences if she were to transform in town. I suggest we bring her to your farm house before we give her the flame orb. Rosalie has volunteered to cast a spell of illusion on a cart that we can use to transport Beatrix back to your home with little suspicion.” 
Rosalie looks at you strangely, “Did you know orange is a great color for illusions? The more it moves the more it stops the illusion from distorting my aether matrix. That said, Beatrix has a very unique aura owing to her unique circumstances, I’m going to need a lot more orange things than I normally would to make sure this spell works.”

name: Strange Companions V
text:
Under the cover of darkness, the four of you trek back to your farmhouse, Rosalie’s face scrunched in concentration, muttering something incomprehensible under her breath, while you and Lorn attempt to talk casually while keeping lookout.
After arriving at the farmhouse, you still can’t shake the feeling that you’re being watched, but you have no proof to bring to the group.
The next morning, Beatrix seems to have recovered from collapsing, she thanks you all for your care and assures you that she is fine. After a moment, a tear streaks down her face, “It feels so good to be among people that care, and to not be an outcast. If you’d allow me this morning to recover, I will tell you a story.”
Lorn pulls you aside and suggests you all spend your morning going about your normal tasks and you can reconvene at lunch. As it happens, he was hoping you could pick up some items for him and a friend while you’re in town. It’s a rather odd list.

name: Strange Companions VI
text:
When you get back to the farmhouse, Beatrix is resting comfortably, and Rosalie continues to pace while pensive and impatient. Lorn arrives and begins smoking a pipe, his presence of calm and serenity have an immediate soothing impact to your frayed nerves. Rosalie steps out of the other room, and upon seeing Lorn mentions how thankful she is to him for helping restock some of her other magic supplies.
“On the contrary, our dear friend here found most of the goods for you, but I did add a little something special for you myself.” Lorn replies. He winks slyly to Rosalie before settling into a chair. 
After putting some tea on, Beatrix sits down and invites you all to listen to her tale. She puts a hand on the flame orb and the orb emits a searing light and the words seem to rush out of Beatrix. 

“Many years ago, dragons and humans lived in relative peace. Magic was abundant in the land, and tribes grew up around different wizarding traditions. I grew up in such a tribe, but I was not born with any magical talent myself. Our family was well known, and one day, a man came to our tribe asking for help from wizards. Only later did they find out that there was a war between humans and dragons, and before we knew it, the war descended upon our tribe too. 
The wrath of the dragons was terrible, and despite my pleading with father, the wizarding tribes were upset at the slaughter of humans and fought back. Many, many dragons died, and many of my friends and family died too. During the worst of the fighting, a dragon soared overhead, pleading with everyone to stop fighting and I was caught up in their words. I followed the dragon many miles and found her pleading with her brethren to stop the fighting. Her words fell on deaf ears, but I was so encouraged that I revealed myself to her and that is how Geist and I became comrades. We rushed to another battlefield to plead to stop the fighting, but it fell on deaf ears. In the fighting, Geist was wounded by a mage who held strange powers, and in my grief I screamed and shouted for the fighting to stop, but it never did… they wouldn’t stop fighting. They wouldn’t listen! In that moment, I lost all hope for humanity and dragonkind and laid beside Geist, waiting for the death of the battlefield I knew was inevitable.”
Beatrix is now openly crying and Lorn puts a hand on her shoulder to comfort her. 
Lorn suggests you take a few minutes to let Beatrix regain her composure, and through tears, Beatrix suggests Geist tell you the rest of the story. She asks for some surf and turf, because she’ll likely be hungry anyways, and asks you all to step outside.

name: Hoptimistic II
text: The extra carrots seemed to help, at least for a few moments. frank hops to the floor to vacuum the carrot shavings up with his mouth. He tells you, between his chomps of dirty-floor-carrot bits, about how he’s never won anything before. “I just have rotten luck. Doesn’t matter how many ladders I walk under, how many mirrors I break, or how much salt I spill. Nothing helps.” You begin to wonder where frank learned about superstitions. He returns to self-loathing on your chair, upside down so his belly is shown. “uuUuUUUugghhhHHhhhhh”, he groans. His pale blue glow looks a bit duller than usual. Maybe something lucky will help frank. You leave some snacks behind, and set off to find some things that might bring frank some luck.

name: Hoptimistic III
text: frank is disappointed in what you brought. “You think a lousy 10 clovers is gonna fix ME? Have you SEEN ME? I AM A MESS!” frank sinks to the floor, flattening out like a pancake. He slinks to your pantry. “You’re out of carrots? OF COURSE YOU ARE.” You get the feeling that frank is being dramatic. He’s rolling around on the floor, mumbling to himself. You hesitantly leave him again to go ask someone for help on how to bring frank some good luck.

name: Hoptimistic IV
text: You’re not sure where to even start looking, so you go to Lorn for some help. Lorn seems pretty knowledgeable. You explain the situation, and he shakes his head. He explains that if frank’s luck is truly that bad, you’ll need some extremely lucky items to help. He suggests you invest in a quarry, if you haven’t yet, as Jade may help your cause. He thumbs through his vast collection of books and pulls out a leather bound diary. He scribbles some things down on a blank page, and sends you on your way.

name: Hoptimistic V
text: One of the things on Lorn’s list was Jade, but your quarry just isn’t producing it fast enough. You heard a rumor that the small spring has some hidden treasure chests that might be filled with precious gems.

name: Hoptimistic VI
text: You heed Lorn’s advice, and gather everything on his list. You go back home, and decide to just sort of pour everything on top of frank, who is now asleep in a puddle of his own drool on your floor.

name: Watermelon Eating Contest
text: Rosalie has asked you to help get the needed melons together for the annual Watermelon eating contest. She bought seeds to grow the melons herself, but didn't get them planted in time.

name: Hoptimistic VII
text: At first, nothing seems to happen. frank is snoring, and his drool puddle is getting to be a bit obnoxious. You go to look for something to clean his mess, and hear a loud whirring sound. You head back to the room frank was sleeping in, and all the items are gone, aside from the mushrooms. “Mushrooms aren’t very good for me. Too much fungus.” He looks like he’s back to normal, as he’s found another bundle of carrots to munch on. “Mind if I stay here for a while? You grow the best carrots, pal.” He doesn’t wait for an answer, and pulls a giant suitcase from your cupboard. You can tell something in his life has changed, but don’t want to press him right now. You don’t have the heart to tell him he can’t stay, and he’s already unpacking his things anyways. Who knew rabbits owned so much stuff?

name: Hoptimistic VIII
text: After frank settles in, he comes over to you with a red, fluffy item. “This was my great-great uncle billy’s. He always had the best luck.” frank pauses. “Or was it great-great uncle peter who had good luck...Well. Either way. I won’t be needing this anymore, since I’m cured, and by the looks of this place you could use it.” You can tell frank is trying to be nice, so you take the red rabbit’s foot. “Hey uh. If I need that back, you’ll still have it, right? It’s kind of a family heirloom, so please don't sell it.”

name: Love Is For The Horses I
text: Neigh! Neigh neigh neigh? Neigh neigh neigh neigh.

name: Love Is For The Horses II
text: Neigh! Neigh! Neigh?!

name: Love Is For The Horses III
text: Neigh neigh. Neigh?

name: Be Mine I
text: Holger needs some help. Making valentines for all of his friends and family is going to take more time than he has remaining before the day of love. Will you help him make some cards?

name: Be Mine II
text: Borgen was so busy this week that he completely forgot to make cards for the day of love. Will you make some cards for him to give out?

name: Be Mine III
text: Rosalie is trying to make valentines for as many people in town as she possibly can. She has made several thousand cards, so far. Now, she’s hoping she can enlist some of her friends to help make even more cards. Will you join Rosalie in making valentines?

name: Be Mine V
text: Vincent is looking for a gift for someone special, but he won’t say who his special person is. Will you bring him some fancy items he could give to his special friend?

name: Be Mine IV
text: Rosalie could still use some more help, if you’re interested.

name: Fire Brigade
text: George is in charge of making sure that the fire brigade is ready to put out any fires that this year's firework show might cause by accident. He needs a few more buckets to be ready to go. Can you help him out?

name: Be Mine VI
text: Jill wants to make some treats for her friends on Valentine’s Day. Will you help her get some additional ingredients?

name: Be Mine VII
text:
Thomas ordered an enormous shipment of heart-shaped necklaces. He was hoping to give them out for Valentine’s Day. Unfortunately, the boat carrying the shipment sank off the coast, near the small island.

A replacement shipment is already on its way, overland this time. Thomas hopes it will arrive quickly, but to be safe Thomas would like some cards to give out. Will you bring him some valentines?

name: Be Mine VIII
text: Rosalie needs another load of cards. Also, she would appreciate it if you could keep them coming. She is fairly certain she’ll need a few more loads.

name: Be Mine IX
text:
The replacement shipment Thomas was expecting ran into some trouble. The wagon driver said that he accidentally ran the wagon a little too close to the edge of a cliff along Cane Pole Ridge. Thomas was told that the shipment tumbled and threw its contents all long the floor of the ridge.

Will you help Thomas recover some of his lost necklaces?

name: Be Mine X
text: If you’ll bring Rosalie one more big load of cards, she thinks she’ll be able to handle the rest.

name: Be Mine XI
text: Will you help Thomas recover some more necklaces? He has a prized possession that he was saving for his cat, but he will gladly give it to you, if you can help him.

name: TRU3 70V3 I
text: ROOMBA cleaned up most of the wreckage in Cane Pole Ridge. If you will provide ROOMBA some corn he should be able to sort all of the heart necklaces out for you.

name: TRU3 70V3 II
text: ROOMBA cleaned up the shipwreck near the small island. If you will provide him with some corn, he should be able to sort out the heart necklaces for you.

name: Better Late Than Never I
text: Beatrix had a pretty rough week and forgot to get her valentines. Will you get her some cards to send out? She’d rather be late than to make anyone feel she forgot them entirely.

name: Better Late Than Never II
text: Star tried with all his power to get back in time for Valentine’s Day, but a dark force kept him rather entangled longer than he expected. And honestly, he thought he had 2 more days. Now, Star is going to need a hand to get caught up. Will you help him with a few things?

name: Mushroom Stew
text: They say all mushrooms are good. Some are only good once though. Holger trusts you know which ones are safe to eat though, and can be used to make enough mushroom stew for him to feed a large number of guests for his upcoming family reunion. He needs a few veggies for the stew too.

name: Better Late Than Never III
text: Thomas still ended up being short on heart necklaces for Valentine’s Day. Is there any chance you could hunt down a few more? He would still like to give them all out, even if it is a bit late.

name: Better Late Than Never IV
text: George would like to send everyone a bottle of wine that sent him a valentine. Will you help him get a couple hundred bottles?

name: A Way Back I
text: Captain Thomas has decided to take another shot at exploring the large island to try to find some way home. Will you help him get set back up to live on the island for a while?

name: A Way Back II
text: The shack that you helped Captain Thomas build seems to be untouched. Actually, Captain Thomas is extremely surprised at how undisturbed the shack is. The good news is that the shack is move-in ready. The only thing Captain Thomas will need is some food supplies. Will you help him get a supply of food for his stay?

name: A Way Back III
text: Captain Thomas would also like to have a substantial supply of bait for fishing. Will you help him get the bait and containers?

name: A Way Back IV
text:
Captain Thomas hasn’t found anything new.

Will you bring Captain Thomas a few more supplies?

name: A Way Back V
text:
Captain Thomas is finding nothing. He has no new insights. Everything on the island is the same as when he left. Captain Thomas isn’t sure how much longer he can do this.

Captain Thomas would appreciate some more supplies, if you don’t mind helping him.

name: A Way Back VI
text: Captain Thomas has discovered something. He needs more supplies to keep pursuing this new possibility.

name: A Way Back VII
text: Captain Thomas just needs more supplies.

name: Stinky Bait
text: Thomas read in a local newspaper article about puppy care that they like to eat stinky things. Fish probably like the same stuff as dogs, and if you camouflage it with the color green, they might think it is their normal food. He wants to try this out, convinced it is the secret bait he has been looking for.

name: A Way Back VIII
text: Captain Thomas appreciates your concern, but all he needs is more supplies and more time on the island. He’s going to FIND A WAY!!!

name: A Way Back IX
text: Captain Thomas can’t do it. He’s lost. Life is too hard. How did this happen? Why can’t he go home?

name: A Way Back X
text: What’s the point…

name: A Towering Investment I
text:
Cecil is looking for an investor to help with an archaeological excavation he is working on. He discovered an ancient tower buried deep underground several kilometers north of town. If his research is correct, this tower is filled with priceless treasure. If you will help him fund this project, he will give you a fair share of the treasure.

Will you invest in Cecil’s excavation project?

name: A Towering Investment II
text:
To help speed the excavation project, Cecil would like you to help provide food for the workers. The value of all the food you provide will go toward increasing your share of the treasure.

Will you help provide food for the workers?

name: A Towering Investment III
text: Cecil would like you to provide additional nutritional variety for the workers. As before, this will add to your share of the treasure.

name: A Towering Investment IV
text: Cecil thinks the food supply needs a few more things.

name: A Towering Investment V
text: Several workers were injured while excavating a section of the tower yesterday. Cecil would like you to increase your monetary investment to provide care for those injured, and to help hire additional workers. Will you invest more silver in Cecil’s project?

name: A Towering Investment VII
text: The tower is larger than Cecil’s initial analysis showed. The excavation is going to cost significantly more than Cecil planned. Will you increase your investment again?

name: A Towering Investment VI
text:
To help reduce costs, Cecil would like you to supply tools and materials for the workers to continue the excavation process. The value will be added as before to your share of the treasure.

Will you provide tools and materials?

name: Invasive Fish
text: Strange new fish have been spotted in the Ocean, at the Beach, and in Crystal River. Thomas thinks they might have been attracted to all of his experimental bait. He would like you to bring him a bunch of these new fish so that he can study what types of bait attract them the most. (Or maybe, so he can pretend that he caught them)

name: A Towering Investment VIII
text: The excavation project needs more tools and materials. Will you provide more supplies?

name: A Towering Investment IX
text: Cecil noticed that the workers need more food supplies. Will you continue to supply food for the workers?

name: Bons Temps I
text: Jill is trying to make some beaded necklaces to toss out at the parade today. Will you help her gather the supplies to make the necklaces?

name: Bons Temps II
text: Jill is ready to start making beads for the necklaces. Will you bring her some glass orbs?

name: Bons Temps III
text: Jill is ready to string up these beads. Will you bring her some twine?

name: Bons Temps IV
text: The necklaces are looking great. Jill added feathers to a few strands to fancy them up. She would like to make a few necklaces that are really fancy. Will you bring her some gems and some iron rings to attach the gems?

name: Bons Temps V
text:
Jill appreciates all of your help! The necklaces look really great.

Jill made a little something for you to wear to the parade today in appreciation for all your help.

name: Bons Temps VI
text: George would like to make some beaded necklaces for Jill to wear in the parade today. This will seem like a strange request, but instead of beads, George wants to make the necklaces out of corn. He wants the strings to be made from the silk and husks and the beads to be kernels of corn, and maybe a few whole cobs mixed into the strands. Will you give him a hand?

name: A Way Back XI
text:
Thomas doesn’t feel quite right. He first noticed it after using the broken mask when he was trying to get to the large island. His body felt strange, and every now and then he would just drop something he was holding. Hoping it was a simple cold, Thomas waited for his body to return to feeling normal, but he hasn’t gotten better.

Now, Thomas feels less normal than before. He drops things constantly, food loses its normal taste periodically, smells flash between normal and weird, and he’s started seeing things. At first, it was just flashes, but now he sees things that aren’t there, some normal things and some strange things.

Thomas has decided to take matters into his own hands and find a treatment that will help him get well. Will you help him with his first treatment idea? He’s going to take a slime bath.

name: A Way Back XII
text: Thomas has another treatment idea. He needs a lot of tomato juice and herbs for this one. Will you give him a hand getting the tomatoes and herbs?

name: Cosplay Costume
text: Jill would like to Cosplay as her D&D character, a Necromancer, at their next gaming session. Most of the materials she needs are pretty cheap, but she wants the prism shard earrings and emberstone at the top of her staff to be authentic. She also wants a sturdy box to store all of it in.

name: A Way Back XIII
text: Thomas thinks beet juice may be the answer, mixed with lemons and hops. Will you get him some beets, lemons, and hops?

name: A Way Back XV
text:
None of the treatments worked. Actually, most of them made Thomas feel a little worse. Now, he thinks it might be a bad idea to consume so much juice in such a short time.

Thomas still feels strange, and now he’s seeing things for longer periods of time. He heard that eating carrots and other vegetables is good for the eyes. Maybe he can eat more vegetables and at least fix his vision.

Will you bring Thomas some vegetables?

name: A Way Back XIV
text: Will you help Thomas get a load of apple cider? It’s his latest treatment idea. Nothing else has helped yet, but Thomas has a good feeling about this one.

name: A Towering Investment X
text: Cecil wants to add a little something extra to the workers’ diet. He thinks the magical properties of golden fish could really boost the speed of the excavation project. Will you bring a supply of different golden fish?

name: A Towering Investment XI
text:
The excavation team has reached the tower’s foundation! The excavation work is finished!

Unfortunately, there’s no way to open the doors to the tower. However, Cecil has an idea that should get the doors open.

On each level of the tower, the workers discovered an intricate and linked series of mechanisms. Cecil thinks that this machinery can be cleaned and repaired and set to working order. The unfortunate part of this plan is that it will require one more investment of silver to fund the repair work.

Will you invest in repairing the tower’s external mechanisms?

name: A Towering Investment XII
text: Cecil would like your help with another cost-saving measure for the tower project. If you will help supply parts for repairing the tower machinery, it will be a huge reduction in expenditure and time lost. As usual, your contributions will go toward your shares in the treasure.

name: A Towering Investment XIV
text: Some of the tower mechanisms require different stones and gems to function. Will you help Cecil gather the required resources?

name: A Towering Investment XV
text: Cecil found that more stones and gems are needed for the tower mechanisms. Will you bring the stones and gems needed?

name: A Towering Investment XVI
text: Cecil thinks the tower machinery is ready to be activated. Before attempting to activate the tower, Cecil would like to have an assortment of items available in case the mechanisms need some additional magical energy. Will you provide the needed items for an additional share in the tower treasure?

name: A Towering Investment XVII
text:
The doors to the tower are open!

Cecil has enlisted ROOMBA to do an initial exploration and cleaning of the tower. Will you bring corn to help power ROOMBA’s work?

name: Mystery Contraption I
text: Cecil is building something and needs some resources. He won't say what it is yet, but will pay in gold.

name: Flux Capacitor
text: Beatrix recently rewatched the classic "Back to the Future" films and had an epiphany. She thinks she might actually be able to build a real-life Flux Capacitor! But, doing so will require some very rare, rumored to be magical stones. Can you find what she is looking for?

name: A Towering Investment XVIII
text:
ROOMBA’s inspection of the tower is complete! The tower looks to be functional and safe, and surprisingly well preserved on the inside.

Cecil also went ahead and performed his own inspection of the tower, and gathered his share of the treasure. He hopes you do not mind him proceeding without you.

Cecil thinks the tower is now ready for your use. In fact, as thanks for your enormous and incredible investment, Cecil would like to turn over the stewardship of the tower to you. He will retain a small role in the management of the tower, but he will leave its normal use, exploration, and operations to you.

name: A Towering Investment XIII
text: The repairs are a little more difficult than expected. Will you invest more silver to help find and fund experts in machine repairs?

name: Irrational Numbers I
text: Holger is making a pie today. Will you help him gather some of the ingredients?

name: Irrational Numbers II
text: Will you bring Holger some apples to use in his pie? He also needs some iron to make a custom pie pan.

name: Irrational Numbers III
text: Holger grossly miscalculated how many apples he needs. Will you bring him some more apples? He also needs a few lemons.

name: Irrational Numbers III.14
text: Holger’s pie turned out great! He appreciates all your help. Happy Pi Day!

name: Green Initiative I
text: frank heard a rumor once about the luckiest carrots that come from soaking in green water. He’s determined to test this theory using the town’s river. He asks you to fetch him some water lilies and other supplies.

name: Green Initiative II
text: frank is getting hungry from watching all of your hard work. He’s only thinking in “green”, so he needs a green snack. He also asks you to make him some strong, sturdy boxes near the river, so he can oversee your progress and ensure everything is organized. He needs two boxes to be stacked, so he can watch everything “at an optimal height”. He hops away to go find some of his friends to watch his experiment.

name: Green Initiative III
text: frank watches as you gather the various items he requested, and you place them in piles along the riverside. You hear a very soft rumble, and it’s heading your way. You look over, and at least 100 bunnies are hopping towards the river. frank hops down from his watchtower, and greets them. “Glad you could make it!” You feel a bit uneasy with so many beady eyes staring at you.

name: Green Initiative IV
text: As you finish gathering all of the things frank has asked for, you watch as his friends start taking everything. They’re more organized than you’d have thought. Impressed, you watch them meticulously place each item around and in the river. Once they are finished, the river does seem to be sparkling with a greener tint than usual.

name: Big Boom V
text: Beatrix finally launched the greatest fireworks display this town has ever seen, but now she has a big mess to clean up. If you can give her a hand one more time, she'd like to give you a big reward for all of your help.

name: Green Initiative V
text: frank doesn’t seem satisfied, as he hasn’t noticed his carrots tasting differently after soaking them in the river. “Must not be green enough.” He sends you off to fetch another batch of green materials, and another snack for him.

name: Green Initiative VI
text: You’ve been curious as to how frank intends to move some of these larger items, since he has not asked you to help with that. As you return with another bucket full of emeralds, you see 50 rabbits pulling a rope, attached to a pine tree tied to a plank of wood. You can’t understand them, because they’re rabbits, but one of them must have said something frank didn’t like. You overhear frank calling one of them “lazy”. You shake your head and get back to gathering things.

name: Green Initiative VII
text: “It’s gotta be the water itself. It’s not green water, so that has to be why it isn’t working.” frank demands green dye, and assures you it’s safe. “I used to drink that stuff all the time, in my youth.”

name: Green Initiative VIII
text: The river is slowly becoming greener. frank seems a little crazed at this point, and he’s saying everyone needs to be wearing green for this to work. You can’t stop now.

name: Green Initiative IX
text: frank asks you to pour in the last of the green dyes, while his friends scurry to place everything else around. As the last drop of dye hits the water, a huge gust of wind blows by. A few bunnies tumble over. The green water shimmers, and frank dips his carrots in for the final test.

name: Green Initiative X
text: The green water is glowing, and frank dips his carrots in for the final test. His carrots come out, and they’re a shimmering gold! You notice a bubbling spot, right in the center of the river. frank’s friends notice it as well, and retrieve it. It looks like a cauldron, and it’s filled with gold! “Gold? What am I going to do with gold? I can’t eat that.” He offers it to you, though he’s confused about what you would use it for. “If you can’t eat it, sleep on it, or play with it, what’s it good for?”

name: Ends Of The Rainbow
text: Leafy has a pot of gold for you, if you can prove you have found both ends of his rainbow.

name: A Way Back XVI
text:
Thomas feels a little more healthy after all of those vegetables, but his symptoms have not diminished. He sees things that aren’t actually there all the time now. There’s one especially unsettling thing that he always sees on the eastern horizon. It looks like a second sun that is rising, but it never actually rises. It just sits there glowing.

Thomas wants to go and try to find the location of this second sun. Will you bring him some supplies and come with him to the large island?

name: A Way Back XVII
text:
The second sun that Thomas can see is brighter from the vantage point of the large island, but it is still far away on the horizon. He’s going to need a bigger boat to reach it that far out in the open seas.

Will you help Thomas start gathering materials to build a vessel worthy of the open seas?

name: A Way Back XVIII
text: While you were gathering materials for the ship, Thomas stumbled upon Captain Thomas passed out on the beach. Will you bring some food and drink to revive the good captain?

name: Dice for a Fireball
text: Jill's Cosplay Costume was a huge success at her last D&D session. However, when she went to cast a fireball spell, she found that she didn't have enough six-sided dice in her collection to roll them all at once for the spell. She would like you to find some fashionable dice that match her costume's theme. She would also like a nice new bag to carry them in, so that she doesn't lose any by mistake.

name: A Way Back XIX
text:
Captain Thomas doesn’t want anything to do with this trip that Thomas is planning, but he also doesn’t want to see anyone get hurt. So, Captain Thomas will guide the construction of the boat until he’s feeling better. Captain Thomas hopes all the hard work will get Thomas to give up and go home anyway.

Will you help gather more materials for the ship?

name: A Way Back XX
text:
Captain Thomas is feeling a little better and is going to help a little with the work. He can’t bear to sit and watch Thomas keep bungling simple tasks.

Captain Thomas thinks they almost have all the materials they need for the ship. Will you bring the last items, and a few replacements for the parts that Thomas mangled?

name: Fooled I
text: Buddy would like to play a prank on his very dear friend, Vincent. For the prank, Buddy wants to make ice cream that looks great, but tastes terrible. Will you help Buddy get the ingredients he needs to make the prank ice cream?

name: Fooled II
text: The next ingredient Buddy needs is eggs. Will you help him get some eggs?

name: Fooled III
text: Buddy is now ready for the secret ingredient to make the ice cream taste terrible. Will you bring Buddy some orange juice?

name: Fooled V
text: Buddy’s prank went perfectly! Vincent was hesitant to eat the ice cream at first. Then, he smiled politely, said it was good, and finished the entire bowl. Vincent even asked for a little more. Buddy appreciates your help on this successful prank.

name: Fooled IV
text: Buddy forgot that he needs ice to make ice cream! Do you have anything he could use to freeze his ice cream?

name: Eggstremely Valuable I
text:
Many times during his travels, Vincent heard tales of people finding decorated eggs hidden in strange places. The eggs were similar in size and heft to normal chicken eggs, but they were decorated with colors and designs. The eggs also seemed to be completely indestructible, at least the one Vincent saw couldn’t be cracked.

These decorated eggs always appeared in the early spring, and many of the legends said there were only 12 eggs that could be found. When spring ended, the eggs vanished until the following year. Then, the eggs reappeared, hidden in new locations.

A few of the legends spoke of a 13th golden egg that held vast powers or wealth or something like that. No one ever found the 13th egg in any of the stories.

Vincent would like you to keep an eye out this spring for mysteriously decorated eggs in strange places. If the two of you can find the 12 springtime eggs, maybe you can find the golden egg too. Vincent would be happy to evenly split any profit that could be made from the golden egg.

If you’re interested, just bring any strange eggs you find to Vincent to prove and secure.

name: Eggstremely Valuable II
text: Vincent hasn’t found any more eggs, yet. Have you?

name: Eggstremely Valuable III
text:
Vincent finds it strange that you have found 2 eggs and he has found none.

Have you found more eggs?

name: Grill Party
text: George has a party planned, but his grill wasn't properly maintained, and he wasn't able to cook up any of his fancy kabobs to feed his guests. Can you help him out in a pinch? (Hint: Visit the Steak Market in town)

name: Eggstremely Valuable IV
text: Any more good fortune?

name: Eggstremely Valuable V
text:
Vincent still hasn’t found a single egg.

You clearly have the better luck. Have you found another egg?

name: Eggstremely Valuable VI
text:
If you continue to find all the eggs, Vincent thinks his share of the profit may have to be revised downward.

Did you find another egg?

name: Eggstremely Valuable VII
text:
Vincent finds his lack of success at finding eggs to be very disturbing.

What do you have?

name: Eggstremely Valuable VIII
text:
Vincent wonders what the odds are that he can find a single egg.

Which one did you find?

name: Strange Companions VII
text:
Before you can step outside, Beatrix asks you all to wait a few moments while she goes ahead. After several seconds, you all step outside and see what you can only believe to be a dragon. Geist dwarfs your home, and she’s more majestic than a mountain. As she lowers her head to address you, flame crackles from her nose and a different fire burns in her eyes. It can only be described as sheer intelligent determination.

“Greetings, I am Geist, and I owe you my unending thanks and gratitude for your care and friendship of my dear friend Beatrix. Rest assured that she is well and unharmed. This has been a traumatic several weeks for her, and I hope to ease her pain by telling you the rest of our story. I know you don't know me, but I know you all very well, as well as Beatrix herself does. Our shared memories make you all so familiar to me, I apologize if I address you all as if I've known you for years, because, you see, I have.

In that moment, so long ago, when Beatrix laid herself down beside me, I wept for the state of the world, for the wars and hatred that even I did not understand. To see so small a human laid low in empathy broke my heart, and it was in that moment of sadness and desperation to not see the world torn apart that something deep inside me changed. As I bled out from my strange wound, I blacked out, and when I came to, I was not me, but I was a part of Beatrix, and she was a part of me.

We eventually learned that only one of us could manifest at once, and through our experiences, Beatrix became so despondent that the only thing I could do for my dear friend was lock our memories away and give her a fresh start in a small village to live our life as normal as possible.

I tell you this, because I believe the injustices we have seen Ric impose on our small town are as cruel as we have ever witnessed, and we know the loss and pain of friend and family. I want to help so I offer you this, the knowledge I have of the peculiar gem. Indeed, I have heard of it and I know it has power that neither Beatrix nor I understand. It seems crucial to understand why Star might have mentioned it now, and together we should seek this item out.”

The group stands around for a moment, deep in thought, when Lorn breaks the silence, “I have heard of this peculiar gem from travelers before, passed down by generations, its value incalculable to anyone. It seems to me the best path forward would be to speak with our resident collector, Cecil, mayhap he has heard of this gem, or has acquired it himself? I have no other leads to offer at this time, unfortunately.”
Everyone agrees this seems like a reasonable first step, and the group decide it best to bring Cecil an offering of goodwill, knowing he is more open to talking about his collection when he’s adding to it.

name: Strange Companions VIII
text:
