As a group, it is decided that you and Rosalie are best suited to see Cecil, so you head off to town with your goods, and make your way through town. Cecil’s house is an oddity, older than many other homes in the town, but it has always seemed to come through tragedy untouched and looking quite pristine.

Rosalie knocks on Cecil’s door and at first, there is no answer. A few moments later, the large front door opens slowly, and Cecil appears with an annoyed look on his face. His eyes quickly flit to Rosalie and before she says anything, he looks to you and says quietly, “You may enter. The mage’s pupil is not allowed in under any circumstance. These are my terms.” His eyes look like they will brook no argument and Rosalie gives you a quizzical look before stepping away from the door.

Cecil opens the door wider and allows you inside. The majesty and size of his home is not lost on you in that moment, as the door opens to a great hallway full of trinkets and baubles that distract the eye and glitter in unique and fascinating ways. Cecil walks you to a room you’ve never been in before and your eyes are drawn to even more trinkets and the energy core you brought back from Romuska, placed on a mantle in a base overseeing the room. You notice a kind of black cord coming down the side of the mantle but before you can figure out where it goes, Cecil interrupts your reverie by coughing gently.

“I know why you’re here, and I need your help. You see, Ric has been asking me for more and more money lately to fund his operation. Obviously, money is easy to come by, but I need to replenish my collection of items I sell to various vendors. In return, I will tell you what I know.”

You see no other avenue forward, and Cecil hands you a list of items he wants you to acquire. It’s strangely similar to items Rosalie and Star have asked you for in the past.

name: Strange Companions IX
text:
Your task completed, Cecil greedily eyes the items and proceeds to stuff them all into a bag in the hallway, his eyes never watching where his hands move, he begins to gush to you,
“Thank you! Finding some of these things are super difficult and you wouldn’t believe how useful and valuable some of these items are! Could you help me out with a few more items?”

He hands you a second list as suspicious as the first and pushes you out the door before you can get a word in edgewise.

name: Strange Companions X
text:
When you return to Cecil’s house, he is positively beaming as you hand him the items. He carefully takes a ring off his finger and puts a new ring on before putting the rest in the same bag by the door. Curiously, he begins to wave you inside and suddenly his eyes turn cold.

“Get out! If you mention any of this to Ric I will tell him about the peculiar gem and Beatrix both! I never want to see that mage’s pupil or you around here again!”

You turn away, seeing Rosalie standing off in the distance to your left trying her best to look innocuous, but failing miserably. As you step away from Cecil’s house, you glimpse a silver silhouette in the distance but struggle to identify the person.

Rosalie approaches you as you head towards the farm and apologizes profusely, “I’m sorry, I was just so worried about Star and Cecil was acting so strange I was trying to hear what was being said with a listening spell…”

Rosalie sniffles a little and you suggest some tea at Rosalie’s house to calm everyone’s nerves after the abrupt change in afternoon.

name: Eggstremely Valuable IX
text:
Vincent is prepared to now accept a smaller percentage of the profit made from selling the eggs. He thinks his share should be equivalent to the percentage of the eggs he finds plus 5%, for coming up with the idea. He still hasn’t found any eggs, but he’s still searching.

How is your search going?

name: A Cog In The Wheel
text:
Beatrix has a water wheel power generator that has lost a few cogs. Can you round up some spare parts for her, while she cleans out the muck caught in the stationary wheel?

Hint: The missing Cogwheels may have washed downstream into the small pond. It has a drop rate of 1/1000, so will take some time to get, but keep trying!

name: Eggstremely Valuable X
text:
Vincent’s chances of finding an egg are really slim now. Even though it’s a bit depressing to be so thoroughly defeated at searching for eggs, Vincent is completely amazed to see these legends turning out to be true. It may be enough to just have his curiosity satisfied. Nevertheless, he’s not giving up his search.

Have you found a new egg?

name: Eggstremely Valuable XI
text:
Vincent can’t wait to see all 12 eggs now. You’re so close!

Will you continue and finish the search?

name: Eggstremely Valuable XII
text:
Vincent hopes the legend of the golden egg is true. Even if you find it, Vincent just wants to see it.

Did you find the last decorated egg?

name: Eggstremely Valuable XIII
text:
You’re not going to believe this! Vincent found the golden egg!

He put all of the 12 decorated eggs together on a plate and they began to glow a soft red glow. The eggs glowed for hours and did nothing else. Confused, Vincent picked up the plate of eggs and moved toward his table. The eggs started glowing a soft green, but turned red again when he put the plate down.

Vincent picked the plate up again and started walking outside. The eggs glowed green whenever he was moving and got brighter when he moved toward the highland hills. So, he kept walking with the eggs right up to the center of the hills.

Somewhere near the center of the hills, the eggs flashed like noonday sun. Vincent immediately stopped and sat down with the eggs while he waited for his eyes to readjust after the flash. When he finally looked around, Vincent saw something shiny in a knot of grass. It was the golden egg!

The decorated eggs stopped glowing after that flash, and nothing more happened when Vincent added the golden egg to the plate of decorated eggs. Whatever magic was at work in the eggs seems to be at rest now.

Now, Vincent doesn’t know what to do with the eggs. He would love to make some money from them, but he feels like it isn’t really earned for his part. He’s also plenty satisfied just seeing legends he heard come to life.

Vincent thinks you should take the eggs. He appreciates all your hard work and figures that you deserve the reward for your efforts.

name: Buddy Rabbit I
text: Buddy wants to join in the festive spirit everyone else in town seems to have, and has asked you to help him make a rabbit costume. He needs 100 feathers. You think that maybe he has never seen a rabbit before, and contemplate introducing him to frank, but realize that if you did, Buddy might want blue feathers instead.

name: Buddy Rabbit II
text: Apparently Buddy ran into frank in town, and now wants blue feathers to continue working on his rabbit costume, because of course he does. Will you bring Buddy 150 blue feathers?

name: Buddy Rabbit III
text: Buddy now understands that rabbits don't lay eggs, and would instead like a chicken costume. He would like you to bring him a couple hundred straw. You wonder, not for the first time, whether Buddy knows what anything actually looks like...

name: Buddy Rabbit IV
text: Buddy is almost set for his festivities. He now would like you to bring him 100 buckets, so that he can leave them full of goodies for people around town. This is, sadly, the least strange request from him this holiday, so you feel lucky that things haven't gotten weirder.

name: Eggstra Lucky I
text:
After turning that river green, frank feels luckier than ever, but he also feels a little strange. Every morning lately, he wakes up and finds himself hugging a decorated egg. The eggs appearing wouldn’t be a big deal if they were something that frank could eat, but these eggs aren’t really useful at all.

So, frank has been hiding these decorated, huggable eggs all over town, as a fun surprise for people that like decorated, huggable eggs. He meant to ask if you like decorated, huggable eggs, but he forgot.

If you’ll bring him some good eats, he’ll try to remember to give you the next decorated, huggable egg that he wakes up hugging.

name: Eggstra Lucky II
text: frank found another egg this morning and remembered that he promised it to you. Would you mind getting him some breakfast to fill the hole that giving up this huggable egg will create?

name: A Study of Color IV
text: There was so much green stuff, that George has a ton of paint and dye left over. Some of it could be yours if you help him stage his next work of art. Blue is the color of the day. Can you round up a few blue-ish objects for him to paint?

name: Buddy Rabbit VIII
text: Buddy says to really finish off his hoard, he needs some more green items, and more jewels. And a diamond. He also says he's very patient, so he will just need some coal, and he will try and make one himself. Well, that's a relief at least.

name: Buddy Rabbit VII
text: Buddy says his dragon costume is really coming along nicely. He thinks that it won't possibly be complete without the dragon's hoard of valuables. This seems eerily familiar for some reason...

name: Buddy Rabbit VI
text: Buddy now thinks that the best costume might be a dragon. Dragons lay eggs, right? He'd like some items to help him look like a dragon.

name: Buddy Rabbit V
text: Buddy thinks it would be a fun joke to leave a bucket of chum along with his bucket of goodies. You wondered when it was going to get weird, and apparently the answer is "now".

name: Buddy Rabbit IX
text: Buddy says his costume and buckets are perfect. He wants to make sure you are in on his gifts, and he hopes you'll be willing to help next time he gets a GREAT IDEA! He also might be confused about holidays...

name: Eggstra Lucky III
text:
frank only has one decorated, huggable egg left. He hasn’t woke up hugging an egg for days now.

He saved this last one because he couldn’t decide where to hide it. Do you want it? Would you be willing to make frank an amazing meal for it? frank means REALLY amazing.

name: Eggstra Lucky IV
text: frank would like a few more ingredients added to his amazing meal, if you don’t mind. It’s almost perfect, like a decorated, huggable egg.

name: Strange Companions XI
text:
After some tea, Lorn stops by and after you recount your dealings with Cecil, he suggests that you may need to do some digging about what has Cecil so spooked, and why he was requesting some suspicious items. You all agree to spend some time asking townsfolk about Cecil and anything strange they might have noticed happening in the town lately.

Rosalie suggests nothing puts people at ease quite like a housewarming gift, so you set about to make a few housewarming gift packages for the townsfolk for when you can ask them some questions.

name: Strange Companions XII
text:
Your gift baskets in hand, you head into town. As you step onto the main street, none other than Ric Ryph steps out from the nearest home, his armor gleaming in the sunlight. He sees you and gives you a strange grin before approaching you.

“Ah yes, a pleasure to see you out and about! I’ve noticed you’ve been spending a lot of time with many of the townsfolk recently. An admirable and good thing to do, why, one might even wonder if you were trying to gain public support!” He casts a significant look at your gift baskets.

“Anyways, Cecil mentioned to me that his silver flow had temporarily been interrupted and that he needed to get a few key pieces of his cashflow back and suggested you would graciously help the town out in its greatest need to defend against the loathsome dragon at his previously donated rate. If you wouldn’t mind, a double deposit, just to keep the town running smoothly and the guard paid, would be ever so appreciated.”

name: Uptime Dreamin I
text:
Neigh….

Charles pushes a card toward you.

“What’s the difference between a computational device and a horse?

A horse can get rid of its bugs…”

name: A Study of Color I
text: George is now relaxing, after his long career as a soldier. He would like to take up painting and would love some help collecting objects to paint for inspiration. He would like to focus on one color at a time. Can you help him round up some Purple objects to paint?

name: Uptime Dreamin II
text:
Neigh neigh neigh.

Charles pushes another card toward you.

“Thanks for your patience…

While the server was horsing around…”

name: Uptime Dreamin III
text:
Neigh neigh neigh, neigh.

Charles pushes another another card toward you.

Hopefully the servers will be more stable ;)

name: Uptime Dreamin IV
text: Charles hopes that the rest of the spring egg celebration goes well, without a hitch.

name: Eggstra Profits
text: Borgen heard there was really high demand for a certain item he was selling last week. He's pretty egg-cited to make a profit on this opportunity...

name: Strange Companions XIII
text:
Money in hand, you head to Ric’s house. Before you can knock, Ric opens the door and gives you a gracious handshake and takes the money from you.

“Thank you, friend. It’s contributions like these that let me know the work we’re doing in this town to make it safe from dragons is worth doing. This money will be extremely useful in the coming days to make safe the townsfolk all over this area. I see you still plan on visiting other townsfolk, well, if you want my advice, don’t trust anyone that won’t give you anything you want immediately.”

You leave, Ric’s words echoing in your ears. You decide the best approach is to talk to some of the townsfolk you are better acquainted with, and approach George’s home.

As luck would have it, George is sitting on his porch playing guitar and singing a song, you pause to listen before approaching him.

“I’d give anything

To be where you’re at

I’d do anything

To become what you are

It’s too late

I don’t have what it takes

I don’t have it

I don’t have it

So move on

I’m alright

I need to move on now

Cause I’m gonna be alright”

The melody catches your ear, haunting but pleasant. There’s a strange comfort in the words, and you give George a moment to finish his song before you approach him any further.

After handing him the gift basket, you ask him about Cecil and any strange occurrences in the town, and George shakes his head, he’s been focused on his music lately and hasn’t paid too much attention to more than he’s had to do for Ric, which are just standard dragon defense tactics. You thank George for his time and offer your thanks for the song.

name: Strange Companions XIV
text:
Walking down the street, you realize many of these homes are foreign to you. As you walk the impression you’re being watched once again settles over you, the sense of unease makes your hairs stand on end, and you resist the urge to break into a run. You look to the sides and though it’s the middle of the day, shadows seem to grow around the houses around you and specks of light glitters in the shadows, like tiny eyes, following your every move.
The sense of real danger starts to mount, you furtively glance left to right and where there was once sun lit homes you now see dark houses with windows that seem to have gone dark – you try to look away but you become entranced with one window, a view of something unfathomable brushes your mind and just as you begin to see flecks of blue a hand wraps around your shoulder and you stifle a scream of terror.

Thomas, fishing pole in one hand, smiles at you and gives you a strange look.

“Friend, you’re standing in the middle of the street perfectly still, are you okay?”

You blink, arms shaking, and the sun has returned to the sky. Thomas ushers you down a side street towards his home. After a few moments, you regain your composure enough to assure Thomas that you are fine and ask him about Cecil and strange happenings.

Thomas gives you a second strange look and breaks out in a belly laugh. “Oh, do you mean besides the dragon attack? Or Ric Ryph? Or perhaps you mean the fact that *I caught all these fish?!*” Thomas proudly shows you a drying rack with three trout.

“Fished ‘em myself! Maybe I’m not a lost cause afterall, eh?”

name: The Big Cleanup I
text:
As Lorn was walking through the woods near his home, he noticed that an area that usually floods during heavy rain was now dry and covered with trash. He suspects the trash all washed into that area from the stream that floods it.

That set Lorn to thinking. With all of the new folks moving into the area, there is likely a lot more trash being spread around. Before the population boom, it wasn’t hard to keep the woods and streams clean, but Lorn thinks it may take a little more mindful effort now.

Will you pitch in and help gather up some of the trash littered around the area?

name: The Big Cleanup II
text:
Lorn appreciates your help with the cleanup.

Now, Lorn thinks it would probably be good to spend a little time clearing some trash from the waterways too. Will you help?

name: A Way Back XXI
text:
Captain Thomas thinks the boat is ready to be tested on the open water. Unfortunately, he doesn’t think Thomas is quite ready to captain the boat on his own. So, Captain Thomas has decided to go and help Thomas on this voyage. Whatever is afflicting Thomas has made Captain Thomas curious. Maybe there’s really something to it, and maybe they’ll find something amazing in that distant glow.

Now, Captain Thomas needs your help to prepare for the voyage. He can’t captain the ship properly without cleaning himself up first. Will you help Captain Thomas get ready to command the ship?

name: A Way Back XXII
text:
Before they start testing the ship on the open water, Captain Thomas wants to christen the ship and give it a name. To properly name and christen the ship, Captain Thomas needs a bottle of wine and some paint.

To make a good, seaworthy paint to make sure the name stays on the ship, Captain Thomas will need your help getting some resources.

Will you get the things Captain Thomas needs to name and christen the ship?

name: A Study of Color II
text: George was really happy with his first painting and now wants to work on another color. Red is next on his list. Can you round up a slew of red objects to stage for his next masterpiece?

name: A Way Back XXIII
text:
Captain Thomas is ready to take the Sarafina out for some test voyages. He expects to have good fortune on the ship, since the bottle of wine busted on the hull of the Sarafina perfectly, even though Thomas stumbled a bit as he swung at the hull.

Will you start bringing coal and emberstone for the steam engine, so they can refuel it quickly after each test voyage?

name: A Way Back XXIV
text: The test voyages went really well, and Thomas performed his share of the duties surprisingly well, but Captain Thomas wants to improve a few issues he discovered with the Sarafina. Will you bring some more materials so the Thomases can make a few modifications to the ship?

name: A Way Back XXV
text:
Captain Thomas appreciates all of your hard work to help bring this beautiful ship to life. The Sarafina is ready. Captain Thomas thinks she’s a sound ship that will carry the Thomases safely to the glow in the east and home again. Her name definitely suits her, even if it does sting Captain Thomas a little.

Now, Captain Thomas has assigned Thomas the task of putting together a list of supplies for their voyage. Will you help him gather the supplies?

While Thomas is getting the list together, will you bring Captain Thomas a load of sunflowers? For long voyages like this, Captain Thomas loves to eat roasted and salted sunflower seeds.

name: A Way Back XXVI
text: Thomas put together two lists of food supplies for the voyage. Will you start on the first list while he checks the second list again?

name: A Way Back XXVII
text: Thomas finished the second list of food supplies. Will you gather the supplies he needs?

name: A Way Back XXVIII
text: Thomas also put together a list of miscellaneous things they might need during the voyage. Will you help gather the items on his list?

name: A Way Back XXIX
text: After discussing many possibilities with Captain Thomas, Thomas came up with another list of items they will need to map and explore whatever is waiting for them at the glow in the east. Will you help Thomas find these last few items?

name: A Way Back XXX
text: Captain Thomas would like to have an assortment of coins and gems for the voyage. He wants to be prepared in case there is an opportunity to barter for supplies, purchase help, or if they just need to buy their way out of a tight spot. They may not end up using any of these valuables, but Captain Thomas still wants a good supply. Will you bring him an assortment of coins and gems?

name: Performance Enhancing Grapes I
text:
Something unusual happened to the radishes that Beatrix was growing. She was strolling through her garden, drinking a glass of grape juice, when a thought suddenly popped into her head. The thought told her that she should pour some of the grape juice on the radishes. The thought felt familiar and kind, but Beatrix doesn’t remember ever pouring grape juice on still-growing crops. Beatrix started to dismiss the thought, but it came again, and it felt so comfortable. So, she poured a bit of the grape juice on her very freshly sprouted radishes. Instantly, the radish stems and leaves elongated to their full-grown height.

Beatrix carefully pulled a radish from the ground and examined it. The radish was fully grown and perfectly ripe! Beatrix couldn’t believe it. She pulled the rest of the radishes and all were alike, ripe and fully grown.

Beatrix is now tangled in curiosity. She wants to know more about this phenomenon. Will you help her experiment and learn more? Will you try some grape juice on your radishes?

name: Performance Enhancing Grapes II
text: Whenever you finish testing the grape juice, will you bring Beatrix some of the radishes from your experiment? Then, she would like you to try some grape juice on cucumbers.

name: Masked Delivery
text:
Rosalie is planning to host a fancy ball as a fundraiser charity event. She would like to have a pair of fancy masks to give away as a prize for one of the raffles. The masks she ordered, unfortunately, were lost during shipping, and now she hopes you can find something suitable to use in a pinch. Do you know where any masks might be found?
Hint: An ex-pirate hiding out in a small cave might have a few laying around. It has a drop rate of 1/1000, so will take some time to get, but keep trying!

name: Performance Enhancing Grapes III
text:
Beatrix continued experimenting with pouring grape juice on different crops. All of the different seeds she planted finished growing instantly when sprinkled with grape juice. Unfortunately, she discovered a negative effect on the soil if the grape juice was used more than two or three times. So, don’t overuse this method.

Will you bring Beatrix some of the cucumbers you grew with grape juice?

name: Performance Enhancing Grapes IV
text:
There doesn’t seem to be anything out of the ordinary with the cucumbers you brought to Beatrix. They appear to be fully grown and ripe, just like the radishes.

Beatrix appreciates your help with learning more about this strange phenomenon. Will you continue experimenting with using grape juice on your crops?

name: May The Horse Be With You I
text:
You decide to visit Charles Horsington III, who is asleep under a shady tree. He appears to be having a nightmare, as he is kicking his leg and whinnying softly. He startles himself awake, and sees you. He places a single feather in front of you.

“Neigh? Neigh neigh.”

You nod your head, and gather more feathers.

name: May The Horse Be With You II
text:
Star Meerif appears, sensing the gathering of feathers was meant for him. He sees Charles Horsington III and smiles warmly. “Hello there!”

“Neigh neigh. Neigh! NEIGH! …Neigh.”

Star nods his head. “I understand, and I will help you learn the ways of the horse.”

Star requests a strange letter from you, while he sets up his plan to help Charles feel more protected against whatever was in his bad dream.

name: May The Horse Be With You III
text: As you return with the letter for Star, you hear a familiar soft whinny. “He dozed off waiting for me to calculate the precise degree of altitude needed to properly conduct what I’m trying to accomplish. Please bring some apples.”

name: May The Horse Be With You IV
text:
The scent of a fresh, crisp apple wakes Charles from a deep sleep.

“Ah yes, the horse awakens.” Star chuckles to himself, as if he told a joke only he would understand.

“Neigh. Neigh neigh!”

Star casts a protection spell on Charles Horsington III. “This should do the trick.” Charles still looks worried, so Star offers him some advice. “The best defense against an enemy is to use their own terrain against them.” Star pats Charles Horsington III. “Take this advice, and you will do just fine.”

name: May The Horse Be With You V
text: frank sees you, and hops over. “I heard you helped ol’ Charlie get over his fear of cloaked desert creatures. Hearing him talk about his day gave me a really good idea.” He hands you 2 sealed letters to deliver.

name: May The Horse Be With You VI
text:
The letters are addressed “Thomas” and “C. Thomas”. Both of them are conveniently standing near the docks, so you deliver the letters. Thomas opens his letter, and reads it carefully. “He wants…sand? I don’t have any sand! Would you please find some for me, and bring it to frank? I owe him a favor so I can’t say no..”

Captain Thomas opens his letter, and tells you he has sand to offer, but is running low on rope, and would be willing to trade with you.

name: May The Horse Be With You VII
text:
You return with the sand, and surprisingly enough, Thomas and Captain Thomas are sitting with frank. You wonder why they didn’t just bring the sand here, themselves. frank tasks the Thomases with pouring sand in the shape of a feather in front of Star’s door. “Hey. Go knock on the door.”

You’ve learned not to question frank anymore, and knock on the door.

name: May The Horse Be With You VIII
text:
Star Meerif opens the door, and greets you. He takes a step out, and slips on the sand he failed to notice on the ground below him. This may very well be the only time one of frank’s pranks has been successful against Star Meerif.

"I don't like sand! It's coarse and rough and irritating… and it gets everywhere." He shakes some sand from his cloak, and sees frank rolling around and laughing. “Laugh it up, fuzzball!” As he stands up, he sees Thomas, then Captain Thomas. He looks back and forth between them, and blinks a few times. “This is getting out of hand. Since when are there TWO of them?”

Star quickly recomposes himself, and flicks his wrist to disperse the sand. He mutters a spell, and goes back inside.

frank has turned green, and his ears are pointing out sideways. His voice is…froggier than it normally is. “Got him good, this time I did.” He pauses. “Talking like this, why am I?”

name: A Study of Color III
text: Red was great, but George was after a new color now. Something very different than his last two paintings. Green is the color of the day now! Can you help gather several green objects for George to paint next?

name: 5 Times Tastier I
text:
As Holger was recently rummaging through Borgen’s wagon, he found a recipe that he thought was long lost. The recipe belonged to their father, and he got it somewhere far across the sea in some distant land. The recipe is for a dish that Holger loves at least five times more than any other food.

If you’ll help him get the ingredients, Holger will share with you a sample of this amazing recipe.

name: 5 Times Tastier II
text:
Holger noticed that the recipe makes enough to serve about four people. He’s not really satisfied with that number of servings. Fortunately, you brought enough peppers to make five times the recipe. So, Holger is going to make enough for twenty.

Will you bring him a load of onions now?

name: 5 Times Tastier III
text: Holger needs tomatoes now. Will you bring him a large load of tomatoes?

name: 5 Times Tastier IV
text: Now, Holger needs meat for the recipe. He knows that it is a big expense, but he promises that it will be worth your investment.

name: 5 Times Tastier V
text: Holger appreciates your incredible efforts to help bring this grand feast to his table, but he needs more help. Holger used all the corn he had available, but he still needs a lot more. Will you bring him a large load of corn?

name: Revenge Of The Fifth
text: Holger isn’t feeling well right now. He thinks he ate a few too many tacos. Will you give him something to help aid his digestive processes?

name: A Way Back XXXI
text:
Before he leaves to find the glow, Thomas would like to ask you for one more, enormous favor.

During these weeks of shipbuilding, Thomas found that if he stood in the center of the island, he almost felt normal again. He talked to Captain Thomas about it, and Captain Thomas told him about all the strange phenomena that he has observed. Captain Thomas also mentioned the hourglass he made with sand from this island that behaves much like the center area.

Will you lend Thomas the hourglass that Captain Thomas made? If it doesn’t have the same effect that the center of the island has on Thomas, he’ll give it right back. If it does help Thomas feel better, will you let him borrow it until he comes back from the glow?

name: A Way Back XXXII
text:
It works! Thomas feels a little more normal when he holds the center of the hourglass. So, he would like to take it along on this voyage, and return it to you as soon as he returns. Thomas is certain you can trust the quest to return him safely home with the hourglass.

Now friend, Thomas is very thankful for all of your help. He definitely could not have made it this far without you. You have helped him become a better person, in addition to all the other help you’ve given. Thomas would like you to accept this book as a small token of his thanks.

Thomas also hopes to have a great story for you when he returns. Maybe he’ll even catch a shark while he’s gone.

name: A Way Back XXXIII
text:
My friend,
By the time you get this letter, Thomas and I should be well out to sea and well on our way to find the glow. I’m sorry to leave this letter as my goodbye, instead of a face-to-face exchange. Goodbyes are tough and I wanted to make sure I got my words just right.

You are a true friend, and you’ve helped me without reservation since I landed on your world. Even when you saw me succumb to desperation, you continued to help me. I’ve also watched as you helped others, no matter what they needed. Your example is part of why I’m helping Thomas on this voyage. If I’m to be stuck on this world, I should make it a better place, just like you do. It would make my Sarafina proud too.

No more feeling sorry for myself. I have a friend in need.

Finally, I’m leaving this runestone in your care. It was in my pocket when I was pulled from my world. It appears to be one of a few that are unique to my universe. Please keep it safe until I return.

Your friend,
Captain Thomas

name: Giamics' Jubilee
text: Rosalie is planning the annual Giamics’ Jubilee, which celebrates the town’s founding, and its first mayor, Andrew Giamics. She thanks you for being so helpful to everyone in town in the short time you’ve lived here, and asks if you would be willing to help her gather some of the items she needs for the jubilee, while she continues planning. She promises to compensate you for your time and offers you a list of items she needs.

name: Wedding Feast
text: Rosalie is preparing the wedding feast for the mayor's daughter. She needs Blue Sea Bass for the entrees and Small Prawn for the appetizers. It's going to be a lot of food. Please help!

name: 20,000 Players!
text: Rosalie is planning the town's big celebration in honor of the incredible population growth this year. The town now has over 20 thousand residents. Rosalie wants to throw a huge party, but in order to make that happen she needs everyone to help. Bring all the items on your list and Rosalie has a big reward for your help.

name: Giamics' Jubilee II
text: Rosalie thanks you for bringing her supplies. She now wants to organize some party games everyone can play. She hands you another list, and uses the blue feathers you brought to cast a levitation spell. The barrels start shifting into neat, organized lines.

name: Giamics' Jubilee III
text: You’ve just finished dragging over the last batch of apples, and you hear Rosalie shout, “I still need a few more apples, please!” Now apples are floating through the air and plopping into the barrels. You’re impressed, and bring her more apples.

name: Giamics' Jubilee IV
text: Holger happens to walk by, and sees apples whizzing through the air. He offers Rosalie some assistance, and can not take his eyes off of the food flying by him. He’s been tasked to fill each barrel with water, and to build some wooden pieces that are needed for a new game, which Rosalie swears she absolutely came up with all on her own.

name: Giamics' Jubilee V
text: Rosalie informs you that some of the apples you gathered have mysteriously gone missing. You wonder if Holger might have anything to do with the disappearance, as a few apple cores can be seen around Holger’s workbench.

name: Giamics' Jubilee VI
text: After you share some words with Holger, he promises to not eat any more apples, until the celebration. He says that he is still hungry, and if you bring him something to eat it will help him remember his promise.

name: Giamics' Jubilee VII
text: Rosalie tells you that this celebration needs a little bit of magic to make it special. You look at the floating apples from her active levitation spell, and she shakes her head. “Not my magic.” She tasks you with finding Star Meerif, and hands you a sealed letter to give him. She tells you there’s a big, open clearing near the river, and that you can probably find him there.

name: Giamics' Jubilee VIII
text: You head to the clearing, and see nothing but emptiness, and a few scattered feathers. Trying to call for Star seems pointless, until you say you have a letter from Rosalie. Before your eyes, Star’s tower appears. He rushes out, and holds his hand out for the letter. He looks disheveled, and seems to be in a big hurry. You hand him the letter, and he runs back inside, mumbling something about "the penumbra of the equator." He and his tower are gone as quickly as they appeared.

name: Giamics' Jubilee IX
text: Rosalie would like to give a special job to frank, who told her earlier that he will be busy taking a nap. You find frank nestled in a pile of carrot tops, basking in the sun. Calling his name does not wake him up, nor does jostling him lightly. You decide to harvest some carrots, and chop them up very finely. You sprinkle the carrot shavings in a trail, leading to Rosalie, and wait.

name: Giamics' Jubilee X
text: After waiting for about three and a half minutes, you see frank vacuuming up the carrot bits, and as expected, he stops where you and Rosalie have been waiting. “Was that a trick to get me to come do something? I feel like that was a trick to get me to come do something.” Rosalie smiles, and pats frank. She asks you to bring her some more materials while she updates frank on his part in her celebration.

name: Giamics' Jubilee XI
text: You return, and frank is nowhere to be seen. Rosalie shows you a nearly complete stage. “No celebration is complete without music! We need lots of instruments!”

name: A New Town Hall
text: A new Mayor has been elected! Mayor-elect Pedro has asked Rosalie to head up the committee to build a new town hall. A lot of building supplies are needed, so everyone is being asked to pitch in.

name: Giamics' Jubilee XII
text: Rosalie needs some dye to add a splash of color to the festivities.

name: Giamics' Jubilee XIII
text:
Rosalie is baffled that she forgot such an integral part of the event: EGGS!
Nobody can quite remember when the tradition started, but the town’s celebration has always involved colorful eggs.

name: Giamics' Jubilee XIV
text: Rosalie needs more eggs, and wants to set up some stations to color the eggs.

name: Peaches For Free I
text:
As Borgen was exploring a marketplace in the Unincorporated Southern Arcagos, his hound Jax accidentally knocked over a bin filled with strange fruit. The fruit didn’t appear to be damaged or spoiled, but the bin completely emptied onto the ground. The farmer selling the strange fruit was absolutely distraught over the spill. As a fellow seller of fine goods, Borgen could relate. So, he reluctantly parted with some of his ancient coins to purchase the entire bin of fruit.

Now, according to the farmer, these peaches should be reaching the peak of ripeness in the next day or so. As they do, Borgen would like to get this new fruit out to several people to test the potential market for these “Peaches of the Unincorporated Southern Arcagos”.

Would you like to try a peach? If you like it, Borgen welcomes you to come back and buy a few more.

name: Jubilee Invitation
text: Rosalie is finally ready to send the invitations! She hands you sealed letters to give out to those who haven’t been involved in the set up, and asks you to create and bring each person a gift basket of things they like.

name: Jubilee Invitation II
text: “THANK YOU. I WILL ARRIVE AFTER I LOCATE MY LEFT SHOE.”

name: Jubilee Invitation III
text: You hand Lorn a neatly packed gift basket, and he thanks you. He will be attending.

name: Jubilee Invitation IV
text: Cecil is grateful you remembered his favorite things, and will be attending.

name: Jubilee Invitation V
text: You catch Borgen as he’s counting up his Ancient Coins, and hand him his basket. “Thank you! I can’t wait to see what Rosalie’s got planned this year!”

name: Jubilee Invitation VI
text: The basket for Beatrix will be shared with Geist, so you make sure there are things for both of them included. Beatrix thanks you, and tells you that Geist talks about your tea quite often. She says it is delicious and soothing.

name: Jubilee Invitation VII
text: Thomas is very excited, and immediately heads to the town square. He forgot to say thank you.

name: A Peg Leg
text: Buddy lost his peg leg. Can you find something he can use as a replacement?

name: Jubilee Invitation VIII
text: Captain Thomas appreciates the trouble you went through, but will not be attending. He looks a bit uncomfortable. He takes his gift basket, and heads back towards his boat.

name: Jubilee Invitation IX
text: “These will be a fine addition to my stash. Thank you. I will see you later!” You hope George is okay.

name: Jubilee Invitation X
text: Vincent accepts your gift basket, and hopes you will also be in attendance.

name: Jubilee Invitation XI
text: Jill is delighted with her gift basket. “I appreciate the thought! My silo is still running off of what you’ve given me before, but I’m sure I will find a use for this. I will see you at the jubilee!”

name: Jubilee Invitation XII
text: “NEIGH! Neigh neigh… NEIGH!” You assume this means he will be attending.

name: Jubilee Invitation XIII
text: You carefully carry Buddy’s gift basket to the cave, leave it outside, and walk away. You don’t want to be there when he uses those things.

name: Jubilee Invitation XIV
text: You crumple up the invitation addressed to the town’s Mayor. That situation is too messy to drag into such a joyous day. Nobody has to know… Right?

name: Jubilee Invitation XV
text: Rosalie thanks you for all your hard work, and hands you a gift basket. “I appreciate all you’ve done to help me, I hope you like your basket!”

name: Peaches For Free II
text: Borgen would like to offer you a special deal, if you enjoyed the peach and want a few more of them. Would you like some more peaches?

name: Ring King I
text:
One of George’s favorite foods is onion rings. For the past ten years he’s been perfecting a recipe that he created. Now, George thinks that it’s finally time to share his onion rings with the world.

During the big anniversary jubilee, George wants to set up a stand to sell his onion rings. While he’s setting up his stand, will you help him gather the ingredients he needs for the onion ring batter?

name: Ring King II
text: George is still getting his frying station ready. While he’s busy, will you get another ingredient for his onion ring batter?

name: Peaches For Free III
text:
Borgen took some of the peaches and attempted to make a few upgraded products to sell. Canned peaches worked pretty well, but it wasn’t different enough. Peach desserts, like pie and cobbler, are amazing, but too labor intensive. Then, Borgen had a breakthrough: peach juice!

Unfortunately, the peach juice has an unwanted side effect for a seller of fine goods like Borgen. It makes you invisible for a short duration after you drink it. Nevertheless, maybe you could find a use for this peach juice. Borgen would be happy to share it with you at a very reasonable price.

name: Welcome to your Farm
text:
Now that you have named your farm, and planted your first seeds, a friendly Neighbor comes to say hello. "Hello, new friend! I'll trade you one of those peppers for a handful of seeds.

After that, when you come back here, you will find that there are lots of people in town who could use your help and help teach you the ropes of running your old farm. Once these seeds grow, come back, and I'll have some more advice for you."

name: Ring King III
text: To keep the oil really hot for all of these onion rings, George is going to need a stable and strong fire. While he starts making his batter, will you bring a load of wood for the fire?

name: Ring King IV
text:
George is ready for the onions, but before you bring them, he wants to make sure that you know that they will make him cry. If seeing a grown man cry while cooking makes you uncomfortable, George understands. He won’t be offended if you drop off the onions and quickly leave.

Will you bring him as many onions as you can?

name: Ring King V
text: George appreciates all of your help with his onion rings stand. His onion rings cooked up perfectly, and everyone seems to love them! Would you like to try George’s onion rings?

name: Always Be Corn-ing I
text: Vincent thinks that the anniversary jubilee is the perfect time to sell some food and make some money. So, once again, Vincent is coming to you for assistance with setting up a stand in town. This time he has all the materials to set up the stand, but he needs your help getting the ingredients to make the corn kabobs that he wants to sell. To start, will you bring Vincent a load of mushrooms?

name: Always Be Corn-ing II
text: Vincent finished setting up his stand. Now, he’s ready for you to help him get more of the ingredients for his kabobs, while he gets his fire going and his grill prepared. Will you bring him a load of tomatoes?

name: Always Be Corn-ing IV
text: Vincent learned how to make these kabobs while he was working way out west, and he’s loved them ever since. They require a special combination of seasonings to make them really tasty. Unfortunately, Vincent is running low on one of the secret ingredients to make the seasoning. Will you bring him a load of sweet roots and be very discreet about it?

name: Always Be Corn-ing III
text: Vincent is now ready for the star of the corn kabobs. Will you bring him a large load of corn?

name: Always Be Corn-ing V
text: Once again, Vincent appreciates your help with his money-making endeavors. The corn kabobs are selling better than pine trees during the holidays.

name: Always Be Corn-ing VI
text: The corn kabobs are going fast. Now, Vincent is running low on corn. Will you bring him more corn?

name: Always Be Corn-ing VII
text: Vincent can’t keep up with the demand for his corn kabobs. He needs more of almost everything. Will you help him?

name: Lorn's Advice I
text: Lorn has come to check up on your progress. "Seems like you have the basics of planting down. You know where to buy seeds in town, and you can always sell your crops at the Farmer's Market. You can take this OJ to drink, and try exploring that small cave nearby. You might find something there to bring back to me?"

name: To Quench The Worst Thirst
text: Buddy is incredibly thirsty. He has a very special drink that he would like to make, and if he doesn’t drink it all, share with the town during the annual celebration. He will need some fruits for a lovely cool concoction. Will you bring him some fruit to start a batch?

name: To Quench The Worst Thirst II
text: Buddy says his drink is coming along well, but he needs something to store it in. Can you bring some bottles? He also says not to worry about the caterpillars he’s offering, and promises that they aren’t used in the drink in any way. He’s… probably telling the truth? Otherwise, he’d be keeping them to use them, not giving them away. Right?

name: To Quench The Worst Thirst III
text: Buddy believes the last thing he needs to perfect this drink is some tea leaves. If you bring some, he will share his drink with you.

name: To Quench The Worst Thirst IV
text: Buddy thinks he might be able to improve the blue spritz if he adds some things to help with the color. This doesn’t seem like something that anyone should be drinking...

name: To Quench The Worst Thirst V
text: Buddy is pretty sure that he’s getting close to the right color, but he needs some blue feathers to help boost it just a little more. Those definitely can’t be healthy to drink, can they?

name: To Quench The Worst Thirst VI
text: The color is almost perfect. Maybe some Moonstones might help get it just right?

name: To Quench The Worst Thirst VII
text: Blue gel is the last thing Buddy can think of that would help get the color just right. Can you bring some from Whispering Creek?

name: To Quench The Worst Thirst VIII
text: Buddy has decided that adding everything to his blue spritz really took away from the taste, so he’s keeping it just like it was. He’d like to give you some more as a thank you for helping him try everything out.

name: Intruders Beware I
text:
Holger usually doesn’t take anything when he sneaks into Borgen’s wagon. He also doesn’t usually break anything in Borgen’s collections. That’s why Holger is fairly certain that the model ship he stepped on, in Borgen’s wagon, was broken before he got there. Additionally, the crunch he heard when he stepped on the model sounded like something already broken, and not like a fresh break. It was more grind and snap than crunch and pop.

When Holger looked down to see the wreckage of the model ship, it was clear that the model was broken before he stepped on it. It was also clear that there was something stuffed inside the hull. Going against his normal tendency, Holger took the contents of the ship. Holger suspects that Borgen didn’t even know the map was jammed inside the model. So Borgen won’t miss it, but he will likely be very sore about the broken ship.

Will you help Holger put together a gift to make Borgen feel better about his broken model ship? Holger would like a gift for Borgen that will remind him of the sea, but maybe not boats.

name: Intruders Beware II
text:
Holger can’t figure out the map that he found in Borgen’s broken model ship. The writing on the map is in a language that Holger doesn’t recognize, but he thinks the map shows a maze of underground tunnels and how to navigate them. However, the entrances to the tunnels, at either end of the maze, are a mystery. Each entrance is drawn as a series of broken squiggles.

Holger has no idea what the squiggles could mean, but he isn’t ready to give up on this mystery. He thinks some food might help him think more clearly. Will you bring him some fish to fry and eat?

name: Lorn's Advice II
text: Did you find a Mushroom in the small cave? If so, Lorn has some more work for you. "You might have found some stone in that cave. You can use it, along with some Iron you can buy from the Country Store to make Iron Cups. That will help your crafting skill grow fast. Before you can craft, you need to build a Workshop on your farm. I'll loan you this silver to help with that. Here are some materials you can practice with. Bring me back the cups you make, and we will call it even."

name: Intruders Beware III
text:
Lorn found a load of wreckage washed up on the beach this morning. He thinks that the storm yesterday may have been unkind to some poor sailor, but Lorn hopes that it was an old wreck stirred up and not a new disaster. Many of the items in the wreckage look quite old. Perhaps Lorn’s hopes are not unfounded.

Lorn is gathering up the interesting and useful items among the wreckage to make them available at the Exchange Center. He has his wagon to carry everything, but he could use help loading and securing the items. Will you help Lorn? He’ll give you a couple of the more interesting and useful items as compensation.

name: Intruders Beware IV
text:
Holger hasn’t made any further progress on deciphering the map. He suspects that the entrance squiggles require a legend, or key of some sort, that isn’t on the map.

Since no solutions were presenting themselves, Holger hiked all over the area looking for anything that might be a clue. He was hoping that he would see something that might shake an idea loose in his brain and help him decipher those squiggles. Eventually, he ended up at the Exchange Center and started talking to Lorn about the map.

As Holger was drawing out some of the squiggles, Lorn had an epiphany. Lorn saw a coin once with very similar markings to one of the groups of squiggles. At first, Lorn thought he had one of the coins in the exchange center storeroom, but after searching for several minutes he couldn’t find a coin that matched what he remembered.

Since Lorn couldn’t find the coin, he tried to do a simple drawing of it. Holger has a general idea of what he’s looking for now. If you happen to come across a coin with a skull on it, will you bring it to Holger?

name: Intruders Beware V
text:
The coin fit with the squiggles on the map perfectly. There’s even some sort of resistance when Holger removes the coin from its spot on the map. It’s strange, but the coin and the map definitely belong together.

The image created by the map’s squiggles and the coin suggests a cove with a skull-shaped cave as the northern entrance to the maze. Holger’s never seen a place like that, but he remembers a bit of a story from Vincent. Vincent was trying to find a specific runestone to help him find a place called Pirate’s Cove. Maybe that’s the place on this map. Holger thinks it may be worth asking Vincent about.

While Holger talks to Vincent, will you find a runestone like the one Vincent wanted for finding Pirate’s Cove?

name: Intruders Beware VI
text:
Vincent wasn’t sure if Pirate’s Cove has a skull-shaped cave. He didn’t get a good look when he was there. Actually, Vincent didn’t want to talk about his time at Pirate’s Cove, but he did tell Holger that he was trying to use the runestone to find Pirate’s Cove.

Speaking of the runestone, Holger has great news! After he returned from talking to Vincent, he noticed that the backside of the runestone, that you found, was similar to the squiggles on the southern entrance on the map. So, he put the runestone face down on the map and lined it up with the squiggles. It fit perfectly! It also had a reaction like the coin, where it resists being removed from the map. Strangely, that resistance doesn’t happen with the runestone face up.

It took Holger a little while to recognize the image created by the runestone and the map, but he’s pretty sure that it’s the small cave not far from Lake Tempest.

Now, Holger wants to go explore the small cave and see if the map is correct. Will you help him prepare for exploring the cave?

name: Intruders Beware VII
text:
Holger found Buddy wandering around while he was exploring the small cave, and Buddy decided to join in the search for the tunnels. Oddly, Buddy knew a lot about the map and the tunnels. Buddy also mentioned that he knew Holger’s father a long time ago. Eventually, Buddy stopped and said that it was unsafe to go further. Holger would have continued, but Buddy seemed adamant.

While Holger was consulting the map to figure out a different path, Buddy warned Holger about pursuing any other options. Buddy explained that all of the tunnel entrances are lined with traps, very deadly ones. He also said that he had a tool to disable the traps, but that the pirate magic powering the traps has weakened over the years. Without stabilizing the pirate magic, the shutoff mechanism wouldn’t work.

Buddy suggested that Holger find a load of pirate artifacts and bring them to the cave. The artifacts will still have a little pirate magic in them that can be accumulated together and shared with the trap mechanisms. Then, Buddy can turn off the traps and let Holger through the tunnels.

Will you help Holger gather up old pirate artifacts?

name: Intruders Beware VIII
text:
Buddy double-crossed Holger. They got the pirate magic shared from the old artifacts to the trap mechanisms. Suddenly, the entire cave felt electric and Holger could hear gears turning and ropes pulling. It was like all of the traps were being reset. Then, out of nowhere Buddy laughed and vanished.

Holger considered trying his luck with the tunnels without Buddy. He even walked to the point where Buddy stopped during their first exploration of the cave. Then, Holger tossed one of his lanterns several meters into a tunnel. It landed on the tunnel floor and a giant boulder immediately fell from the ceiling. The boulder fell exactly where the lantern fell. At that, Holger decided to come home and have a nice meal.

Will you find Buddy and see if you can get him to turn the traps off in the cave? Maybe you could take Buddy a gift as reminder of your friendship.

name: Intruders Beware IX
text:
Buddy doesn’t think that Holger is ready for the treasures and truths that await him at the end of the tunnels. Pirate’s Cove has many secrets that Holger is too immature to understand. However, since you are one of Buddy’s best friends, Buddy will give you the key to disabling the tunnel traps, if you help Holger do one, very important good deed.

Buddy will trade you a powerful stone for a beautiful diamond as proof of your covenant.

name: Intruders Beware X
text: Holger isn’t sure what to think about this plan, or about Buddy’s judgment. Nevertheless, he has a perfect idea of what to do for the good deed. All he needs is a replacement model ship.

name: Intruders Beware XI
text:
Buddy is satisfied with Holger’s good deed. He thinks Holger and Borgen would make their father pretty proud if he was still around. Buddy wonders if it would be fun to tell Holger and Borgen that he is their father. That may be better left for a trek through the stars, or an intergalactic imperial incursion.

Buddy is glad to give you the key for shutting off the tunnel traps. However, he intends to keep protecting visitors that are exploring the small cave from running into the tunnels. He’ll stop everyone he finds in the cave and try to help them avoid unsafe areas.

Remember, to use the key, stick it in the skull mark on the floor between the tunnel entrance and the cave, and then turn it clockwise. Buddy loves the sound it makes when the traps disengage. He hopes you enjoy it too.

name: Lorn's Advice IV
text: With a yellow Perch in hand, Lorn is ready to get cooking! "Thanks for bringing me my dinner! I'll check in on you from time to time. You will find that many other townsfolk will show up as well, as your skills grow, with requests for help too. Being a good neighboor is important!"

name: Hold The Line I
text:
Star’s calculations and vast strategy may not be enough to hold back the Shadow if someone fails to do their part. So it is that Star finds himself coming to you on a universal Thursday to ask for assistance. It appears that the meticulously crafted barrier that Star engineered was compromised by a shift in the distribution of ethereal focusing scepters.

The undermining force appears to be the monetary value of the staff. Star has corrected this issue, but now he needs to correct both the architectural and logistical distribution. That’s where he needs your help.

Will you accept another mystical staff and keep it secret, and keep it safe, until Star or one of his duly authorized messengers calls for it?

name: Lorn's Advice III
text:
10 fancy iron cups are just what Lorn is looking for! "I'll take the cups, and call your debt paid. Next, have some bait, and then you can try your hand at fishing. How does that sound? Think you can catch a Yellow Perch for my dinner?

There are a few types of bait here that you can 'swap' between. Later, when you get your own trout farm, you can raise your own minnows and grubs. To fish, when you see a shadow, click on it. Then, click on the moving blue dot to reel it in. Some say it is best to wait for the dot to come to you."

name: Shark Week I
text: Thomas wants to catch a shark. He's going to try something different for bait. Will you bring him a shovel so he can dig up some new and different worms? He'll gladly give you all of the useless stuff he digs up as payment, and he'll return the shovel when he's done.

name: Shark Week II
text: Thomas did not catch a shark using worms. So, he would like to try something a little bigger for bait. He'll give you some stuff he found on the beach in exchange for some largemouth bass.
